dialogue_sentences: ["This is a Main Street tax cut, 15 percent across -- let's take a family making $30,000 a year, that's $1261.", "This economic package is about families but it's a six-point package.", "First of all, it's a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution which President Clinton defeated."]
dialogue: This is a Main Street tax cut, 15 percent across -- let's take a family making $30,000 a year, that's $1261. This economic package is about families but it's a six-point package. First of all, it's a balanced budget amendment to the Constitution which President Clinton defeated.
snippet_sentences: ['He twisted arms and got six Democrats to vote the other way, but we lost by one vote.']
snippet: He twisted arms and got six Democrats to vote the other way, but we lost by one vote.

dialogue_sentences: ["And it's also regulatory reform.", "It's a good package, Mr. President.", "We'd like to have your support."]
dialogue: And it's also regulatory reform. It's a good package, Mr. President. We'd like to have your support.
snippet_sentences: ["Well, here's the problem with it: It sounds very good, but there's a reason that 500 economists, including seven Nobel prize winners and business periodicals like Business Week, and even Senator Dole's friends, Senator Warren Rudman, former Republican senator from New Hampshire, says it's not a practical program."]
snippet: Well, here's the problem with it: It sounds very good, but there's a reason that 500 economists, including seven Nobel prize winners and business periodicals like Business Week, and even Senator Dole's friends, Senator Warren Rudman, former Republican senator from New Hampshire, says it's not a practical program.

dialogue_sentences: ['The Senator mentioned the trial lawyers.', "Now, a lot of the trial lawyers didn't want me to sign any bill at all, but I had thought we ought to do what we could to cut frivolous lawsuits, but they wouldn't make some of the changes that I thought should be made.", 'Now, let me just give you an example.']
dialogue: The Senator mentioned the trial lawyers. Now, a lot of the trial lawyers didn't want me to sign any bill at all, but I had thought we ought to do what we could to cut frivolous lawsuits, but they wouldn't make some of the changes that I thought should be made. Now, let me just give you an example.
snippet_sentences: ['I had a person in the Oval Office who lost a child in a school bus accident where a drunk driver caused the accident directly, but there were problems with the school bus.', 'The drunk driver had no money.', 'Under the new bill, if I had signed it, a person like that could never have had any recovery.', 'I thought that was wrong.']
snippet: I had a person in the Oval Office who lost a child in a school bus accident where a drunk driver caused the accident directly, but there were problems with the school bus. The drunk driver had no money. Under the new bill, if I had signed it, a person like that could never have had any recovery. I thought that was wrong.

dialogue_sentences: ['But let me respond to what you said.', 'I agree that too many incumbent politicians in Washington in both parties have consistently opposed campaign finance reform.', 'That was certainly the case from the minute I got there.']
dialogue: But let me respond to what you said. I agree that too many incumbent politicians in Washington in both parties have consistently opposed campaign finance reform. That was certainly the case from the minute I got there.
snippet_sentences: ['So after Speaker Gingrich and Senator Dole took over the Congress, I went to New Hampshire and a man suggested -- a gentleman that unfortunately just passed away a couple of days ago, suggested that we appoint a commission.', 'And I shook hands with him on it and I appointed my members, and the commission never met.']
snippet: So after Speaker Gingrich and Senator Dole took over the Congress, I went to New Hampshire and a man suggested -- a gentleman that unfortunately just passed away a couple of days ago, suggested that we appoint a commission. And I shook hands with him on it and I appointed my members, and the commission never met.

dialogue_sentences: ['And I hope we can finally get it in the next session of Congress, because we need it badly.', "Well, on campaign reform itself, we're going to get it when we have a bipartisan commission, take it out of politics.", "Get people who don't have any interest in politics but understand the issue and let them make the recommendation to Congress."]
dialogue: And I hope we can finally get it in the next session of Congress, because we need it badly. Well, on campaign reform itself, we're going to get it when we have a bipartisan commission, take it out of politics. Get people who don't have any interest in politics but understand the issue and let them make the recommendation to Congress.
snippet_sentences: ["Now, we're now kidding anybody, Mr. President.", 'Millions and millions of Americans.']
snippet: Now, we're now kidding anybody, Mr. President. Millions and millions of Americans.

dialogue_sentences: ["But we're lawyers, I like lawyers.", "I don't dislike trial lawyers.", "But it seemed to me there's got to be some end to the frivolous lawsuits and there's got to be some cap on punitive damage."]
dialogue: But we're lawyers, I like lawyers. I don't dislike trial lawyers. But it seemed to me there's got to be some end to the frivolous lawsuits and there's got to be some cap on punitive damage.
snippet_sentences: ["You're putting a lot of business people out of business.", 'I said that one day and Pat Moynihan, a Democrat, say, no, he said, in the history of the world.', 'So I modified it, the largest tax increase in the history of the world.']
snippet: You're putting a lot of business people out of business. I said that one day and Pat Moynihan, a Democrat, say, no, he said, in the history of the world. So I modified it, the largest tax increase in the history of the world.

dialogue_sentences: ["Get people who don't have any interest in politics but understand the issue and let them make the recommendation to Congress.", "Now, we're now kidding anybody, Mr. President.", 'Millions and millions of Americans.']
dialogue: Get people who don't have any interest in politics but understand the issue and let them make the recommendation to Congress. Now, we're now kidding anybody, Mr. President. Millions and millions of Americans.
snippet_sentences: ["They know the Republican Party hasn't done it.", "They know the Democratic party won't do it.", 'We ought to agree that somebody else should do it.']
snippet: They know the Republican Party hasn't done it. They know the Democratic party won't do it. We ought to agree that somebody else should do it.

dialogue_sentences: ["You didn't do that with Mr. with President Bush in 1992.", 'Let me say, first of all, I signed a tort reform bill that dealt with civilian aviation a couple of years ago.', 'I proved that I will sign reasonable tort reform.']
dialogue: You didn't do that with Mr. with President Bush in 1992. Let me say, first of all, I signed a tort reform bill that dealt with civilian aviation a couple of years ago. I proved that I will sign reasonable tort reform.
snippet_sentences: ["Secondly, Senator Dole had some pretty harsh comments about special interest money, but it wasn't me who opposed what we tried to do to save the lives of children who were subject to tobacco and then went to the tobacco growers and bragged about standing up for the Federal government when we tried to stop the advertising, marketing, and sales of tobacco to children.", "And it wasn't me that let the polluters actually come into the halls of Congress, into the rooms, and rewrite the environmental laws.", "That's what Speaker Gingrich and Senator Dole did, not me."]
snippet: Secondly, Senator Dole had some pretty harsh comments about special interest money, but it wasn't me who opposed what we tried to do to save the lives of children who were subject to tobacco and then went to the tobacco growers and bragged about standing up for the Federal government when we tried to stop the advertising, marketing, and sales of tobacco to children. And it wasn't me that let the polluters actually come into the halls of Congress, into the rooms, and rewrite the environmental laws. That's what Speaker Gingrich and Senator Dole did, not me.

dialogue_sentences: ["It wasn't until election year, Mr. President, that you ever thought about stopping smoking.", 'What about drugs that have increased, doubled in the last 44 months?', 'Cocaine is up 141 percent -- marijuana, cocaine up 166 percent.']
dialogue: It wasn't until election year, Mr. President, that you ever thought about stopping smoking. What about drugs that have increased, doubled in the last 44 months? Cocaine is up 141 percent -- marijuana, cocaine up 166 percent.
snippet_sentences: ['It seems to me that you have a selective memory.']
snippet: It seems to me that you have a selective memory.

dialogue_sentences: ['So after Speaker Gingrich and Senator Dole took over the Congress, I went to New Hampshire and a man suggested -- a gentleman that unfortunately just passed away a couple of days ago, suggested that we appoint a commission.', 'And I shook hands with him on it and I appointed my members, and the commission never met.', "And then Senator Dole's ardent supporters, Senator McCain, who's out there today, along with Senator Feingold, supported, sponsored a campaign finance reform proposal."]
dialogue: So after Speaker Gingrich and Senator Dole took over the Congress, I went to New Hampshire and a man suggested -- a gentleman that unfortunately just passed away a couple of days ago, suggested that we appoint a commission. And I shook hands with him on it and I appointed my members, and the commission never met. And then Senator Dole's ardent supporters, Senator McCain, who's out there today, along with Senator Feingold, supported, sponsored a campaign finance reform proposal.
snippet_sentences: ['I strongly supported it.', "And members of Senator Dole's own party in the Senate killed it.", 'And he was not out there urging them to vote for the McCain-Feingold bill.']
snippet: I strongly supported it. And members of Senator Dole's own party in the Senate killed it. And he was not out there urging them to vote for the McCain-Feingold bill.

dialogue_sentences: ['The tragedy is that our young people are still increasing their use of drugs up to about 11 percent total with marijuana, and I regret it.', 'Let me tell you what I tried to do about it.', 'We submitted the biggest drug budget ever.']
dialogue: The tragedy is that our young people are still increasing their use of drugs up to about 11 percent total with marijuana, and I regret it. Let me tell you what I tried to do about it. We submitted the biggest drug budget ever.
snippet_sentences: ['We have dramatically increased control and enforcement at the border.']
snippet: We have dramatically increased control and enforcement at the border.

dialogue_sentences: ['Secondly, Senator Dole, you voted against the crime bill that had the death penalty for drug kingpins in it.', "I don't think that means you're soft on drugs.", 'We just have a different approach.']
dialogue: Secondly, Senator Dole, you voted against the crime bill that had the death penalty for drug kingpins in it. I don't think that means you're soft on drugs. We just have a different approach.
snippet_sentences: ['But let me remind you, my family has suffered from drug abuse.', "I know what it's like to see somebody you love nearly lose their lives, and I hate drugs, Senator.", 'We need to do this together and we can.']
snippet: But let me remind you, my family has suffered from drug abuse. I know what it's like to see somebody you love nearly lose their lives, and I hate drugs, Senator. We need to do this together and we can.

dialogue_sentences: ['But it seems to me the record is clear.', 'The record is pretty clear in Arkansas, when you were governor.', 'Drug use doubled.']
dialogue: But it seems to me the record is clear. The record is pretty clear in Arkansas, when you were governor. Drug use doubled.
snippet_sentences: ['You resisted the appointment of a drug czar there because you thought it might interfere with treatment.']
snippet: You resisted the appointment of a drug czar there because you thought it might interfere with treatment.

dialogue_sentences: ['Senator Dole led the fight against the Brady Bill.', 'He tried to keep it from coming to my desk.', "He didn't succeed and I signed it and I'm glad I did."]
dialogue: Senator Dole led the fight against the Brady Bill. He tried to keep it from coming to my desk. He didn't succeed and I signed it and I'm glad I did.
snippet_sentences: ["Then when we had the assault weapons ban in the Senate, Senator Dole fought it bitterly and opposed the entire crime bill and almost brought the entire crime bill down because the National Rifle Association didn't want the assault weapons ban, just like they didn't want the Brady Bill."]
snippet: Then when we had the assault weapons ban in the Senate, Senator Dole fought it bitterly and opposed the entire crime bill and almost brought the entire crime bill down because the National Rifle Association didn't want the assault weapons ban, just like they didn't want the Brady Bill.

dialogue_sentences: ['First of all, I take full responsibility for what happened in Somalia, but the American people must remember that those soldiers were under an American commander when that happened.', "I believe they did the best they could under the circumstances, and let's not forget that hundreds of thousands of lives were saved there.", 'Secondly, in Haiti, political violence is much, much smaller than it was.']
dialogue: First of all, I take full responsibility for what happened in Somalia, but the American people must remember that those soldiers were under an American commander when that happened. I believe they did the best they could under the circumstances, and let's not forget that hundreds of thousands of lives were saved there. Secondly, in Haiti, political violence is much, much smaller than it was.
snippet_sentences: ["Thirdly, in Bosnia it's a virtual miracle that there has been no return to war and at least there has now been an election."]
snippet: Thirdly, in Bosnia it's a virtual miracle that there has been no return to war and at least there has now been an election.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's just like you said in Texas one day, you know raised taxes too much, and you did, and you cut defense too much, Mr. President, and you did.", 'You may have said that, too.', 'But the bottom line is, we are the strongest nation in the world.']
dialogue: It's just like you said in Texas one day, you know raised taxes too much, and you did, and you cut defense too much, Mr. President, and you did. You may have said that, too. But the bottom line is, we are the strongest nation in the world.
snippet_sentences: ["We provide the leadership and we're going to have to continue to provide the leadership, but let's do it on our terms when our interests are involved and not when somebody blows the whistle at the United Nations."]
snippet: We provide the leadership and we're going to have to continue to provide the leadership, but let's do it on our terms when our interests are involved and not when somebody blows the whistle at the United Nations.

dialogue_sentences: ['You may have said that, too.', 'But the bottom line is, we are the strongest nation in the world.', "We provide the leadership and we're going to have to continue to provide the leadership, but let's do it on our terms when our interests are involved and not when somebody blows the whistle at the United Nations."]
dialogue: You may have said that, too. But the bottom line is, we are the strongest nation in the world. We provide the leadership and we're going to have to continue to provide the leadership, but let's do it on our terms when our interests are involved and not when somebody blows the whistle at the United Nations.
snippet_sentences: ['Our military is the strongest military in the world.', 'It is the strongest, best prepared, best equipped it has ever been.']
snippet: Our military is the strongest military in the world. It is the strongest, best prepared, best equipped it has ever been.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have to be able to make a difference.', 'And frankly we have to consider what the risks are to our young men and women in uniform.', "But I believe the evidence is that our deployments have been successful, in Haiti, in Bosnia, when we moved to Kuwait to repel Saddam Hussein's threatened invasion of Kuwait."]
dialogue: We have to be able to make a difference. And frankly we have to consider what the risks are to our young men and women in uniform. But I believe the evidence is that our deployments have been successful, in Haiti, in Bosnia, when we moved to Kuwait to repel Saddam Hussein's threatened invasion of Kuwait.
snippet_sentences: ['I believe the United States is at peace tonight in part because of the disciplined, careful, effective deployment of our military resources.']
snippet: I believe the United States is at peace tonight in part because of the disciplined, careful, effective deployment of our military resources.

dialogue_sentences: ['Here we have Cuba 90 miles from our shores, and what have we done, we passed the law that gave people a right to sue and the President postponed it for six months.', "And it seemed to me if you want to send a signal, you've got to send a signal, Mr. President.", 'Well, first of all, for the last four years we have worked had to put more and more pressure on the Castro government to bring about more openness and move toward democracy.']
dialogue: Here we have Cuba 90 miles from our shores, and what have we done, we passed the law that gave people a right to sue and the President postponed it for six months. And it seemed to me if you want to send a signal, you've got to send a signal, Mr. President. Well, first of all, for the last four years we have worked had to put more and more pressure on the Castro government to bring about more openness and move toward democracy.
snippet_sentences: ['In 1992, before I became President, the Congress passed the Cuba Democracy Act and I enforced it vigorously.']
snippet: In 1992, before I became President, the Congress passed the Cuba Democracy Act and I enforced it vigorously.

dialogue_sentences: ["I know you probably would oppose it, Mr. President, but I think we should have a fairer system and a flatter system, and we'll have a fairer and flatter system and we're going to make the economic package work.", 'The President was opposed to it in 1993.', 'He wanted to give us this big system, that took over about one-seventh of the economy, that put on price controls, created all these state alliances, and would cost $1.5 trillion and force people into managed care, whether they wanted it or not.']
dialogue: I know you probably would oppose it, Mr. President, but I think we should have a fairer system and a flatter system, and we'll have a fairer and flatter system and we're going to make the economic package work. The President was opposed to it in 1993. He wanted to give us this big system, that took over about one-seventh of the economy, that put on price controls, created all these state alliances, and would cost $1.5 trillion and force people into managed care, whether they wanted it or not.
snippet_sentences: ['Most people want to see their own doctor.', "They're going to see their own doctor when Bob Dole is president.", "We won't threaten anybody."]
snippet: Most people want to see their own doctor. They're going to see their own doctor when Bob Dole is president. We won't threaten anybody.

dialogue_sentences: ["And even when it finally got near passage, Senator Kennedy held it up for 100 days, because he wasn't satisfied with one provision.", 'But it will cover preexisting conditions.', "If you change your job, you're going to be covered."]
dialogue: And even when it finally got near passage, Senator Kennedy held it up for 100 days, because he wasn't satisfied with one provision. But it will cover preexisting conditions. If you change your job, you're going to be covered.
snippet_sentences: ['So there are a lot of good things in this bill we should have done instead of trying this massive, massive takeover by the Federal government.']
snippet: So there are a lot of good things in this bill we should have done instead of trying this massive, massive takeover by the Federal government.

dialogue_sentences: ["And they said no because they got a memo from one of their political advisers saying that instead they should characterize whatever we did as big government and make sure nothing was done to aid healthcare before the '94 elections so they could make that claim.", "Well, maybe we bit off more than we could chew, but we're pursuing a step-by-step reform now.", "The Kennedy-Kassebaum bill that I signed will make it possible for 25 million people to keep their health insurance when they change jobs or when somebody in their family's been sick."]
dialogue: And they said no because they got a memo from one of their political advisers saying that instead they should characterize whatever we did as big government and make sure nothing was done to aid healthcare before the '94 elections so they could make that claim. Well, maybe we bit off more than we could chew, but we're pursuing a step-by-step reform now. The Kennedy-Kassebaum bill that I signed will make it possible for 25 million people to keep their health insurance when they change jobs or when somebody in their family's been sick.
snippet_sentences: ["I signed a bill to stop these drive-by deliveries when insurance companies can force people out of the hospital after 24 hours and I vetoed Senator Dole's Medicare plan that would have forced a lot of seniors into managed care and taken a lot more money out of their pockets and led to Medicare withering on the vine."]
snippet: I signed a bill to stop these drive-by deliveries when insurance companies can force people out of the hospital after 24 hours and I vetoed Senator Dole's Medicare plan that would have forced a lot of seniors into managed care and taken a lot more money out of their pockets and led to Medicare withering on the vine.

dialogue_sentences: ['It is a very difficult environment.', 'The feelings are very strong.', 'There are extremists in all parts of the Middle East who want to kill that peace process.']
dialogue: It is a very difficult environment. The feelings are very strong. There are extremists in all parts of the Middle East who want to kill that peace process.
snippet_sentences: ['Prime Minister Rabin gave his life because someone in his own country literally hated him for trying to bring peace.', 'I would like to have had a big, organized summit, but those people were killing each other, rapidly, innocent Arab children, innocent Israeli people, they were dying.']
snippet: Prime Minister Rabin gave his life because someone in his own country literally hated him for trying to bring peace. I would like to have had a big, organized summit, but those people were killing each other, rapidly, innocent Arab children, innocent Israeli people, they were dying.

dialogue_sentences: ['This is a serious business.', "It's about your family; it's about your business, and in this case it's about a firmer policy with Cuba.", 'Let me just mention, Senator Dole voted for $900 billion in tax increases.']
dialogue: This is a serious business. It's about your family; it's about your business, and in this case it's about a firmer policy with Cuba. Let me just mention, Senator Dole voted for $900 billion in tax increases.
snippet_sentences: ["His running mate Jack Kemp once said that Bob Dole never met a tax he didn't hike."]
snippet: His running mate Jack Kemp once said that Bob Dole never met a tax he didn't hike.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's about your family; it's about your business, and in this case it's about a firmer policy with Cuba.", 'Let me just mention, Senator Dole voted for $900 billion in tax increases.', "His running mate Jack Kemp once said that Bob Dole never met a tax he didn't hike."]
dialogue: It's about your family; it's about your business, and in this case it's about a firmer policy with Cuba. Let me just mention, Senator Dole voted for $900 billion in tax increases. His running mate Jack Kemp once said that Bob Dole never met a tax he didn't hike.
snippet_sentences: ["And everybody knows, including the Wall Street Journal, hardly a friend of the Democratic party of this administration, that the '82 tax increase he sponsored in inflation-adjusted dollars was the biggest tax increase in American history."]
snippet: And everybody knows, including the Wall Street Journal, hardly a friend of the Democratic party of this administration, that the '82 tax increase he sponsored in inflation-adjusted dollars was the biggest tax increase in American history.

dialogue_sentences: ['Another way you can do is to expand Medicaid.', 'In America no one will go without healthcare, no one will go without food.', 'Food.']
dialogue: Another way you can do is to expand Medicaid. In America no one will go without healthcare, no one will go without food. Food.
snippet_sentences: ["Well, the president's own CIA director says Saddam is stronger now than he was."]
snippet: Well, the president's own CIA director says Saddam is stronger now than he was.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well, I have a different view.', 'Again, Iâ€™ve supported the President on Bosnia, and I think we were told the troops would be out in a year.', "Now I understand it's been extended 'til some time next year."]
dialogue: Well, I have a different view. Again, Iâ€™ve supported the President on Bosnia, and I think we were told the troops would be out in a year. Now I understand it's been extended 'til some time next year.
snippet_sentences: ["But, let's start with Somalia, where they dragged Americans through the streets, and where 18 Americans were killed one day, because they didn't have, they were pinned down for eight hours, the rangers."]
snippet: But, let's start with Somalia, where they dragged Americans through the streets, and where 18 Americans were killed one day, because they didn't have, they were pinned down for eight hours, the rangers.

dialogue_sentences: ["Until we got a Republican Congress, we finally got action, I'm proud of my colleagues in the Republican Party for getting that done.", 'It means a lot to a lot of people watching us tonight.', "Well, that sounds very good, but it's very wrong."]
dialogue: Until we got a Republican Congress, we finally got action, I'm proud of my colleagues in the Republican Party for getting that done. It means a lot to a lot of people watching us tonight. Well, that sounds very good, but it's very wrong.
snippet_sentences: ["Senator Dole remembers well that we actually offered not to even put in a healthcare bill in 1994, uh '93, but instead to work with the Senate Republicans and write a joint bill.", "And they said no because they got a memo from one of their political advisers saying that instead they should characterize whatever we did as big government and make sure nothing was done to aid healthcare before the '94 elections so they could make that claim."]
snippet: Senator Dole remembers well that we actually offered not to even put in a healthcare bill in 1994, uh '93, but instead to work with the Senate Republicans and write a joint bill. And they said no because they got a memo from one of their political advisers saying that instead they should characterize whatever we did as big government and make sure nothing was done to aid healthcare before the '94 elections so they could make that claim.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, I'm saying that Senator Dole said in his fine speech in San Diego that he wanted to build a bridge to the past.", 'And I think I know what he meant by that.', "He's troubled, as I am, by some of the things that go on today."]
dialogue: Well, I'm saying that Senator Dole said in his fine speech in San Diego that he wanted to build a bridge to the past. And I think I know what he meant by that. He's troubled, as I am, by some of the things that go on today.
snippet_sentences: ['But I believe America is the greatest country in human history because we have maintained freedom and increasing prosperity by relentlessly pushing the barriers of knowledge, the barriers of the present, always moving into the future.']
snippet: But I believe America is the greatest country in human history because we have maintained freedom and increasing prosperity by relentlessly pushing the barriers of knowledge, the barriers of the present, always moving into the future.

dialogue_sentences: ["But why shouldn't everybody have that choice.", "Why shouldn't low income Americans and low middle income Americans.", "I'm excited about it."]
dialogue: But why shouldn't everybody have that choice. Why shouldn't low income Americans and low middle income Americans. I'm excited about it.
snippet_sentences: ["It's going to be a big, big opportunity for a lot of people."]
snippet: It's going to be a big, big opportunity for a lot of people.

dialogue_sentences: ["You're for school uniforms and curfews and you're opposed to truancy.", "Now that's not reform, Mr. President.", "Why can't Landale Shakespeare in Cleveland or Pilar Gonzales in Milwaukee give their children an opportunity to go to a better school."]
dialogue: You're for school uniforms and curfews and you're opposed to truancy. Now that's not reform, Mr. President. Why can't Landale Shakespeare in Cleveland or Pilar Gonzales in Milwaukee give their children an opportunity to go to a better school.
snippet_sentences: ["Some schools aren't safe.", "Some schools aren't even safe.", 'Your choice is nothing.']
snippet: Some schools aren't safe. Some schools aren't even safe. Your choice is nothing.

dialogue_sentences: ["There won't be 10 millionaires and 14 lawyers in the cabinet.", "There will be people with experience and people who understand America and people who've made it and know the hard knocks in life.", 'When Senator Dole made that remark about all the elitists, all the young elitists in the administration, one of the young men who works for me who grew up in a house trailer looked at me and said, Mr. President, I know how you grew up, who is he talking about.']
dialogue: There won't be 10 millionaires and 14 lawyers in the cabinet. There will be people with experience and people who understand America and people who've made it and know the hard knocks in life. When Senator Dole made that remark about all the elitists, all the young elitists in the administration, one of the young men who works for me who grew up in a house trailer looked at me and said, Mr. President, I know how you grew up, who is he talking about.
snippet_sentences: ["And you know this liberal charge, that's what their party always drags out when they get in a tight race.", "It's sort of their golden oldie, you know."]
snippet: And you know this liberal charge, that's what their party always drags out when they get in a tight race. It's sort of their golden oldie, you know.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's sort of their golden oldie, you know.", "It's a record they think they can play that everybody loves to hear.", "And I just don't think that dog will hunt this time."]
dialogue: It's sort of their golden oldie, you know. It's a record they think they can play that everybody loves to hear. And I just don't think that dog will hunt this time.
snippet_sentences: ['The American people should make up their own mind.']
snippet: The American people should make up their own mind.

dialogue_sentences: ["Here's the record: We cut deficit four years in a row for the first time before the Civil War -- I mean, before World War II, and maybe before the Civil War, too.", "We've made every one of them eligible for a tax cut.", "We've got declining crime rates, two million fewer people on welfare rolls before welfare reform passed, and a 50 percent increase in child support and a crime bill with 60 death penalties and 100,000 police and the assault weapons ban."]
dialogue: Here's the record: We cut deficit four years in a row for the first time before the Civil War -- I mean, before World War II, and maybe before the Civil War, too. We've made every one of them eligible for a tax cut. We've got declining crime rates, two million fewer people on welfare rolls before welfare reform passed, and a 50 percent increase in child support and a crime bill with 60 death penalties and 100,000 police and the assault weapons ban.
snippet_sentences: ["The American people can make up their mind about whether that's a liberal record or a record that's good for America.", 'Liberal, conservative, you put whatever label you want on it.']
snippet: The American people can make up their mind about whether that's a liberal record or a record that's good for America. Liberal, conservative, you put whatever label you want on it.

dialogue_sentences: ["It was wrong for the country and calling it conservative won't make it right.", "It was a bad decision for America and would have been bad for our future if I hadn't stopped it.", 'Well, the President can define himself in any way he wants, but I think we have to look at the record.']
dialogue: It was wrong for the country and calling it conservative won't make it right. It was a bad decision for America and would have been bad for our future if I hadn't stopped it. Well, the President can define himself in any way he wants, but I think we have to look at the record.
snippet_sentences: ['Go back to the time he was, what, Texas director for George McGovern.', "George McGovern is a friend of mine, so I don't mean, but he was a liberal, proud liberal."]
snippet: Go back to the time he was, what, Texas director for George McGovern. George McGovern is a friend of mine, so I don't mean, but he was a liberal, proud liberal.

dialogue_sentences: ['And not about personal things.', 'You know, I think his liberal vision is a thing of the past.', 'I know he wants to disown it.']
dialogue: And not about personal things. You know, I think his liberal vision is a thing of the past. I know he wants to disown it.
snippet_sentences: ["I wouldn't want to be a liberal either, Mr. President, but you're stuck with it because that's your record, that's your record in Arkansas: The biggest tax increase in history."]
snippet: I wouldn't want to be a liberal either, Mr. President, but you're stuck with it because that's your record, that's your record in Arkansas: The biggest tax increase in history.

dialogue_sentences: ["So I'd rather talk about my strengths.", 'And I think I have my strengths and I think the best thing going for Bob Dole is that Bob Dole keeps his word.', "It's a question between trust and fear, and I would say, I think, Mr. President, about all you've got going in this campaign is fear."]
dialogue: So I'd rather talk about my strengths. And I think I have my strengths and I think the best thing going for Bob Dole is that Bob Dole keeps his word. It's a question between trust and fear, and I would say, I think, Mr. President, about all you've got going in this campaign is fear.
snippet_sentences: ["You're spending millions and millions of dollars in negative ads frightening senior citizens."]
snippet: You're spending millions and millions of dollars in negative ads frightening senior citizens.

dialogue_sentences: ["I know this to be a fact because I had one tell me last week, Senator don't cut my Medicare.", "I'm trying to save your Medicare, just as I rescued Social Security with a bipartisan commission.", 'I have relatives on Medicare.']
dialogue: I know this to be a fact because I had one tell me last week, Senator don't cut my Medicare. I'm trying to save your Medicare, just as I rescued Social Security with a bipartisan commission. I have relatives on Medicare.
snippet_sentences: ['I used to sign welfare checks for my grandparents.', "I know all about poverty and all about need and all about taking care of people, and that's been my career in the United States Senate."]
snippet: I used to sign welfare checks for my grandparents. I know all about poverty and all about need and all about taking care of people, and that's been my career in the United States Senate.

dialogue_sentences: ["He's president so I guess it's a little better deal.", 'But I wanted the American people to know I was willing to give up something.', "I wasn't just getting more power and more power."]

snippet: And you folks out there are going to have to choose who you think is right.

dialogue_sentences: ['Those plans are better than this $550 billion tax scheme.', "Now, remember, folks, even Senator Dole's campaign co-chair here, Senator D'Amato, says he's got to cut Medicare to pay for this.", "Everybody who's looked at it, 500 economists, seven Nobel prize winners, say it's bad for the economy."]

snippet: It's going to blow a hole in the deficit It's going to raise taxes on nine million people and require bigger cuts than the one I vetoed.

dialogue_sentences: ["I can't clear my throat in 90 seconds.", 'Jim, Bob Dole and myself do not see Al Gore and Bill Clinton as our enemy.', 'We see them as our opponents.']
dialogue: I can't clear my throat in 90 seconds. Jim, Bob Dole and myself do not see Al Gore and Bill Clinton as our enemy. We see them as our opponents.
snippet_sentences: ['This is the greatest democracy in the world.']
snippet: This is the greatest democracy in the world.

dialogue_sentences: ['Clearly, Abraham Lincoln put it best when he said you serve your party best by serving the nation first.', "And I can't think of a better way of serving this nation in 1996 than by electing Bob Dole as the President of the United States of America.", 'These issues are fully capable of being understood and reflected upon by the American people.']
dialogue: Clearly, Abraham Lincoln put it best when he said you serve your party best by serving the nation first. And I can't think of a better way of serving this nation in 1996 than by electing Bob Dole as the President of the United States of America. These issues are fully capable of being understood and reflected upon by the American people.
snippet_sentences: ['This is a democracy in which we have the freest press and the greatest First Amendment rights in the history of mankind.']
snippet: This is a democracy in which we have the freest press and the greatest First Amendment rights in the history of mankind.

dialogue: Also, tax relief for first-time home buyers, tax encouragement for savings and help in paying health care expenses, and a tax break, actually, the elimination of capital gains taxes on the -- on the profits from the sale of a home. All of this is within a balanced budget plan, which protects Medicare, Medicaid, education and the environment. Jim, this economy is overtaxed, overregulated, too many people suing each other, there's too much litigation.
snippet_sentences: ['Our education is not up to the standards that the American family and the American people want for their children.']
snippet: Our education is not up to the standards that the American family and the American people want for their children.

dialogue_sentences: ['He fought on the battlefield.', 'He has worked with Democrats and Republicans.', 'In my opinion, it is beneath Bob Dole to go after anyone personally.']
dialogue: He fought on the battlefield. He has worked with Democrats and Republicans. In my opinion, it is beneath Bob Dole to go after anyone personally.
snippet_sentences: ['Clearly, Abraham Lincoln put it best when he said you serve your party best by serving the nation first.']
snippet: Clearly, Abraham Lincoln put it best when he said you serve your party best by serving the nation first.

dialogue_sentences: ['President Clinton addressed this issue when he said, "Mend it, don\'t end it."', 'Diversity is a great strength in America.', 'Look around the world at other places where they have not paid attention to the necessity of promoting harmony of, between different ethnic, racial and religious, and cultural groups.']
dialogue: President Clinton addressed this issue when he said, "Mend it, don't end it." Diversity is a great strength in America. Look around the world at other places where they have not paid attention to the necessity of promoting harmony of, between different ethnic, racial and religious, and cultural groups.
snippet_sentences: ["We ought to be very proud in our country, as most Americans are, that we've made tremendous progress, but we ought to recognize that we have more work to do."]
snippet: We ought to be very proud in our country, as most Americans are, that we've made tremendous progress, but we ought to recognize that we have more work to do.

dialogue_sentences: ["We ought to be very proud in our country, as most Americans are, that we've made tremendous progress, but we ought to recognize that we have more work to do.", 'Now, the first thing that we are trying to do is to create a million new jobs in the inner cities of this country, with tax credits for employers who hire people who are now unemployed.', 'We are seeking to have vigorous enforcement of the laws that bar discrimination.']
dialogue: We ought to be very proud in our country, as most Americans are, that we've made tremendous progress, but we ought to recognize that we have more work to do. Now, the first thing that we are trying to do is to create a million new jobs in the inner cities of this country, with tax credits for employers who hire people who are now unemployed. We are seeking to have vigorous enforcement of the laws that bar discrimination.
snippet_sentences: ['Now, I want to congratulate Mr. Kemp for being a lonely voice in the Republican party over the years on this question.', "It is -- it is with some sadness that I refer to the fact that the day after he joined Senator Dole's ticket, he announced that he was changing his position and was hereto, thereafter going to adopt Senator Dole's position to end all affirmative action."]
snippet: Now, I want to congratulate Mr. Kemp for being a lonely voice in the Republican party over the years on this question. It is -- it is with some sadness that I refer to the fact that the day after he joined Senator Dole's ticket, he announced that he was changing his position and was hereto, thereafter going to adopt Senator Dole's position to end all affirmative action.

dialogue_sentences: ['Quotas have always been against the American ideal.', 'People need to own.', "And that's what Abraham Lincoln believed."]
dialogue: Quotas have always been against the American ideal. People need to own. And that's what Abraham Lincoln believed.

snippet: That when people own something, they have a stake in the American dream. That is Affirmative Action in America.

dialogue_sentences: ["And that's what Abraham Lincoln believed.", 'That when people own something, they have a stake in the American dream.', 'That is Affirmative Action in America.']
dialogue: And that's what Abraham Lincoln believed. That when people own something, they have a stake in the American dream. That is Affirmative Action in America.

dialogue_sentences: ['That must change, and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp.', 'Remember what I said just a moment ago.', 'If it were not so, he would have told you.']
dialogue: That must change, and it will under Bob Dole and Jack Kemp. Remember what I said just a moment ago. If it were not so, he would have told you.
snippet_sentences: ['The problems between races in America must be addressed.']
snippet: The problems between races in America must be addressed.

dialogue_sentences: ['We must have a tax code going into the 21st Century that does not protect the establishment and this tax code does.', "And by cutting and eliminating the Capital Gains, by cutting and eliminating the Estate Tax, by bringing the top tax rate down to something reasonable, like -- here he goes again -- I think in peacetime, it shouldn't be higher, Bob, and I don't think it should be higher than 25 percent, phased in.", 'But capital would flow out into the economy.']
dialogue: We must have a tax code going into the 21st Century that does not protect the establishment and this tax code does. And by cutting and eliminating the Capital Gains, by cutting and eliminating the Estate Tax, by bringing the top tax rate down to something reasonable, like -- here he goes again -- I think in peacetime, it shouldn't be higher, Bob, and I don't think it should be higher than 25 percent, phased in. But capital would flow out into the economy.
snippet_sentences: ['Small businessmen and women, African-American, Asian Americans, Latino Americans, female Americans would be able to start their businesses.']
snippet: Small businessmen and women, African-American, Asian Americans, Latino Americans, female Americans would be able to start their businesses.

dialogue_sentences: ['Our country is as the Kerner Commission Report suggested a number of years ago was being split, but they said between white and black.', "I think it's being split, Jim, not so much between white and black, although that's still a very serious problem.", 'We really have two economies.']
dialogue: Our country is as the Kerner Commission Report suggested a number of years ago was being split, but they said between white and black. I think it's being split, Jim, not so much between white and black, although that's still a very serious problem. We really have two economies.
snippet_sentences: ['Our general economy, our national economy, our mainstream economy is democratic, is based on incentives, a small "d" Al, it\'s capitalism and incentives for working and saving and investing and producing, and families and the things that really lead to progress up that ladder that we call "The American Dream," but is what is really universal.']
snippet: Our general economy, our national economy, our mainstream economy is democratic, is based on incentives, a small "d" Al, it's capitalism and incentives for working and saving and investing and producing, and families and the things that really lead to progress up that ladder that we call "The American Dream," but is what is really universal.

dialogue_sentences: ["I have actually not questioned Governor Bush's experience.", 'I have questioned his proposals.', 'I think this is a very important moment for our country.']
dialogue: I have actually not questioned Governor Bush's experience. I have questioned his proposals. I think this is a very important moment for our country.
snippet_sentences: ['We have achieved extraordinary prosperity.']
snippet: We have achieved extraordinary prosperity.

dialogue_sentences: ['Our country has cut the welfare rolls in half.', "I fought hard from my days in the Senate and as vice president to cut the welfare rolls and we've moved millions of people in America into good jobs.", "But it's now time for the next stage of welfare reform, and include fathers and not only mothers."]
dialogue: Our country has cut the welfare rolls in half. I fought hard from my days in the Senate and as vice president to cut the welfare rolls and we've moved millions of people in America into good jobs. But it's now time for the next stage of welfare reform, and include fathers and not only mothers.
snippet_sentences: ["Let me just say that obviously tonight we're going to hear some phony numbers about what I think and what we ought to do."]
snippet: Let me just say that obviously tonight we're going to hear some phony numbers about what I think and what we ought to do.

dialogue_sentences: ['There is a difference of opinion.', "My opponent thinks the government -- the surplus is the government's money.", "That's not what I think."]
dialogue: There is a difference of opinion. My opponent thinks the government -- the surplus is the government's money. That's not what I think.
snippet_sentences: ["I think it's the hard-working people of America's money and I want to share some of that money with you so you have more money to build and save and dream for your families."]
snippet: I think it's the hard-working people of America's money and I want to share some of that money with you so you have more money to build and save and dream for your families.

dialogue_sentences: ['Surplus is money -- more money than needed.', 'Let me tell you what your plan is.', "It's not Social Security plus, it's Social Security plus huge debt."]
dialogue: Surplus is money -- more money than needed. Let me tell you what your plan is. It's not Social Security plus, it's Social Security plus huge debt.
snippet_sentences: ['You leave future generations with tremendous IOUs.']
snippet: You leave future generations with tremendous IOUs.

dialogue_sentences: ['He puts no real assets into the Social Security system.', 'The revenues exceed the expenses in Social Security until the year 2015 which means all retirees are going to get the promises made.', 'For those of you who he wants to scare into the voting booth to vote for him, hear me loud and clear.']
dialogue: He puts no real assets into the Social Security system. The revenues exceed the expenses in Social Security until the year 2015 which means all retirees are going to get the promises made. For those of you who he wants to scare into the voting booth to vote for him, hear me loud and clear.
snippet_sentences: ['A promise made will be a promise kept.']
snippet: A promise made will be a promise kept.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's a fundamental difference of opinion here, folks.", 'Younger worker after younger worker hears my call that says I trust you.', 'And you know what, the issue is changing.']
dialogue: It's a fundamental difference of opinion here, folks. Younger worker after younger worker hears my call that says I trust you. And you know what, the issue is changing.
snippet_sentences: ["Seniors now understand that the promise made will be a promise kept, but younger workers now understand we better have a government that trusts them and that's exactly what I'm going to do."]
snippet: Seniors now understand that the promise made will be a promise kept, but younger workers now understand we better have a government that trusts them and that's exactly what I'm going to do.

dialogue_sentences: ["I thought it was interesting that on the two minutes he spent about a million-and-a-half on my plan, which means he doesn't want you to know what he's doing is loading up IOUs for future generations.", 'He puts no real assets into the Social Security system.', 'The revenues exceed the expenses in Social Security until the year 2015 which means all retirees are going to get the promises made.']
dialogue: I thought it was interesting that on the two minutes he spent about a million-and-a-half on my plan, which means he doesn't want you to know what he's doing is loading up IOUs for future generations. He puts no real assets into the Social Security system. The revenues exceed the expenses in Social Security until the year 2015 which means all retirees are going to get the promises made.
snippet_sentences: ['For those of you who he wants to scare into the voting booth to vote for him, hear me loud and clear.']
snippet: For those of you who he wants to scare into the voting booth to vote for him, hear me loud and clear.

dialogue_sentences: ['And we can do better than the past administration has done.', "It's time for a fresh start.", "It's time for a new look."]
dialogue: And we can do better than the past administration has done. It's time for a fresh start. It's time for a new look.
snippet_sentences: ["It's time for a fresh start after a season of cynicism."]
snippet: It's time for a fresh start after a season of cynicism.

dialogue_sentences: ['We became grandparents a year-and-a-half ago.', "We've got four children.", "I have devoted 24 years of my life to public service and I've said this before and I'll say it again, if you entrust me with the presidency, I may not be the most exciting politician, but I will work hard for you every day."]
dialogue: We became grandparents a year-and-a-half ago. We've got four children. I have devoted 24 years of my life to public service and I've said this before and I'll say it again, if you entrust me with the presidency, I may not be the most exciting politician, but I will work hard for you every day.
snippet_sentences: ['I will fight for middle-class families and working men and women and I will never let you down.']
snippet: I will fight for middle-class families and working men and women and I will never let you down.

dialogue_sentences: ["And that's one of the reasons I've said before, and I'll pledge here tonight, if I'm president, the very first bill that Joe Lieberman and I will send to the United States Congress is the McCain-Feingold campaign finance reform bill.", "And the reason it's that important is that all of the other issues, whether prescription drugs for all seniors that are opposed by the drug companies or the patient's bill of rights to take the decisions away from the HMOs and give them to the doctors and nurses, opposed by the HMOs and insurance companies, all these other proposals are going to be a lot easier to get passed for the American people if we limit the influence of special interest money and give democracy back to the American people.", 'And I wish Governor Bush would join me this evening in endorsing the McCain-Feingold Campaign Finance Reform Bill.']
dialogue: And that's one of the reasons I've said before, and I'll pledge here tonight, if I'm president, the very first bill that Joe Lieberman and I will send to the United States Congress is the McCain-Feingold campaign finance reform bill. And the reason it's that important is that all of the other issues, whether prescription drugs for all seniors that are opposed by the drug companies or the patient's bill of rights to take the decisions away from the HMOs and give them to the doctors and nurses, opposed by the HMOs and insurance companies, all these other proposals are going to be a lot easier to get passed for the American people if we limit the influence of special interest money and give democracy back to the American people. And I wish Governor Bush would join me this evening in endorsing the McCain-Feingold Campaign Finance Reform Bill.
snippet_sentences: ['You know, this man has no credibility on the issue.']
snippet: You know, this man has no credibility on the issue.

dialogue_sentences: ['And we have a very important decision to make.', 'Will we use the prosperity to enrich all of our families and not just a few?', 'One important way of looking at this is to ask who are you going to fight for?']
dialogue: And we have a very important decision to make. Will we use the prosperity to enrich all of our families and not just a few? One important way of looking at this is to ask who are you going to fight for?
snippet_sentences: ['Throughout my career in public service, I have fought for the working men and women of this country, middle-class families.']
snippet: Throughout my career in public service, I have fought for the working men and women of this country, middle-class families.

dialogue_sentences: ["She's 79 years old.", 'She has Social Security.', "I'm not going to cut her benefits or support any proposal that would."]
dialogue: She's 79 years old. She has Social Security. I'm not going to cut her benefits or support any proposal that would.

snippet: She gets a small pension, but in order to pay for her prescription drug benefits, she has to go out seven days a week several hours a day picking up cans.

dialogue_sentences: ['I want to make sure prescription drugs are available for all seniors.', 'And I want seniors to have additional choices when it comes to choosing their health care plans.', 'I want to finally get something done on Social Security.']
dialogue: I want to make sure prescription drugs are available for all seniors. And I want seniors to have additional choices when it comes to choosing their health care plans. I want to finally get something done on Social Security.
snippet_sentences: ['I want to make sure the seniors have the promise made will be a promise kept, but I want younger workers to be able to manage some of their own money, some of their own payroll taxes in the private sector under certain guidelines to get a better rate of return on your own money.']
snippet: I want to make sure the seniors have the promise made will be a promise kept, but I want younger workers to be able to manage some of their own money, some of their own payroll taxes in the private sector under certain guidelines to get a better rate of return on your own money.

dialogue_sentences: ["I don't want to be the world's policeman, I want to be the world's peacemaker by having a military of high morale and a military that is well-equipped.", 'I want anti-ballistic missile systems to protect ourselves and our allies from a rogue nation that may try to hold us hostage or blackmail our allies and friends.', 'I want to make sure the education system fulfills its hope and promise.']
dialogue: I don't want to be the world's policeman, I want to be the world's peacemaker by having a military of high morale and a military that is well-equipped. I want anti-ballistic missile systems to protect ourselves and our allies from a rogue nation that may try to hold us hostage or blackmail our allies and friends. I want to make sure the education system fulfills its hope and promise.
snippet_sentences: ["I've had a strong record of working with Democrats and Republicans in Texas to make sure no child is left behind."]
snippet: I've had a strong record of working with Democrats and Republicans in Texas to make sure no child is left behind.

dialogue_sentences: ['Now here is the contrast.', "95% of all seniors would get no help whatsoever under my opponent's plan for the first four or five years.", "Now, one thing I don't understand, Jim, is why is it that the wealthiest 1% get their tax cuts the first year, but 95% of seniors have to wait four to five years before they get a single penny?"]
dialogue: Now here is the contrast. 95% of all seniors would get no help whatsoever under my opponent's plan for the first four or five years. Now, one thing I don't understand, Jim, is why is it that the wealthiest 1% get their tax cuts the first year, but 95% of seniors have to wait four to five years before they get a single penny?
snippet_sentences: ['I guess my answer to that is the man is running on Medi-scare.']
snippet: I guess my answer to that is the man is running on Medi-scare.

dialogue_sentences: ["I cannot let this go by, the old-style Washington politics, of we're going to scare you in the voting booth.", 'Under my plan the man gets immediate help with prescription drugs.', "It's called Immediate Helping Hand."]
dialogue: I cannot let this go by, the old-style Washington politics, of we're going to scare you in the voting booth. Under my plan the man gets immediate help with prescription drugs. It's called Immediate Helping Hand.
snippet_sentences: ['Instead of squabbling and finger pointing, he gets immediate help.']
snippet: Instead of squabbling and finger pointing, he gets immediate help.

dialogue_sentences: ['He talks about numbers.', "I'm beginning to think not only did he invent the Internet, but he invented the calculator.", "It's fuzzy math."]
dialogue: He talks about numbers. I'm beginning to think not only did he invent the Internet, but he invented the calculator. It's fuzzy math.
snippet_sentences: ["It's a scaring -- he's trying to scare people in the voting booth."]
snippet: It's a scaring -- he's trying to scare people in the voting booth.

dialogue_sentences: ["I don't think a president can do that.", "I was disappointed in the ruling because I think abortions ought to be more rare in America, and I'm worried that that pill will create more abortions and cause more people to have abortions.", "This is a very important topic and it's a very sensitive topic, because a lot of good people disagree on the issue."]
dialogue: I don't think a president can do that. I was disappointed in the ruling because I think abortions ought to be more rare in America, and I'm worried that that pill will create more abortions and cause more people to have abortions. This is a very important topic and it's a very sensitive topic, because a lot of good people disagree on the issue.

dialogue_sentences: ["If it's a failing school, shut it down and reopen it under a new principal with a turnaround team of specialists the way Governor Jim Hunt does in North Carolina.", 'Here is another difference.', "The governor, if it's a failing school, would leave the children in that failing school for three years and then give a little bit of money to the parents, a down payment on a down payment for private school tuition, and pretend that that would be enough for them to go out and go to a private school."]

dialogue_sentences: ['I have been in public service for 24 years, Jim.', 'And throughout all that time the people I have fought for have been the middle-class families, and I have been willing to stand up to powerful interests like the big insurance companies, the drug companies, the HMOs, the oil companies.', 'They have good people and they play constructive roles sometimes, but sometimes they get too much power.']
dialogue: I have been in public service for 24 years, Jim. They have good people and they play constructive roles sometimes, but sometimes they get too much power.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's their ingenuity, I agree with that.", 'But you know, they were working pretty hard eight years ago.', 'And instead of concentrating on tax cuts mostly for the wealthy, we want -- I want tax cuts for the middle-class families and I want to continue the prosperity and make sure that it enriches not just a few but all of our families.']

snippet: We have gone from the biggest deficits to the biggest surpluses.

dialogue_sentences: ["I think you've done so well there, I want to keep you there.", 'It is such an assault on the basic promise that America makes that the law will treat individuals as individuals regardless of their status.', 'And the sad fact is that racial profiling occurs in this country.']

dialogue_sentences: ["First we would issue, if we're fortunate enough to be elected, an executive order prohibiting racial profiling.", 'And secondly the first Civil Rights Act legislation we would send to Congress would be a national ban on racial profiling.', 'It is just wrong.']

dialogue_sentences: ['The only way to stop it is through the law.', 'The law, after all, is meant to express our values and our aspirations for our society.', 'And our values are violently contradicted by the kind of racial profiling that I know exists.']

dialogue_sentences: ['I thought that humor was unacceptable.', 'Let me come to the question of Hollywood and then answer the general question.', "Al Gore and I have felt for a long time, first as parents and then only second as public officials, that we cannot let America's parents stand alone in this competition that they feel they're in with Hollywood to raise their own kids and give their kids the faith and values they want to give them."]

dialogue_sentences: ['We want to restore our public schools to the greatness they once represented so that every parent has the opportunity to choose what is best for their child and so that every child has an opportunity to share in the American dream.', 'We also want to reform the tax code.', "We think it's very important now that we have a surplus, that a portion of that surplus go back to the people who earned it."]

dialogue_sentences: ['So bottom line, this is an unfair and unacceptable situation.', "And even though, as the economy has risen in the last eight years, America's women have risen with it and received more income, until women are receiving the same amount of pay for the same job they're doing as a man receives, we've not achieved genuine equality in this country.", 'Al Gore and I are committed to closing that gap and achieving that equality.']
dialogue: So bottom line, this is an unfair and unacceptable situation. snippet_sentences: ["If that is not confirmed and does not happen, then I think the United States, with its European allies, ought to do everything we can to encourage the people of Serbia to do exactly what they've been doing over the last few days to rise up and end this reign of terror by Milosevic, and bring themselves back into the family of nations where they will be welcomed by the United States and others."]
snippet: If that is not confirmed and does not happen, then I think the United States, with its European allies, ought to do everything we can to encourage the people of Serbia to do exactly what they've been doing over the last few days to rise up and end this reign of terror by Milosevic, and bring themselves back into the family of nations where they will be welcomed by the United States and others.

dialogue_sentences: ["He's been supportive of the policy that we've seen with respect to Yugoslavia.", 'And I think he deserves a lot of credit for that.', 'I would go beyond that.']

dialogue_sentences: ['This has had some other unfortunate effects.', "I saw a letter the other day from a young captain stationed in Fort Bragg, a graduate of West Point in '95 getting ready to get out of the service because he's only allowed to train with his troops when fuel is available for the vehicles and only allowed to fire their weapons twice a year.", "He's concerned that if he had to send them into combat it would mean lives lost."]
dialogue: This has had some other unfortunate effects. I saw a letter the other day from a young captain stationed in Fort Bragg, a graduate of West Point in '95 getting ready to get out of the service because he's only allowed to train with his troops when fuel is available for the vehicles and only allowed to fire their weapons twice a year. He's concerned that if he had to send them into combat it would mean lives lost.
snippet_sentences: ['That is a legitimate concern, this is a very important area.']
snippet: That is a legitimate concern, this is a very important area.

dialogue_sentences: ['We made significant breakthroughs, I think, at the end of the Bush administration because of the Gulf War.', 'In effect, we had joined together with Arab allies and done enormous damage to the Iraqi armed forces.', 'By virtue of the end of the Cold War, the Soviets were no longer a factor.']
dialogue: We made significant breakthroughs, I think, at the end of the Bush administration because of the Gulf War. In effect, we had joined together with Arab allies and done enormous damage to the Iraqi armed forces. By virtue of the end of the Cold War, the Soviets were no longer a factor.
snippet_sentences: ['They used to fish in troubled waters whenever they had the opportunity in the Middle East.']
snippet: They used to fish in troubled waters whenever they had the opportunity in the Middle East.

dialogue_sentences: ['I hope and pray her mission is successful, that there is a cease fire, and the parties return to the peace table.', 'I hope I might, through my friendships in Israel and throughout the Arab world, play a unique role in bringing peace to this -- this sacred region of the world.', 'Bernie, it has been a very, very difficult area to work in for a long time.']
dialogue: I hope and pray her mission is successful, that there is a cease fire, and the parties return to the peace table. I hope I might, through my friendships in Israel and throughout the Arab world, play a unique role in bringing peace to this -- this sacred region of the world. Bernie, it has been a very, very difficult area to work in for a long time.

snippet_sentences: ['We had a strong international coalition raid against them, effective economic sanctions, and a very robust inspection regime was in place under the U. N. auspices and it was able to do a good job of stripping out the capacity to build weapons of mass destruction, the work he had been doing that had not been destroyed during the war in biological and chemical agents, as well as a nuclear program.']
snippet: We had a strong international coalition raid against them, effective economic sanctions, and a very robust inspection regime was in place under the U. N. auspices and it was able to do a good job of stripping out the capacity to build weapons of mass destruction, the work he had been doing that had not been destroyed during the war in biological and chemical agents, as well as a nuclear program.

dialogue_sentences: ["I also think it's unfortunate we find ourselves in a position where we don't know for sure what might be transpiring inside Iraq.", "I certainly hope he's not regenerating that kind of capability, but if he were, if in fact Saddam Hussein were taking steps to try to rebuild nuclear capability or weapons of mass destruction, you would have to give very serious consideration to military action to -- to stop that activity.", "I don't think you can afford to have a man like Saddam Hussein with nuclear weapons in the Middle East."]
dialogue: I also think it's unfortunate we find ourselves in a position where we don't know for sure what might be transpiring inside Iraq. I certainly hope he's not regenerating that kind of capability, but if he were, if in fact Saddam Hussein were taking steps to try to rebuild nuclear capability or weapons of mass destruction, you would have to give very serious consideration to military action to -- to stop that activity. I don't think you can afford to have a man like Saddam Hussein with nuclear weapons in the Middle East.
snippet_sentences: ['It would, of course, be a very serious situation if we had evidence, credible evidence, that Saddam Hussein was developing weapons of mass destruction.']
snippet: It would, of course, be a very serious situation if we had evidence, credible evidence, that Saddam Hussein was developing weapons of mass destruction.

dialogue_sentences: ['As a result, we have had almost ten years now of instability.', 'We have continued to operate almost all of this time military action to enforce a no-fly zone.', 'The Vice President met with them earlier this year.']
dialogue: As a result, we have had almost ten years now of instability. We have continued to operate almost all of this time military action to enforce a no-fly zone. The Vice President met with them earlier this year.
snippet_sentences: ['We are supporting them in their efforts and will continue to support them until the Iraqi people rise up and do what the people of Serbia have done in the last few days, get rid of a despot.', "We'll welcome you back into the family of nations where you belong."]
snippet: We are supporting them in their efforts and will continue to support them until the Iraqi people rise up and do what the people of Serbia have done in the last few days, get rid of a despot. We'll welcome you back into the family of nations where you belong.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have other problems.', "We don't have refinery capacity.", "We haven't built a new refinery in this country for over ten years."]
dialogue: We have other problems. We don't have refinery capacity. We haven't built a new refinery in this country for over ten years.
snippet_sentences: ["Even with more crude available they're probably not going to be able to do very much by way of producing additional home heating oil for this winter."]
snippet: Even with more crude available they're probably not going to be able to do very much by way of producing additional home heating oil for this winter.

dialogue_sentences: ['I think we have to make choices.', 'The Wyoming wilderness bill, frankly was one of my proudest achievements as a member of Congress.', 'I worked on that with my good friend Al Simpson for about four years.']
dialogue: I think we have to make choices. The Wyoming wilderness bill, frankly was one of my proudest achievements as a member of Congress. I worked on that with my good friend Al Simpson for about four years.
snippet_sentences: ['We set aside a part of Wyoming, nearly a million acres of wilderness that ought to be separate and not be developed.']
snippet: We set aside a part of Wyoming, nearly a million acres of wilderness that ought to be separate and not be developed.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's just not worth doing.", 'Al Gore and I are going to guarantee Social Security and add to it the retirement savings plan that I mentioned earlier which will help middle-class families looking forward.', 'The Social Security system is in trouble.']
dialogue: That's just not worth doing. Al Gore and I are going to guarantee Social Security and add to it the retirement savings plan that I mentioned earlier which will help middle-class families looking forward. The Social Security system is in trouble.
snippet_sentences: ["It's been a fantastic program and has been there for 65 years that has provided benefits for senior citizens over that period of time."]
snippet: It's been a fantastic program and has been there for 65 years that has provided benefits for senior citizens over that period of time.

dialogue_sentences: ["So we've got to enforce our civil rights laws.", "We've got to deal with things like racial profiling.", 'And we have to keep our military strong.']
dialogue: So we've got to enforce our civil rights laws. We've got to deal with things like racial profiling. And we have to keep our military strong.
snippet_sentences: ["We have the strongest military, and I'll do whatever is necessary, if I'm president, to make sure that it stays that way."]
snippet: We have the strongest military, and I'll do whatever is necessary, if I'm president, to make sure that it stays that way.

dialogue_sentences: ["We're a freedom-loving nation and if we're an arrogant nation they'll view us that way, but if we're a humble nation they'll respect us.", 'I agree with that.', 'I agree with that.']
dialogue: We're a freedom-loving nation and if we're an arrogant nation they'll view us that way, but if we're a humble nation they'll respect us. I agree with that. I agree with that.
snippet_sentences: ['I think that one of the problems that we have faced in the world is that we are so much more powerful than any single nation has been in relationship to the rest of the world than at any time in history, that I know about, anyway.']
snippet: I think that one of the problems that we have faced in the world is that we are so much more powerful than any single nation has been in relationship to the rest of the world than at any time in history, that I know about, anyway.

dialogue_sentences: ['But I think that we also have to have a sense of mission in the world.', "We have to protect our capacity to push forward what America's all about.", 'That means not only military strength and our values, it also means keeping our economy strong.']
dialogue: But I think that we also have to have a sense of mission in the world. We have to protect our capacity to push forward what America's all about. That means not only military strength and our values, it also means keeping our economy strong.
snippet_sentences: ["You know, in the last, or two decades ago, it was routine for leaders of foreign countries to come over here and say you guys have got to do something about these horrendous deficits because it's causing tremendous problems for the rest of the world, and we were lectured to all the time."]
snippet: You know, in the last, or two decades ago, it was routine for leaders of foreign countries to come over here and say you guys have got to do something about these horrendous deficits because it's causing tremendous problems for the rest of the world, and we were lectured to all the time.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's really true, even the ones that sometimes shake their fists at us.", "As soon as they have a change that allows the people to speak freely, they're wanting to develop some kind of blueprint that will help them be like us more, freedom, free markets, political freedom.", 'So I think first and foremost our power ought to be wielded to in ways that form a more perfect union.']
dialogue: It's really true, even the ones that sometimes shake their fists at us. As soon as they have a change that allows the people to speak freely, they're wanting to develop some kind of blueprint that will help them be like us more, freedom, free markets, political freedom. So I think first and foremost our power ought to be wielded to in ways that form a more perfect union.
snippet_sentences: ["The power of example is America's greatest power in the world.", 'And that means, for example, standing up for human rights.', "It means addressing the problems of injustice and inequity, along the lines of race and ethnicity here at home, because in all these other places around the world where they're having these terrible problems, when they feel hope, it is often because they see in us a reflection of their potential."]
snippet: The power of example is America's greatest power in the world. And that means, for example, standing up for human rights. It means addressing the problems of injustice and inequity, along the lines of race and ethnicity here at home, because in all these other places around the world where they're having these terrible problems, when they feel hope, it is often because they see in us a reflection of their potential.

dialogue_sentences: ['Our country has been very active with regular conversations with the leaders there.', 'And we just have to take it day-to-day right now.', 'But one thing I would say where diplomacy is concerned, Israel should feel absolutely secure about one thing.']
dialogue: Our country has been very active with regular conversations with the leaders there. And we just have to take it day-to-day right now. But one thing I would say where diplomacy is concerned, Israel should feel absolutely secure about one thing.

snippet: Our bonds with Israel are larger than agreements or disagreements on some details of diplomatic initiatives.

dialogue_sentences: ['And we just have to take it day-to-day right now.', 'But one thing I would say where diplomacy is concerned, Israel should feel absolutely secure about one thing.', 'Our bonds with Israel are larger than agreements or disagreements on some details of diplomatic initiatives.']
dialogue: And we just have to take it day-to-day right now. But one thing I would say where diplomacy is concerned, Israel should feel absolutely secure about one thing. Our bonds with Israel are larger than agreements or disagreements on some details of diplomatic initiatives.
