I also have a plan to win the war on terror, funding homeland security, strengthening our military, cutting our finances, reaching out to the world, again building strong alliances.
snippet_sentences: ["I believe America's best days are ahead of us because I believe that the future belongs to freedom, not to fear.", "That's the country that I'm going to fight for."]
snippet: I believe America's best days are ahead of us because I believe that the future belongs to freedom, not to fear. That's the country that I'm going to fight for.

dialogue_sentences: ['Thank you.', 'And God bless America.', 'Thank you very much tonight, Jim.']
dialogue: Thank you. And God bless America. Thank you very much tonight, Jim.
snippet_sentences: ['If America shows uncertainty or weakness in this decade, the world will drift toward tragedy.']
snippet: If America shows uncertainty or weakness in this decade, the world will drift toward tragedy.

dialogue_sentences: ['Now Senator Kennedy has made some very strong criticisms of my part - or alleged part - in what has happened in Cuba.', 'He points to the fact that I visited Cuba while Mr. Batista was in power there.', "I can only point out that if we are going to judge the Administrations in terms of our attitude toward dictators, we're glad to have a comparison with the previous administration."]
dialogue: Now Senator Kennedy has made some very strong criticisms of my part - or alleged part - in what has happened in Cuba. He points to the fact that I visited Cuba while Mr. Batista was in power there. I can only point out that if we are going to judge the Administrations in terms of our attitude toward dictators, we're glad to have a comparison with the previous administration.
snippet_sentences: ['There were eleven dictators in South America and in Central America when we came in, in 1953.', 'Today there are only three left including the one in Cuba.']
snippet: There were eleven dictators in South America and in Central America when we came in, in 1953. Today there are only three left including the one in Cuba.

dialogue_sentences: ['In fact, it would be deflationary; it would cause great unemployment; it would cause a real slowdown in our economy.', 'If it ever becomes necessary, and is wise economically and essential to our security, I would have no hesitancy in suggesting a tax increase or any other policy which would defend the United States.', "I have talked in every speech about the fact that these are going to be very difficult times in the nineteen-sixties and that we're going to have to meet our responsibilities as citizens."]
dialogue: In fact, it would be deflationary; it would cause great unemployment; it would cause a real slowdown in our economy. If it ever becomes necessary, and is wise economically and essential to our security, I would have no hesitancy in suggesting a tax increase or any other policy which would defend the United States. I have talked in every speech about the fact that these are going to be very difficult times in the nineteen-sixties and that we're going to have to meet our responsibilities as citizens.
snippet_sentences: ["I'm talking about a national mood."]
snippet: I'm talking about a national mood.

dialogue_sentences: ['If it ever becomes necessary, and is wise economically and essential to our security, I would have no hesitancy in suggesting a tax increase or any other policy which would defend the United States.', "I have talked in every speech about the fact that these are going to be very difficult times in the nineteen-sixties and that we're going to have to meet our responsibilities as citizens.", "I'm talking about a national mood."]
dialogue: If it ever becomes necessary, and is wise economically and essential to our security, I would have no hesitancy in suggesting a tax increase or any other policy which would defend the United States. I have talked in every speech about the fact that these are going to be very difficult times in the nineteen-sixties and that we're going to have to meet our responsibilities as citizens. I'm talking about a national mood.
snippet_sentences: ["I'm talking about our willingness to bear any burdens in order to maintain our own freedom and in order to meet our freedom around the globe."]
snippet: I'm talking about our willingness to bear any burdens in order to maintain our own freedom and in order to meet our freedom around the globe.

dialogue_sentences: ['I hope not.', "I hope we can economize elsewhere so that we don't have to.", 'But I would have no hesitation to ask the American people to pay the taxes even in l961 - if necessary - to maintain a sound economy and also to maintain a sound dollar.']
dialogue: I hope not. I hope we can economize elsewhere so that we don't have to. But I would have no hesitation to ask the American people to pay the taxes even in l961 - if necessary - to maintain a sound economy and also to maintain a sound dollar.
snippet_sentences: ['Because when you do not tax, and tax enough to pay for your outgo, you pay it many times over in higher prices and inflation; and I simply will not do that.']
snippet: Because when you do not tax, and tax enough to pay for your outgo, you pay it many times over in higher prices and inflation; and I simply will not do that.

dialogue_sentences: ['Now incidentally, I should point out here that Senator Kennedy has attacked our foreign policy.', "He's said that it's been a policy that has led to defeat and retreat.", "And I'd like to know where have we been defeated and where have we retreated?"]
dialogue: Now incidentally, I should point out here that Senator Kennedy has attacked our foreign policy. He's said that it's been a policy that has led to defeat and retreat. And I'd like to know where have we been defeated and where have we retreated?
snippet_sentences: ['In the Truman Administration, six hundred million people went behind the Iron Curtain including the satellite countries of Eastern Europe and Communist China.']
snippet: In the Truman Administration, six hundred million people went behind the Iron Curtain including the satellite countries of Eastern Europe and Communist China.

dialogue_sentences: ["I think this is very harmful at a time Mr. Khrushchev is here - harmful because it's wrong.", "I don't think it was helpful when he suggested - and I'm glad he's corrected this to an extent - that seventeen million people go to bed hungry every night in the United States.", "Now this just wasn't true."]
dialogue: I think this is very harmful at a time Mr. Khrushchev is here - harmful because it's wrong. I don't think it was helpful when he suggested - and I'm glad he's corrected this to an extent - that seventeen million people go to bed hungry every night in the United States. Now this just wasn't true.
snippet_sentences: ['Now, there are people who go to bed hungry in the United States - far less, incidentally, than used to go to bed hungry when we came into power at the end of the Truman Administration.']
snippet: Now, there are people who go to bed hungry in the United States - far less, incidentally, than used to go to bed hungry when we came into power at the end of the Truman Administration.

dialogue_sentences: ['The Nationalists have these two islands.', 'We should not uh - force our Nationalist allies to get off of them and give them to the Communists.', "If we do that we start a chain reaction; because the Communists aren't after Quemoy and Matsu, they're a- they're after Formosa."]
dialogue: The Nationalists have these two islands. We should not uh - force our Nationalist allies to get off of them and give them to the Communists. If we do that we start a chain reaction; because the Communists aren't after Quemoy and Matsu, they're a- they're after Formosa.
snippet_sentences: ['In my opinion this is the same kind of woolly thinking that led to disaster for America in Korea.']
snippet: In my opinion this is the same kind of woolly thinking that led to disaster for America in Korea.

dialogue_sentences: ["We have never said flatly that we will defend Quemoy and Matsu if it's attacked.", "We say we will defend it if it's part of a general attack on Formosa.", "But it's extremely difficult to make that judgment."]
dialogue: We have never said flatly that we will defend Quemoy and Matsu if it's attacked. We say we will defend it if it's part of a general attack on Formosa. But it's extremely difficult to make that judgment.
snippet_sentences: ['Now, Mr. Herter in 1958, when he was Under Secretary of State, said they were strategically undefensible.']
snippet: Now, Mr. Herter in 1958, when he was Under Secretary of State, said they were strategically undefensible.

dialogue_sentences: ["We say we will defend it if it's part of a general attack on Formosa.", "But it's extremely difficult to make that judgment.", 'Now, Mr. Herter in 1958, when he was Under Secretary of State, said they were strategically undefensible.']
dialogue: We say we will defend it if it's part of a general attack on Formosa. But it's extremely difficult to make that judgment. Now, Mr. Herter in 1958, when he was Under Secretary of State, said they were strategically undefensible.
snippet_sentences: ['Admirals Spruance and Callins in 1955 said that we should not attempt to defend these islands, in their conference in the Far East.']
snippet: Admirals Spruance and Callins in 1955 said that we should not attempt to defend these islands, in their conference in the Far East.

dialogue_sentences: ["But it's extremely difficult to make that judgment.", 'Now, Mr. Herter in 1958, when he was Under Secretary of State, said they were strategically undefensible.', 'Admirals Spruance and Callins in 1955 said that we should not attempt to defend these islands, in their conference in the Far East.']
dialogue: But it's extremely difficult to make that judgment. Now, Mr. Herter in 1958, when he was Under Secretary of State, said they were strategically undefensible. Admirals Spruance and Callins in 1955 said that we should not attempt to defend these islands, in their conference in the Far East.
snippet_sentences: ['General Ridgway has said the same thing.']
snippet: General Ridgway has said the same thing.

dialogue_sentences: ['I believe we should be stronger than we now are.', 'I believe we should have a stronger military force.', 'I believe we should increase our strength all over the world.']
dialogue: I believe we should be stronger than we now are. I believe we should have a stronger military force. I believe we should increase our strength all over the world.
snippet_sentences: ["But I don't confuse words with strength; and in my judgment if the summit was useful, if it would have brought us closer to peace, that rather than the lie that we told - which has been criticized by all responsible people afterwards - it would have been far better for us to follow the common diplomatic procedure of expressing regrets and then try to move on."]
snippet: But I don't confuse words with strength; and in my judgment if the summit was useful, if it would have brought us closer to peace, that rather than the lie that we told - which has been criticized by all responsible people afterwards - it would have been far better for us to follow the common diplomatic procedure of expressing regrets and then try to move on.

dialogue_sentences: ['And when I speak of presidential leadership, I refer for example to our attitude on the sit-in strikes.', 'Here we have a situation which causes all of us concern - causes us concern because of the denial of the rights of people to the equality which we think belongs to everybody.', 'I have talked to Negro mothers.']
dialogue: And when I speak of presidential leadership, I refer for example to our attitude on the sit-in strikes. Here we have a situation which causes all of us concern - causes us concern because of the denial of the rights of people to the equality which we think belongs to everybody. I have talked to Negro mothers.
snippet_sentences: ["I've heard them explain - try to explain - how they tell their children how they can go into a store and buy a loaf of bread but then can't go into that store and sit at the counter and get a Coca Cola."]
snippet: I've heard them explain - try to explain - how they tell their children how they can go into a store and buy a loaf of bread but then can't go into that store and sit at the counter and get a Coca Cola.

dialogue_sentences: ['So, under the circumstances, what do we do?', 'Well what we do is what the Attorney-General of the United States did under the direction of the President: call in the owners of chain stores and get them to take action.', "Now there are other places where the executive can lead, but let me just sum up by saying this: why do I talk every time I'm in the South on civil rights?"]
dialogue: So, under the circumstances, what do we do? Well what we do is what the Attorney-General of the United States did under the direction of the President: call in the owners of chain stores and get them to take action. Now there are other places where the executive can lead, but let me just sum up by saying this: why do I talk every time I'm in the South on civil rights?
snippet_sentences: ["Not because I am preaching to the people of the South because this isn't just a Southern problem; it's a Northern problem and a Western problem; it's a problem for all of us."]
snippet: Not because I am preaching to the people of the South because this isn't just a Southern problem; it's a Northern problem and a Western problem; it's a problem for all of us.

dialogue_sentences: ['I would hope an incident like that would not happen.', "I think if the president is responsible, if he consults with those involved, if he makes it clear that the Supreme Court decision is going to be carried out in a way that the Supreme Court planned - with deliberate speed - then in my judgment, providing he's behind action, I believe we can make uh - progress.", 'Now the present Administration - the President - has said - never indicated what he thought of the 1954 decision.']
dialogue: I would hope an incident like that would not happen. I think if the president is responsible, if he consults with those involved, if he makes it clear that the Supreme Court decision is going to be carried out in a way that the Supreme Court planned - with deliberate speed - then in my judgment, providing he's behind action, I believe we can make uh - progress. Now the present Administration - the President - has said - never indicated what he thought of the 1954 decision.
snippet_sentences: ['Unless the president speaks, then of course uh - the country doesn\'t speak, and Franklin Roosevelt said: "The pre - uh - the presidency of the United States is above all a place of moral leadership."']
snippet: Unless the president speaks, then of course uh - the country doesn't speak, and Franklin Roosevelt said: "The pre - uh - the presidency of the United States is above all a place of moral leadership."

dialogue_sentences: ['We need all the talent we can get.', 'We sit on a conspicuous stage.', 'We are a goldfish bowl before the world.']
dialogue: We need all the talent we can get. We sit on a conspicuous stage. We are a goldfish bowl before the world.
snippet_sentences: ['We have to practice what we preach.']
snippet: We have to practice what we preach.

dialogue_sentences: ['I selected a man who stands with me in this field and who will talk with me and work with me on it.', 'Now the Senator referred to the Committee on Government Contracts.', "And yet that very committee of which I am chairman has been handicapped by the fact that we have not had adequate funds; we have not had adequate powers; we haven't had an adequate staff."]
dialogue: I selected a man who stands with me in this field and who will talk with me and work with me on it. Now the Senator referred to the Committee on Government Contracts. And yet that very committee of which I am chairman has been handicapped by the fact that we have not had adequate funds; we have not had adequate powers; we haven't had an adequate staff.
snippet_sentences: ["Now in the special session of Congress and also in the session that preceded it, the Democratic Congress - in which there's a two-to-one Democratic majority - was asked by the President to give us the funds and give us the power to do a job and they did nothing at all, And in the special session in which Senator Kennedy was calling the signals, along with Senator Johnson, they turned it down and he himself voted against giving us the powers despite the fact that the bill had already been considered before, that it already had hearings on, and the Congress already knew what it had before it."]
snippet: Now in the special session of Congress and also in the session that preceded it, the Democratic Congress - in which there's a two-to-one Democratic majority - was asked by the President to give us the funds and give us the power to do a job and they did nothing at all, And in the special session in which Senator Kennedy was calling the signals, along with Senator Johnson, they turned it down and he himself voted against giving us the powers despite the fact that the bill had already been considered before, that it already had hearings on, and the Congress already knew what it had before it.

dialogue_sentences: ["Mr. Morgan, no matter how well we're doing in the cold war, we're not doing as well as we should."]
dialogue: Mr. Morgan, no matter how well we're doing in the cold war, we're not doing as well as we should.
snippet_sentences: ['And that will always be the case as long as the Communists are on the international scene, in the aggressive tac- uh - tendencies that they presently are following.']
snippet: And that will always be the case as long as the Communists are on the international scene, in the aggressive tac- uh - tendencies that they presently are following.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'd like to point out that in the last six years, the Democratic Congresses, of which he'd been a member, have cut twenty million dollars off of the Voice of America programs.", 'They also have cut four billion dollars off of mutual security in these last six years.', 'Now when they talk about our record here, it is well that they recognize that they have to stand up for their record as well.']
dialogue: I'd like to point out that in the last six years, the Democratic Congresses, of which he'd been a member, have cut twenty million dollars off of the Voice of America programs. They also have cut four billion dollars off of mutual security in these last six years. Now when they talk about our record here, it is well that they recognize that they have to stand up for their record as well.
snippet_sentences: ["So let me summarize by saying this: I'm not satisfied with what we're doing in the cold war because I believe we have to step up our activities and launch an offensive for the minds and hearts and souls of men."]
snippet: So let me summarize by saying this: I'm not satisfied with what we're doing in the cold war because I believe we have to step up our activities and launch an offensive for the minds and hearts and souls of men.

dialogue_sentences: ['Last year there were twenty-nine and tomorrow when the preliminary vote is held you will see a strengthening of that position or very closely to it.', 'We have not maintained our position and our prestige.', 'A Gallup Poll taken in February of this year asking the - in eight out of nine countries - they asked the people, who do they think would be ahead by 1970 militarily and scientifically, and a majority in eight of the nine countries said the Soviet Union would be by 1970.']
dialogue: Last year there were twenty-nine and tomorrow when the preliminary vote is held you will see a strengthening of that position or very closely to it. We have not maintained our position and our prestige. A Gallup Poll taken in February of this year asking the - in eight out of nine countries - they asked the people, who do they think would be ahead by 1970 militarily and scientifically, and a majority in eight of the nine countries said the Soviet Union would be by 1970.
snippet_sentences: ['Governor Rockefeller has been far more critical in June of our position in the world than I have been.']
snippet: Governor Rockefeller has been far more critical in June of our position in the world than I have been.

dialogue_sentences: ['Now Senator Kennedy a moment ago referred to the fact that there was not an adequate Voice of America program for Latin America.', "I'd like to point out that in the last six years, the Democratic Congresses, of which he'd been a member, have cut twenty million dollars off of the Voice of America programs.", 'They also have cut four billion dollars off of mutual security in these last six years.']
dialogue: Now Senator Kennedy a moment ago referred to the fact that there was not an adequate Voice of America program for Latin America. I'd like to point out that in the last six years, the Democratic Congresses, of which he'd been a member, have cut twenty million dollars off of the Voice of America programs. They also have cut four billion dollars off of mutual security in these last six years.
snippet_sentences: ['Now when they talk about our record here, it is well that they recognize that they have to stand up for their record as well.']
snippet: Now when they talk about our record here, it is well that they recognize that they have to stand up for their record as well.

snippet_sentences: ['We have been wholly indifferent to Latin America until the last few months.']
snippet: We have been wholly indifferent to Latin America until the last few months.

dialogue_sentences: ['I believe we can do it.', 'If we build our economy the way we should, we can afford to do these things and we must do it.', 'Senator Kennedy has put a great deal of stress on the necessity for economic assistance.']
dialogue: I believe we can do it. If we build our economy the way we should, we can afford to do these things and we must do it. Senator Kennedy has put a great deal of stress on the necessity for economic assistance.
snippet_sentences: ["But it's also tremendously important to bear in mind that when you pour in money without pouring in technical assistance at w- as well, that you have a disastrous situation."]
snippet: But it's also tremendously important to bear in mind that when you pour in money without pouring in technical assistance at w- as well, that you have a disastrous situation.

dialogue_sentences: ['This we must get across to the world.', "And we can't do it unless we do have adequate funds for, for example, information which has been cut by the Congress, adequate funds for technical assistance.", 'The other point that I would make with regard to economic assistance and technical assistance is that the United States must not rest its case here alone.']
dialogue: This we must get across to the world. And we can't do it unless we do have adequate funds for, for example, information which has been cut by the Congress, adequate funds for technical assistance. The other point that I would make with regard to economic assistance and technical assistance is that the United States must not rest its case here alone.
snippet_sentences: ['This is primarily an ideological battle - a battle for the minds and the hearts and the souls of men.']
snippet: This is primarily an ideological battle - a battle for the minds and the hearts and the souls of men.

dialogue_sentences: ['To combat unemployment we first must concentrate on the very areas to which you refer - the so-called depressed areas.']
dialogue: To combat unemployment we first must concentrate on the very areas to which you refer - the so-called depressed areas.
snippet_sentences: ['Now in the last Congress - the special session of the Congress - there was a bill: one by the President, one by Senator Kennedy and members of his party.', 'Now the bill that the President had submitted would have provided more aid for those areas that really need it - areas like Scranton and Wilkes-Barre and the areas of West Virginia - than the ones that Senator Kennedy was supporting.', 'On the other hand we found that the bill got into the legislative difficulties and consequently no action was taken.']
snippet: Now in the last Congress - the special session of the Congress - there was a bill: one by the President, one by Senator Kennedy and members of his party. Now the bill that the President had submitted would have provided more aid for those areas that really need it - areas like Scranton and Wilkes-Barre and the areas of West Virginia - than the ones that Senator Kennedy was supporting. On the other hand we found that the bill got into the legislative difficulties and consequently no action was taken.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's the great issue.", 'President Eisenhower moves from the scene on January twentieth and the next four years are the critical years.', "And that's the debate."]
dialogue: That's the great issue. President Eisenhower moves from the scene on January twentieth and the next four years are the critical years. And that's the debate.
snippet_sentences: ["That's the argument between Mr. Nixon and myself and on that issue the American people have to make their judgment and I think it's a important judgment."]
snippet: That's the argument between Mr. Nixon and myself and on that issue the American people have to make their judgment and I think it's a important judgment.

dialogue_sentences: ['But what does he offer?', 'He offers retreads of programs that failed.', 'I submit to you that as you look at his programs, his program for example with regard to the Federal Reserve and uh - free money or loose money uh - high - low interest rates, his program in the economic field generally are the programs that were adopted and tried during the Truman Administration.']
dialogue: But what does he offer? He offers retreads of programs that failed. I submit to you that as you look at his programs, his program for example with regard to the Federal Reserve and uh - free money or loose money uh - high - low interest rates, his program in the economic field generally are the programs that were adopted and tried during the Truman Administration.
snippet_sentences: ['And when we compare the economic progress of this country in the Truman Administration with that of the Eisenhower Administration, we find that in every index there has been a tr- great deal more performance and more progress in this Administration than in that one.']
snippet: And when we compare the economic progress of this country in the Truman Administration with that of the Eisenhower Administration, we find that in every index there has been a tr- great deal more performance and more progress in this Administration than in that one.

dialogue_sentences: ["We've been uh - having a very clear decision in the last eight years.", 'Mr. Nixon has been part of that Administration.', "He's had experience in it."]
dialogue: We've been uh - having a very clear decision in the last eight years. Mr. Nixon has been part of that Administration. He's had experience in it.
snippet_sentences: ["And I believe this Administration has not met its responsibilities in the last eight years, that our power relative to that of the Communists is declining, that we're facing a very hazardous time in the sixties, and unless the United States begin to move here - unless we start to go ahead - I don't believe that we're going to meet our responsibility to our own people or to the cause of freedom."]
snippet: And I believe this Administration has not met its responsibilities in the last eight years, that our power relative to that of the Communists is declining, that we're facing a very hazardous time in the sixties, and unless the United States begin to move here - unless we start to go ahead - I don't believe that we're going to meet our responsibility to our own people or to the cause of freedom.

dialogue_sentences: ['Now the next president of the United States in his first year is going to be confronted with a very serious question on our defense of Berlin, our commitment to Berlin.', "It's going to be a test of our nerve and will.", "It's going to be a test of our strength."]
dialogue: Now the next president of the United States in his first year is going to be confronted with a very serious question on our defense of Berlin, our commitment to Berlin. It's going to be a test of our nerve and will. It's going to be a test of our strength.
snippet_sentences: ["And because we're going to move in sixty-one and two, partly because we have not maintained our strength with sufficient vigor in the last years, I believe that before we meet that crisis, that the next president of the United States should send a message to Congress asking for a revitalization of our military strength, because come spring or late in the winter we're going to be face to face with the most serious Berlin crisis since l949 or fifty."]
snippet: And because we're going to move in sixty-one and two, partly because we have not maintained our strength with sufficient vigor in the last years, I believe that before we meet that crisis, that the next president of the United States should send a message to Congress asking for a revitalization of our military strength, because come spring or late in the winter we're going to be face to face with the most serious Berlin crisis since l949 or fifty.

dialogue_sentences: ['Concern about Iraq specifically focused on the fact that Saddam Hussein had been, for years, listed on the state sponsor of terror, that they he had established relationships with Abu Nidal, who operated out of Baghdad; he paid $25,000 to the families of suicide bombers; and he had an established relationship with Al Qaida.', "Specifically, look at George Tenet, the CIA director's testimony before the Committee on Foreign Relations two years ago when he talked about a 10-year relationship.", "The effort that we've mounted with respect to Iraq focused specifically on the possibility that this was the most likely nexus between the terrorists and weapons of mass destruction."]
dialogue: Concern about Iraq specifically focused on the fact that Saddam Hussein had been, for years, listed on the state sponsor of terror, that they he had established relationships with Abu Nidal, who operated out of Baghdad; he paid $25,000 to the families of suicide bombers; and he had an established relationship with Al Qaida. Specifically, look at George Tenet, the CIA director's testimony before the Committee on Foreign Relations two years ago when he talked about a 10-year relationship. The effort that we've mounted with respect to Iraq focused specifically on the possibility that this was the most likely nexus between the terrorists and weapons of mass destruction.
snippet_sentences: ['The biggest threat we faced today is the possibility of terrorists smuggling a nuclear weapon or a biological agent into one of our own cities and threatening the lives of hundreds of thousands of Americans.']
snippet: The biggest threat we faced today is the possibility of terrorists smuggling a nuclear weapon or a biological agent into one of our own cities and threatening the lives of hundreds of thousands of Americans.

dialogue_sentences: ['We had the 10th Mountain Division up in Uzbekistan available.', 'We had the finest military in the world on the ground.', 'And what did we do?']
dialogue: We had the 10th Mountain Division up in Uzbekistan available. We had the finest military in the world on the ground. And what did we do?
snippet_sentences: ['We turned -- this is the man who masterminded the greatest mass murder and terrorist attack in American history.']
snippet: We turned -- this is the man who masterminded the greatest mass murder and terrorist attack in American history.

dialogue_sentences: ['And, in fact, any connection with Al Qaida is tenuous at best.', 'The senator has got his facts wrong.', "I have not suggested there's a connection between Iraq and 9/11, but there's clearly an established Iraqi track record with terror."]
dialogue: And, in fact, any connection with Al Qaida is tenuous at best. The senator has got his facts wrong. I have not suggested there's a connection between Iraq and 9/11, but there's clearly an established Iraqi track record with terror.
snippet_sentences: ["And the point is that that's the place where you're most likely to see the terrorists come together with weapons of mass destruction, the deadly technologies that Saddam Hussein had developed and used over the years."]
snippet: And the point is that that's the place where you're most likely to see the terrorists come together with weapons of mass destruction, the deadly technologies that Saddam Hussein had developed and used over the years.

dialogue_sentences: ["We've captured or killed thousands of Al Qaida in various places around the world and especially in Afghanistan.", "We'll continue to very aggressively pursue him, and I'm confident eventually we'll get him.", "The key to success in Afghanistan has been, again, to go in and go after the terrorists, which we've done, and also take down the Taliban regime which allowed them to function there, in effect sponsors, if you will, of the Al Qaida organization."]
dialogue: We've captured or killed thousands of Al Qaida in various places around the world and especially in Afghanistan. We'll continue to very aggressively pursue him, and I'm confident eventually we'll get him. The key to success in Afghanistan has been, again, to go in and go after the terrorists, which we've done, and also take down the Taliban regime which allowed them to function there, in effect sponsors, if you will, of the Al Qaida organization.
snippet_sentences: ['John Edwards, two and a half years ago, six months after we went into Afghanistan announced that it was chaotic, the situation was deteriorating, the warlords were about to take over.']
snippet: John Edwards, two and a half years ago, six months after we went into Afghanistan announced that it was chaotic, the situation was deteriorating, the warlords were about to take over.

dialogue_sentences: ['He also said very clearly that he will never give any country veto power over the security of the United States of America.', "Now, I know the vice president would like to pretend that wasn't said, and the president would too.", 'But the reality is it was said.']
dialogue: He also said very clearly that he will never give any country veto power over the security of the United States of America. Now, I know the vice president would like to pretend that wasn't said, and the president would too. But the reality is it was said.
snippet_sentences: ["Here's what's actually happened in Afghanistan, regardless of this rosy scenario that they paint on Afghanistan, just like they do with Iraq."]
snippet: Here's what's actually happened in Afghanistan, regardless of this rosy scenario that they paint on Afghanistan, just like they do with Iraq.

dialogue_sentences: ['And it will apply in Afghanistan, and it will apply as well in Iraq.', 'The vice president just said that we should focus on state sponsors of terrorism.', 'Iran has moved forward with its nuclear weapons program.']
dialogue: And it will apply in Afghanistan, and it will apply as well in Iraq. The vice president just said that we should focus on state sponsors of terrorism. Iran has moved forward with its nuclear weapons program.
snippet_sentences: ["They're more dangerous today than they were four years ago."]
snippet: They're more dangerous today than they were four years ago.

dialogue_sentences: ['Iran has moved forward with its nuclear weapons program.', "They're more dangerous today than they were four years ago.", 'North Korea has moved forward with their nuclear weapons program, gone from one to two nuclear weapons to six to eight nuclear weapons.']
dialogue: Iran has moved forward with its nuclear weapons program. They're more dangerous today than they were four years ago. North Korea has moved forward with their nuclear weapons program, gone from one to two nuclear weapons to six to eight nuclear weapons.
snippet_sentences: ['This vice president has been an advocate for over a decade for lifting sanctions against Iran, the largest state sponsor of terrorism on the planet.']
snippet: This vice president has been an advocate for over a decade for lifting sanctions against Iran, the largest state sponsor of terrorism on the planet.

dialogue_sentences: ["You're not credible on Iraq because of the enormous inconsistencies that John Kerry and you have cited time after time after time during the course of the campaign.", "Whatever the political pressures of the moment requires, that's where you're at.", "But you've not been consistent, and there's no indication at all that John Kerry has the conviction to successfully carry through on the war on terror."]
dialogue: You're not credible on Iraq because of the enormous inconsistencies that John Kerry and you have cited time after time after time during the course of the campaign. Whatever the political pressures of the moment requires, that's where you're at. But you've not been consistent, and there's no indication at all that John Kerry has the conviction to successfully carry through on the war on terror.
snippet_sentences: ['What the vice president has just said is just a complete distortion.']
snippet: What the vice president has just said is just a complete distortion.

dialogue_sentences: ['And, after 9/11, it became clear that we had to do several things to have a successful strategy to win the global war on terror, specifically that we had to go after the terrorists wherever we might find them, that we also had to go after state sponsors of terror, those who might provide sanctuary or safe harbor for terror.', 'And we also then finally had to stand up democracies in their stead afterwards, because that was the only way to guarantee that these states would not again become safe harbors for terror or for the development of deadly weapons.', 'Concern about Iraq specifically focused on the fact that Saddam Hussein had been, for years, listed on the state sponsor of terror, that they he had established relationships with Abu Nidal, who operated out of Baghdad; he paid $25,000 to the families of suicide bombers; and he had an established relationship with Al Qaida.']
dialogue: And, after 9/11, it became clear that we had to do several things to have a successful strategy to win the global war on terror, specifically that we had to go after the terrorists wherever we might find them, that we also had to go after state sponsors of terror, those who might provide sanctuary or safe harbor for terror. And we also then finally had to stand up democracies in their stead afterwards, because that was the only way to guarantee that these states would not again become safe harbors for terror or for the development of deadly weapons. Concern about Iraq specifically focused on the fact that Saddam Hussein had been, for years, listed on the state sponsor of terror, that they he had established relationships with Abu Nidal, who operated out of Baghdad; he paid $25,000 to the families of suicide bombers; and he had an established relationship with Al Qaida.
snippet_sentences: ["Specifically, look at George Tenet, the CIA director's testimony before the Committee on Foreign Relations two years ago when he talked about a 10-year relationship."]
snippet: Specifically, look at George Tenet, the CIA director's testimony before the Committee on Foreign Relations two years ago when he talked about a 10-year relationship.

dialogue_sentences: ['The truth is, our men and women in uniform have been heroic.', "Our military has done everything they've been asked to do.", "And it's not just me that sees the mess in Iraq."]
dialogue: The truth is, our men and women in uniform have been heroic. Our military has done everything they've been asked to do. And it's not just me that sees the mess in Iraq.
snippet_sentences: ["There are Republican leaders, like John McCain, like Richard Lugar, like Chuck Hagel, who have said Iraq is a mess and it's getting worse."]
snippet: There are Republican leaders, like John McCain, like Richard Lugar, like Chuck Hagel, who have said Iraq is a mess and it's getting worse.

dialogue_sentences: ['What the vice president has just said is just a complete distortion.', 'The American people saw John Kerry on Thursday night.', "They don't need the vice president or the president to tell them what they saw."]
dialogue: What the vice president has just said is just a complete distortion. The American people saw John Kerry on Thursday night. They don't need the vice president or the president to tell them what they saw.
snippet_sentences: ['They saw a man who was strong, who had conviction, who is resolute, who made it very clear that he will do everything that has to be done to find terrorists, to keep the American people safe.']
snippet: They saw a man who was strong, who had conviction, who is resolute, who made it very clear that he will do everything that has to be done to find terrorists, to keep the American people safe.

dialogue_sentences: ['They saw a man who was strong, who had conviction, who is resolute, who made it very clear that he will do everything that has to be done to find terrorists, to keep the American people safe.', 'He laid out his plan for success in Iraq, made it clear that we were committed to success in Iraq.', 'We have to be, because we have troops on the ground there and because they have created a haven for terrorists.']
dialogue: They saw a man who was strong, who had conviction, who is resolute, who made it very clear that he will do everything that has to be done to find terrorists, to keep the American people safe. He laid out his plan for success in Iraq, made it clear that we were committed to success in Iraq. We have to be, because we have troops on the ground there and because they have created a haven for terrorists.
snippet_sentences: ['Your rhetoric, Senator, would be a lot more credible if there was a record to back it up.', "There isn't."]
snippet: Your rhetoric, Senator, would be a lot more credible if there was a record to back it up. There isn't.

dialogue_sentences: ["And the point is that that's the place where you're most likely to see the terrorists come together with weapons of mass destruction, the deadly technologies that Saddam Hussein had developed and used over the years.", 'Now, the fact of the matter is, the big difference here, Gwen, is they are not prepared to deal with states that sponsor terror.', "They've got a very limited view about how to use U. S. military forces to defend America."]
dialogue: And the point is that that's the place where you're most likely to see the terrorists come together with weapons of mass destruction, the deadly technologies that Saddam Hussein had developed and used over the years. Now, the fact of the matter is, the big difference here, Gwen, is they are not prepared to deal with states that sponsor terror. They've got a very limited view about how to use U. S. military forces to defend America.
snippet_sentences: ['We heard Senator Kerry say the other night that there ought to be some kind of global test before U. S. troops are deployed preemptively to protect the United States.', "That's part of a track record that goes back to the 1970s when he ran for Congress the first time and said troops should not be deployed without U. N. approval.", "Then, in the mid-'80s, he ran on the basis of cutting most of our major defense programs.", 'In 1991, he voted against Desert Storm.', "It's a consistent pattern over time of always being on the wrong side of defense issues."]
snippet: We heard Senator Kerry say the other night that there ought to be some kind of global test before U. S. troops are deployed preemptively to protect the United States. That's part of a track record that goes back to the 1970s when he ran for Congress the first time and said troops should not be deployed without U. N. approval. Then, in the mid-'80s, he ran on the basis of cutting most of our major defense programs. In 1991, he voted against Desert Storm. It's a consistent pattern over time of always being on the wrong side of defense issues.

dialogue_sentences: ['But the key here is not to try to solve the problems in Iraq by putting in more American troops.', 'The key is to get the Iraqis to take on the responsibility for their own security.', "That's exactly what we're doing."]
dialogue: But the key here is not to try to solve the problems in Iraq by putting in more American troops. The key is to get the Iraqis to take on the responsibility for their own security. That's exactly what we're doing.
snippet_sentences: ["If you put American troops in there in larger number and don't get the Iraqis into the fight, you'll postpone the day when you can in fact bring our boys home."]
snippet: If you put American troops in there in larger number and don't get the Iraqis into the fight, you'll postpone the day when you can in fact bring our boys home.

dialogue_sentences: ['They had a choice on negotiating discounts in the Medicare prescription drug bill of being with the American people or with the drug companies.', "They had a choice on the patients' bill of rights, allowing people to make their own health care decisions and not having insurance companies make them, be with the American people, be with the big insurance companies.", "They're with the insurance companies."]
dialogue: They had a choice on negotiating discounts in the Medicare prescription drug bill of being with the American people or with the drug companies. They had a choice on the patients' bill of rights, allowing people to make their own health care decisions and not having insurance companies make them, be with the American people, be with the big insurance companies. They're with the insurance companies.
snippet_sentences: ['John Kerry and I will always fight for the American people.']
snippet: John Kerry and I will always fight for the American people.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well, first of all, let me say that John Kerry has -- I can use his name now?', 'OK. John Kerry has been, as have I, been completely consistent about Iraq.', "We've made very clear from the beginning -- and not an afterthought; we said it at the time -- that we had to confront Saddam Hussein and that we had to have a coalition and a plan to be successful."]
dialogue: Well, first of all, let me say that John Kerry has -- I can use his name now? OK. John Kerry has been, as have I, been completely consistent about Iraq. We've made very clear from the beginning -- and not an afterthought; we said it at the time -- that we had to confront Saddam Hussein and that we had to have a coalition and a plan to be successful.
snippet_sentences: ["And the vice president didn't say much about it in your earlier question, but Paul Bremer has now made clear that they didn't have enough troops and they didn't have a plan."]
snippet: And the vice president didn't say much about it in your earlier question, but Paul Bremer has now made clear that they didn't have enough troops and they didn't have a plan.

dialogue_sentences: ['So there are some Democrats who agree with our approach.', "And hopefully in a second term, we'll see an improvement along those lines.", 'The president said that he would unite this country, that he was a uniter, not a divider.']

snippet: Have you ever seen America more divided? Have you ever seen Washington more divided? The reality is it is not an accident.

dialogue_sentences: ["It'll provide prescription drug benefits to 40 million senior citizens.", "It's a very, very significant piece of legislation.", 'They had a choice on allowing prescription drugs into this country from Canada, of being with the American people or with the drug companies.']

snippet: They were with the drug companies.

dialogue_sentences: ['Thank you.', 'Thank you.', "I'm saying specifically that I don't believe he has the qualities we need in a commander in chief because I don't think, based on his record, that he would pursue the kind of aggressive policies that need to be pursued if we're going to defeat these terrorists."]
dialogue: Thank you. Thank you. I'm saying specifically that I don't believe he has the qualities we need in a commander in chief because I don't think, based on his record, that he would pursue the kind of aggressive policies that need to be pursued if we're going to defeat these terrorists.
snippet_sentences: ["We need to battle them overseas so we don't have to battle them here at home."]
snippet: We need to battle them overseas so we don't have to battle them here at home.

dialogue_sentences: ['We know that when we went into Afghanistan that he then migrated to Baghdad.', 'He set up shop in Baghdad, where he oversaw the poisons facility up at Khurmal (ph), where the terrorists were developing ricin and other deadly substances to use.', "We know he's still in Baghdad today."]
dialogue: We know that when we went into Afghanistan that he then migrated to Baghdad. He set up shop in Baghdad, where he oversaw the poisons facility up at Khurmal (ph), where the terrorists were developing ricin and other deadly substances to use. We know he's still in Baghdad today.
snippet_sentences: ['He is responsible for most of the major car bombings that have killed or maimed thousands of people.']
snippet: He is responsible for most of the major car bombings that have killed or maimed thousands of people.

dialogue_sentences: ['He set up shop in Baghdad, where he oversaw the poisons facility up at Khurmal (ph), where the terrorists were developing ricin and other deadly substances to use.', "We know he's still in Baghdad today.", 'He is responsible for most of the major car bombings that have killed or maimed thousands of people.']
dialogue: He set up shop in Baghdad, where he oversaw the poisons facility up at Khurmal (ph), where the terrorists were developing ricin and other deadly substances to use. We know he's still in Baghdad today. He is responsible for most of the major car bombings that have killed or maimed thousands of people.
snippet_sentences: ["He's the one you will see on the evening news beheading hostages."]
snippet: He's the one you will see on the evening news beheading hostages.

dialogue_sentences: ["And his judgment's flawed, and the record's there for anybody who wants to look at it.", 'In 1984, when he ran for the Senate he opposed, or called for the elimination of a great many major weapons systems that were crucial to winning the Cold War and are important today to our overall forces.', "When Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait and occupied it in 1990 and '91, he stood up on the floor of the Senate and voted against going in to liberate Kuwait and push Saddam Hussein back to Iraq."]
dialogue: And his judgment's flawed, and the record's there for anybody who wants to look at it. In 1984, when he ran for the Senate he opposed, or called for the elimination of a great many major weapons systems that were crucial to winning the Cold War and are important today to our overall forces. When Saddam Hussein invaded Kuwait and occupied it in 1990 and '91, he stood up on the floor of the Senate and voted against going in to liberate Kuwait and push Saddam Hussein back to Iraq.
snippet_sentences: ["The problem we have is that, if you look at his record, he doesn't display the qualities of somebody who has conviction."]
snippet: The problem we have is that, if you look at his record, he doesn't display the qualities of somebody who has conviction.

dialogue_sentences: ['Now, the vice president, as you pointed out, spoke out loudly for lifting the sanctions on Iraq.', 'John Kerry and I believe we need to strengthen the sanctions on Iraq, including closing the loophole that allows companies to use a subsidiary, offshore subsidiaries to do business with Iran.', 'I mentioned Halliburton a few minute ago in connection with the $87 billion, and you raised it in this question.']
dialogue: Now, the vice president, as you pointed out, spoke out loudly for lifting the sanctions on Iraq. John Kerry and I believe we need to strengthen the sanctions on Iraq, including closing the loophole that allows companies to use a subsidiary, offshore subsidiaries to do business with Iran. I mentioned Halliburton a few minute ago in connection with the $87 billion, and you raised it in this question.
snippet_sentences: ['This is relevant, because he was pushing for lifting sanctions when he was CEO of Halliburton.']
snippet: This is relevant, because he was pushing for lifting sanctions when he was CEO of Halliburton.

dialogue_sentences: ['I mentioned Halliburton a few minute ago in connection with the $87 billion, and you raised it in this question.', 'This is relevant, because he was pushing for lifting sanctions when he was CEO of Halliburton.', "Here's why we didn't think Halliburton should have a no-bid contract."]
dialogue: I mentioned Halliburton a few minute ago in connection with the $87 billion, and you raised it in this question. This is relevant, because he was pushing for lifting sanctions when he was CEO of Halliburton. Here's why we didn't think Halliburton should have a no-bid contract.
snippet_sentences: ['While he was CEO of Halliburton, they paid millions of dollars in fines for providing false information on their company, just like Enron and Ken Lay.']
snippet: While he was CEO of Halliburton, they paid millions of dollars in fines for providing false information on their company, just like Enron and Ken Lay.

dialogue_sentences: ['We left in the morning, headed to the airport to leave, and later in the day I found out that that same day, not far from where we were staying, the Sbarro Pizzeria was hit by a suicide bomber in Jerusalem.', 'Six children were killed.', 'What are the Israeli people supposed to do?']
dialogue: We left in the morning, headed to the airport to leave, and later in the day I found out that that same day, not far from where we were staying, the Sbarro Pizzeria was hit by a suicide bomber in Jerusalem. Six children were killed. What are the Israeli people supposed to do?
snippet_sentences: ['How can they continue to watch Israeli children killed by suicide bombers, killed by terrorists?']
snippet: How can they continue to watch Israeli children killed by suicide bombers, killed by terrorists?

dialogue_sentences: ["They don't have a partner for peace right now.", "They certainly don't have a partner in Arafat, and they need a legitimate partner for peace.", 'And I might add, it is very important for America to crack down on the Saudis who have not had a public prosecution for financing terrorism since 9/11.']
dialogue: They don't have a partner for peace right now. They certainly don't have a partner in Arafat, and they need a legitimate partner for peace. And I might add, it is very important for America to crack down on the Saudis who have not had a public prosecution for financing terrorism since 9/11.
snippet_sentences: ["And it's important for America to confront the situation in Iran, because Iran is an enormous threat to Israel and to the Israeli people."]
snippet: And it's important for America to confront the situation in Iran, because Iran is an enormous threat to Israel and to the Israeli people.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'm up in the Senate most Tuesdays when they're in session.", 'The first time I ever met you was when you walked on the stage tonight.', 'In respect to Israel and Palestine, Gwen, the suicide bombers, in part, were generated by Saddam Hussein, who paid $25,000 to the families of suicide bombers.']
dialogue: I'm up in the Senate most Tuesdays when they're in session. The first time I ever met you was when you walked on the stage tonight. In respect to Israel and Palestine, Gwen, the suicide bombers, in part, were generated by Saddam Hussein, who paid $25,000 to the families of suicide bombers.
snippet_sentences: ["I personally think one of the reasons that we don't have as many suicide attacks today in Israel as we've had in the past is because Saddam is no longer in business."]
snippet: I personally think one of the reasons that we don't have as many suicide attacks today in Israel as we've had in the past is because Saddam is no longer in business.

dialogue_sentences: ['And I might add, it is very important for America to crack down on the Saudis who have not had a public prosecution for financing terrorism since 9/11.', "And it's important for America to confront the situation in Iran, because Iran is an enormous threat to Israel and to the Israeli people.", "Gwen, I want to go back to the last comment, and then I'll come back to Israel-Palestine."]
dialogue: And I might add, it is very important for America to crack down on the Saudis who have not had a public prosecution for financing terrorism since 9/11. And it's important for America to confront the situation in Iran, because Iran is an enormous threat to Israel and to the Israeli people. Gwen, I want to go back to the last comment, and then I'll come back to Israel-Palestine.
snippet_sentences: ['The reason they keep trying to attack Halliburton is because they want to obscure their own record.']
snippet: The reason they keep trying to attack Halliburton is because they want to obscure their own record.

dialogue_sentences: ['But first, there has to be an interlocutor you can trust and deal with.', 'There has to be reform of the Palestinian system.', "I know that won't come as a shock."]
dialogue: But first, there has to be an interlocutor you can trust and deal with. There has to be reform of the Palestinian system. I know that won't come as a shock.
snippet_sentences: ["The vice president, I'm surprised to hear him talk about records."]
snippet: The vice president, I'm surprised to hear him talk about records.

dialogue_sentences: ["Here's what's happened: In the time that they have been in office, in the last four years, 1.6 million private sector jobs have been lost, 2.7 million manufacturing jobs have been lost.", "And it's had real consequences in places like Cleveland.", "Cleveland is a wonderful, distinguished city that's done a lot of great things, but it has the highest poverty rate in the country."]
dialogue: Here's what's happened: In the time that they have been in office, in the last four years, 1.6 million private sector jobs have been lost, 2.7 million manufacturing jobs have been lost. snippet: One out of almost two children in Cleveland are now living in poverty.

snippet_sentences: ["Here's what's happened: In the time that they have been in office, in the last four years, 1.6 million private sector jobs have been lost, 2.7 million manufacturing jobs have been lost.", "And it's had real consequences in places like Cleveland."]
snippet: Here's what's happened: In the time that they have been in office, in the last four years, 1.6 million private sector jobs have been lost, 2.7 million manufacturing jobs have been lost. And it's had real consequences in places like Cleveland.

dialogue_sentences: ["And it's had real consequences in places like Cleveland.", "Cleveland is a wonderful, distinguished city that's done a lot of great things, but it has the highest poverty rate in the country.", 'One out of almost two children in Cleveland are now living in poverty.']
dialogue: And it's had real consequences in places like Cleveland. Cleveland is a wonderful, distinguished city that's done a lot of great things, but it has the highest poverty rate in the country. One out of almost two children in Cleveland are now living in poverty.

dialogue_sentences: ["Because we will do what they've not done."]
dialogue: Because we will do what they've not done.
snippet_sentences: ["You know, if you look at what's happened over the last four years, we have gone from a $5 trillion projected surplus when George Bush took office to a $3 trillion projected deficit."]
snippet: You know, if you look at what's happened over the last four years, we have gone from a $5 trillion projected surplus when George Bush took office to a $3 trillion projected deficit.

dialogue_sentences: ['John Kerry and I have a plan to do something about it.', "We want to put more responsibility on the lawyers to require, before a case, malpractice, which the vice president just spoke about, have the case reviewed by independent experts to determine if the case is serious and meritorious before it can be filed; hold the lawyers responsible for that, certify that and hold the lawyer financially responsible if they don't do it; have a three-strikes-and-you're-out rule so that a lawyer who files three of these cases without meeting this requirement loses their right to file these cases.", "That way we keep the cases out of the system that don't belong in the system."]
dialogue: John Kerry and I have a plan to do something about it. We want to put more responsibility on the lawyers to require, before a case, malpractice, which the vice president just spoke about, have the case reviewed by independent experts to determine if the case is serious and meritorious before it can be filed; hold the lawyers responsible for that, certify that and hold the lawyer financially responsible if they don't do it; have a three-strikes-and-you're-out rule so that a lawyer who files three of these cases without meeting this requirement loses their right to file these cases. That way we keep the cases out of the system that don't belong in the system.
snippet_sentences: ['They talk about frivolous cases.']
snippet: They talk about frivolous cases.

dialogue_sentences: ['While you were in private practice in law and as a senator, you had the advantage of a special tax loophole, Subchapter S corporation, which you set up so you could avoid paying $600,000 in Medicare taxes that would have gone into the fund.', "And it's those kinds of loopholes that necessitate a premium increase under the law that was enacted in 1997, supported by John Kerry.", 'Well, first of all, I have paid all the taxes that I owe.']
dialogue: While you were in private practice in law and as a senator, you had the advantage of a special tax loophole, Subchapter S corporation, which you set up so you could avoid paying $600,000 in Medicare taxes that would have gone into the fund. And it's those kinds of loopholes that necessitate a premium increase under the law that was enacted in 1997, supported by John Kerry. Well, first of all, I have paid all the taxes that I owe.
snippet_sentences: ['When the vice president was CEO of Halliburton, they took advantage of every offshore loophole available.']
snippet: When the vice president was CEO of Halliburton, they took advantage of every offshore loophole available.

dialogue_sentences: ["Now, the president has presided over an economy where we've lost 1.6 million jobs.", 'The first president in 72 years to lose jobs.', 'I have a plan to put people back to work.']
dialogue: Now, the president has presided over an economy where we've lost 1.6 million jobs. The first president in 72 years to lose jobs. I have a plan to put people back to work.
snippet_sentences: ["That's not wishy- washy."]
snippet: That's not wishy- washy.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'm going to give you a tax cut.", 'The president gave the top 1 percent of income-earners in America, got $89 billion last year, more than the 80 percent of people who earn $100,000 or less all put together.', "I think that's wrong."]
dialogue: I'm going to give you a tax cut. The president gave the top 1 percent of income-earners in America, got $89 billion last year, more than the 80 percent of people who earn $100,000 or less all put together. I think that's wrong.
snippet_sentences: ["That's not wishy-washy, and that's what I'm fighting for, you."]
snippet: That's not wishy-washy, and that's what I'm fighting for, you.

dialogue_sentences: ['I can see why people at your workplace think he changes positions a lot, because he does.', 'He said he voted for the $87 billion, and voted against it right before he voted for it.', 'And that sends a confusing signal to people.']
dialogue: I can see why people at your workplace think he changes positions a lot, because he does. He said he voted for the $87 billion, and voted against it right before he voted for it. And that sends a confusing signal to people.

snippet: He said he thought Saddam Hussein was a grave threat, and now he said it was a mistake to remove Saddam Hussein from power.

dialogue_sentences: ['Thank you for your question.', 'Off-road diesel engines -- we have reached an agreement to reduce pollution from off-road diesel engines by 90 percent.', "I've got a plan to increase the wetlands by 3 million."]
dialogue: Thank you for your question. Off-road diesel engines -- we have reached an agreement to reduce pollution from off-road diesel engines by 90 percent. I've got a plan to increase the wetlands by 3 million.
snippet_sentences: ["We've got an aggressive brown field program to refurbish inner-city sore spots to useful pieces of property."]
snippet: We've got an aggressive brown field program to refurbish inner-city sore spots to useful pieces of property.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's good for small businesses, good for owners.", 'You own your own account.', 'You can save tax-free.']
dialogue: It's good for small businesses, good for owners. You own your own account. You can save tax-free.

snippet: You get a catastrophic plan to help you on it.

dialogue_sentences: ["And so when you're running up the taxes like that, you're taxing job creators, and that's not how you keep jobs here.", "You can't stop all outsourcing, Charlie.", "I've never promised that."]
dialogue: And so when you're running up the taxes like that, you're taxing job creators, and that's not how you keep jobs here. You can't stop all outsourcing, Charlie. I've never promised that.
snippet_sentences: ["I'm not going to, because that would be pandering."]
snippet: I'm not going to, because that would be pandering.

dialogue_sentences: ['You can save tax-free.', 'You get a catastrophic plan to help you on it.', 'This is different from saying, "OK, let me incent you to go on the government."']
dialogue: You can save tax-free. You get a catastrophic plan to help you on it. This is different from saying, "OK, let me incent you to go on the government."

snippet: He's talking about his plan to keep jobs here. You know he calls it an outsourcing to keep -- stop outsourcing.

dialogue_sentences: ["Secondly, we're going to create a manufacturing jobs credit and a new jobs credit for people to be able to help hire and be more competitive here in America.", "Third, what's really hurting American business more than anything else is the cost of health care.", "Now, you didn't hear any plan from the president, because he doesn't have a plan to lower the cost of health care."]
dialogue: Secondly, we're going to create a manufacturing jobs credit and a new jobs credit for people to be able to help hire and be more competitive here in America. Third, what's really hurting American business more than anything else is the cost of health care. Now, you didn't hear any plan from the president, because he doesn't have a plan to lower the cost of health care.
snippet_sentences: ['Five million Americans have lost their health care; 620,000 Missourians have no health care at all; 96,000 Missourians have lost their health care under President Bush.']
snippet: Five million Americans have lost their health care; 620,000 Missourians have no health care at all; 96,000 Missourians have lost their health care under President Bush.

dialogue_sentences: ["You can't.", "But what you can do is create a fair playing field, and that's what I'm talking about.", 'But let me just address what the president just said.']
dialogue: You can't. But what you can do is create a fair playing field, and that's what I'm talking about. But let me just address what the president just said.
snippet_sentences: ["Ladies and gentlemen, that's just not true what he said.", 'The Wall Street Journal said 96 percent of small businesses are not affected at all by my plan.', 'And you know why he gets that count?', "The president got $84 from a timber company that owns, and he's counted as a small business.", "Dick Cheney's counted as a small business.", "That's how they do things."]
snippet: Ladies and gentlemen, that's just not true what he said. The Wall Street Journal said 96 percent of small businesses are not affected at all by my plan. And you know why he gets that count? The president got $84 from a timber company that owns, and he's counted as a small business. Dick Cheney's counted as a small business. That's how they do things.

dialogue_sentences: ["I really don't think your rights are being watered down.", "As a matter of fact, I wouldn't support it if I thought that.", 'Every action being taken against terrorists requires court order, requires scrutiny.']
dialogue: I really don't think your rights are being watered down. As a matter of fact, I wouldn't support it if I thought that. Every action being taken against terrorists requires court order, requires scrutiny.

snippet: As a matter of fact, the tools now given to the terrorist fighters are the same tools that we've been using against drug dealers and white-collar criminals.

dialogue_sentences: ["They've got people allowed to go into churches now and political meetings without any showing of potential criminal activity or otherwise.", 'Now, I voted for the Patriot Act.', 'Ninety-nine United States senators voted for it.']
dialogue: They've got people allowed to go into churches now and political meetings without any showing of potential criminal activity or otherwise. Now, I voted for the Patriot Act. Ninety-nine United States senators voted for it.

snippet: And the president's been very busy running around the country using what I just described to you as a reason to say I'm wishy-washy, that I'm a flip-flopper.

dialogue_sentences: ["And he said the mark of a good judge, good justice, is that when you're reading their decision, their opinion, you can't tell if it's written by a man or woman, a liberal or a conservative, a Muslim, a Jew or a Christian.", "You just know you're reading a good judicial decision.", 'What I want to find, if I am privileged to have the opportunity to do it -- and the Supreme Court of the United States is at stake in this race, ladies and gentlemen.']
dialogue: And he said the mark of a good judge, good justice, is that when you're reading their decision, their opinion, you can't tell if it's written by a man or woman, a liberal or a conservative, a Muslim, a Jew or a Christian. You just know you're reading a good judicial decision. What I want to find, if I am privileged to have the opportunity to do it -- and the Supreme Court of the United States is at stake in this race, ladies and gentlemen.
snippet_sentences: ["The future of things that matter to you -- in terms of civil rights, what kind of Justice Department you'll have, whether we'll enforce the law.", 'Will we have equal opportunity?', "Will women's rights be protected?", 'Will we have equal pay for women, which is going backwards?', "Will a woman's right to choose be protected?"]
snippet: The future of things that matter to you -- in terms of civil rights, what kind of Justice Department you'll have, whether we'll enforce the law. Will we have equal opportunity? Will women's rights be protected? Will we have equal pay for women, which is going backwards? Will a woman's right to choose be protected?

dialogue_sentences: ["I'm a Catholic, raised a Catholic.", 'I was an altar boy.', 'Religion has been a huge part of my life.']
dialogue: I'm a Catholic, raised a Catholic. I was an altar boy. Religion has been a huge part of my life.

dialogue_sentences: ["Over 20 years in the United States Senate, I've worked with John McCain, who's sitting here, I've worked with other colleagues.", "I've reached across the aisle.", "I've tried to find the common ground, because that's what makes us strong as Americans."]
dialogue: Over 20 years in the United States Senate, I've worked with John McCain, who's sitting here, I've worked with other colleagues. I've reached across the aisle. I've tried to find the common ground, because that's what makes us strong as Americans.
snippet_sentences: ["And if Americans trust me with the presidency, I can pledge to you, we will have the most significant effort, openly -- not secret meetings in the White House with special interests, not ideologically driven efforts to push people aside -- but a genuine effort to try to restore America's hope and possibilities by bringing people together."]
snippet: And if Americans trust me with the presidency, I can pledge to you, we will have the most significant effort, openly -- not secret meetings in the White House with special interests, not ideologically driven efforts to push people aside -- but a genuine effort to try to restore America's hope and possibilities by bringing people together.

dialogue_sentences: ["I've tried to find the common ground, because that's what makes us strong as Americans.", "And if Americans trust me with the presidency, I can pledge to you, we will have the most significant effort, openly -- not secret meetings in the White House with special interests, not ideologically driven efforts to push people aside -- but a genuine effort to try to restore America's hope and possibilities by bringing people together.", "And one of the ways we're going to do it is, I'm going to work with my friend, John McCain, to further campaign finance reform so we get these incredible amounts of money out of the system and open it up to average people, so America is really represented by the people who make up America."]
dialogue: I've tried to find the common ground, because that's what makes us strong as Americans. And if Americans trust me with the presidency, I can pledge to you, we will have the most significant effort, openly -- not secret meetings in the White House with special interests, not ideologically driven efforts to push people aside -- but a genuine effort to try to restore America's hope and possibilities by bringing people together. And one of the ways we're going to do it is, I'm going to work with my friend, John McCain, to further campaign finance reform so we get these incredible amounts of money out of the system and open it up to average people, so America is really represented by the people who make up America.

snippet: My biggest disappointment in Washington is how partisan the town is.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'll tell you exactly how I can do it: by reinstating what President Bush took away, which is called pay as you go.", 'During the 1990s, we had pay-as-you-go rules.', 'If you were going to pass something in the Congress, you had to show where you are going to pay for it and how.']
dialogue: I'll tell you exactly how I can do it: by reinstating what President Bush took away, which is called pay as you go. During the 1990s, we had pay-as-you-go rules. If you were going to pass something in the Congress, you had to show where you are going to pay for it and how.
snippet_sentences: ["President Bush has taken -- he's the only president in history to do this.", "He's also the only president in 72 years to lose jobs -- 1.", '6 million jobs lost.', "He's the only president to have incomes of families go down for the last three years; the only president to see exports go down; the only president to see the lowest level of business investment in our country as it is today."]
snippet: President Bush has taken -- he's the only president in history to do this. He's also the only president in 72 years to lose jobs -- 1. 6 million jobs lost. snippet: Well, two leading national news networks have both said the president's characterization of my health-care plan is incorrect. One called it fiction. The other called it untrue.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have a fundamental difference of opinion.', 'I think government- run health will lead to poor-quality health, will lead to rationing, will lead to less choice.', 'Once a health-care program ends up in a line item in the federal government budget, it leads to more controls.']
dialogue: We have a fundamental difference of opinion. I think government- run health will lead to poor-quality health, will lead to rationing, will lead to less choice. Once a health-care program ends up in a line item in the federal government budget, it leads to more controls.
snippet_sentences: ['And just look at other countries that have tried to have federally controlled health care.', 'They have poor-quality health care.']
snippet: And just look at other countries that have tried to have federally controlled health care. They have poor-quality health care.

dialogue_sentences: ['And the compounding rate of interest effect will make it more likely that the Social Security system is solvent for our children and our grandchildren.', 'I will work with Republicans and Democrats.', "It'll be a vital issue in my second term."]
dialogue: And the compounding rate of interest effect will make it more likely that the Social Security system is solvent for our children and our grandchildren. I will work with Republicans and Democrats. It'll be a vital issue in my second term.
snippet_sentences: ['But I want to warn my fellow citizens: The cost of doing nothing, the cost of saying the current system is OK, far exceeds the costs of trying to make sure we save the system for our children.']
snippet: But I want to warn my fellow citizens: The cost of doing nothing, the cost of saying the current system is OK, far exceeds the costs of trying to make sure we save the system for our children.

dialogue_sentences: ["It'll be a vital issue in my second term.", 'But I want to warn my fellow citizens: The cost of doing nothing, the cost of saying the current system is OK, far exceeds the costs of trying to make sure we save the system for our children.', 'You just heard the president say that young people ought to be able to take money out of Social Security and put it in their own accounts.']
dialogue: It'll be a vital issue in my second term. But I want to warn my fellow citizens: The cost of doing nothing, the cost of saying the current system is OK, far exceeds the costs of trying to make sure we save the system for our children. You just heard the president say that young people ought to be able to take money out of Social Security and put it in their own accounts.
snippet_sentences: ["Now, my fellow Americans, that's an invitation to disaster."]
snippet: Now, my fellow Americans, that's an invitation to disaster.

dialogue_sentences: ["Now, the president has never explained to America, ever, hasn't done it tonight, where does the transitional money, that $2 trillion, come from?", "He's already got $3 trillion, according to The Washington Post, of expenses that he's put on the line from his convention and the promises of this campaign, none of which are paid for.", 'Not one of them are paid for.']
dialogue: Now, the president has never explained to America, ever, hasn't done it tonight, where does the transitional money, that $2 trillion, come from? He's already got $3 trillion, according to The Washington Post, of expenses that he's put on the line from his convention and the promises of this campaign, none of which are paid for. Not one of them are paid for.
