snippet_sentences: ['The fact is that the president is driving the largest deficits in American history.']
snippet: The fact is that the president is driving the largest deficits in American history.

dialogue_sentences: ["And we'll make whatever adjustment is necessary.", 'But the first and most important thing is to start creating jobs in America.', "The jobs the president is creating pay $9,000 less than the jobs that we're losing."]
dialogue: And we'll make whatever adjustment is necessary. But the first and most important thing is to start creating jobs in America. The jobs the president is creating pay $9,000 less than the jobs that we're losing.
snippet_sentences: ['And this is the first president in 72 years to preside over an economy in America that has lost jobs, 1.', 'Eleven other presidents -- six Democrats and five Republicans -- had wars, had recessions, had great difficulties; none of them lost jobs the way this president has.']
snippet: And this is the first president in 72 years to preside over an economy in America that has lost jobs, 1. Eleven other presidents -- six Democrats and five Republicans -- had wars, had recessions, had great difficulties; none of them lost jobs the way this president has.

dialogue_sentences: ['But I want to warn my fellow citizens: The cost of doing nothing, the cost of saying the current system is OK, far exceeds the costs of trying to make sure we save the system for our children.', 'You just heard the president say that young people ought to be able to take money out of Social Security and put it in their own accounts.', "Now, my fellow Americans, that's an invitation to disaster."]
dialogue: But I want to warn my fellow citizens: The cost of doing nothing, the cost of saying the current system is OK, far exceeds the costs of trying to make sure we save the system for our children. You just heard the president say that young people ought to be able to take money out of Social Security and put it in their own accounts. Now, my fellow Americans, that's an invitation to disaster.
snippet_sentences: ["The CBO said very clearly that if you were to adopt the president's plan, there would be a $2 trillion hole in Social Security, because today's workers pay in to the system for today's retirees.", "And the CBO said -- that's the Congressional Budget Office; it's bipartisan -- they said that there would have to be a cut in benefits of 25 percent to 40 percent."]
snippet: The CBO said very clearly that if you were to adopt the president's plan, there would be a $2 trillion hole in Social Security, because today's workers pay in to the system for today's retirees. And the CBO said -- that's the Congressional Budget Office; it's bipartisan -- they said that there would have to be a cut in benefits of 25 percent to 40 percent.

dialogue_sentences: ["The CBO said very clearly that if you were to adopt the president's plan, there would be a $2 trillion hole in Social Security, because today's workers pay in to the system for today's retirees.", "And the CBO said -- that's the Congressional Budget Office; it's bipartisan -- they said that there would have to be a cut in benefits of 25 percent to 40 percent.", "Now, the president has never explained to America, ever, hasn't done it tonight, where does the transitional money, that $2 trillion, come from?"]
dialogue: The CBO said very clearly that if you were to adopt the president's plan, there would be a $2 trillion hole in Social Security, because today's workers pay in to the system for today's retirees. And the CBO said -- that's the Congressional Budget Office; it's bipartisan -- they said that there would have to be a cut in benefits of 25 percent to 40 percent. Now, the president has never explained to America, ever, hasn't done it tonight, where does the transitional money, that $2 trillion, come from?
snippet_sentences: ["He's already got $3 trillion, according to The Washington Post, of expenses that he's put on the line from his convention and the promises of this campaign, none of which are paid for.", 'Not one of them are paid for.']
snippet: He's already got $3 trillion, according to The Washington Post, of expenses that he's put on the line from his convention and the promises of this campaign, none of which are paid for. Not one of them are paid for.

dialogue_sentences: ['Eleven other presidents -- six Democrats and five Republicans -- had wars, had recessions, had great difficulties; none of them lost jobs the way this president has.', 'I have a plan to put America back to work.', "And if we're fiscally responsible and put America back to work, we're going to fix Social Security."]
dialogue: Eleven other presidents -- six Democrats and five Republicans -- had wars, had recessions, had great difficulties; none of them lost jobs the way this president has. I have a plan to put America back to work. And if we're fiscally responsible and put America back to work, we're going to fix Social Security.
snippet_sentences: ['He forgot to tell you he voted to tax Social Security benefits more than one time.', "I didn't hear any plan to fix Social Security."]
snippet: He forgot to tell you he voted to tax Social Security benefits more than one time. I didn't hear any plan to fix Social Security.

dialogue_sentences: ['I remember the 2000 campaign, people said if George W. gets elected, your check will be taken away.', "Well, people got their checks, and they'll continue to get their checks.", 'There is a problem for our youngsters, a real problem.']
dialogue: I remember the 2000 campaign, people said if George W. gets elected, your check will be taken away. Well, people got their checks, and they'll continue to get their checks. There is a problem for our youngsters, a real problem.
snippet_sentences: ["And if we don't act today, the problem will be valued in the trillions."]
snippet: And if we don't act today, the problem will be valued in the trillions.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, to say that the borders are not as protected as they were prior to September the 11th shows he doesn't know the borders.", "They're much better protected today than they were when I was the governor of Texas.", 'We have much more manpower and much more equipment there.']
dialogue: Well, to say that the borders are not as protected as they were prior to September the 11th shows he doesn't know the borders. They're much better protected today than they were when I was the governor of Texas. We have much more manpower and much more equipment there.
snippet_sentences: ["He just doesn't understand how the borders work, evidently, to say that.", 'That is an outrageous claim.']
snippet: He just doesn't understand how the borders work, evidently, to say that. That is an outrageous claim.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's completely out of control.", "It's gone -- we have now presided over the largest increase in the size of government since the Great Society.", 'We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us.']
dialogue: It's completely out of control. It's gone -- we have now presided over the largest increase in the size of government since the Great Society. We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us.
snippet_sentences: ["And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway."]
snippet: And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's gone -- we have now presided over the largest increase in the size of government since the Great Society.", 'We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us.', "And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway."]
dialogue: It's gone -- we have now presided over the largest increase in the size of government since the Great Society. We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us. And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway.
snippet_sentences: ["It's a gateway to out-of-control spending and corruption."]
snippet: It's a gateway to out-of-control spending and corruption.

dialogue_sentences: ['We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us.', "And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway.", "It's a gateway to out-of-control spending and corruption."]
dialogue: We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us. And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway. It's a gateway to out-of-control spending and corruption.
snippet_sentences: ['And we have former members of Congress now residing in federal prison because of the evils of this earmarking and pork-barrel spending.']
snippet: And we have former members of Congress now residing in federal prison because of the evils of this earmarking and pork-barrel spending.

dialogue_sentences: ['And, absolutely, we need earmark reform.', "And when I'm president, I will go line by line to make sure that we are not spending money unwisely.", "But the fact is that eliminating earmarks alone is not a recipe for how we're going to get the middle class back on track."]
dialogue: And, absolutely, we need earmark reform. And when I'm president, I will go line by line to make sure that we are not spending money unwisely. But the fact is that eliminating earmarks alone is not a recipe for how we're going to get the middle class back on track.
snippet_sentences: ["And when you look at your tax policies that are directed primarily at those who are doing well, and you are neglecting people who are really struggling right now, I think that is a continuation of the last eight years, and we can't afford another four."]
snippet: And when you look at your tax policies that are directed primarily at those who are doing well, and you are neglecting people who are really struggling right now, I think that is a continuation of the last eight years, and we can't afford another four.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's a lot more than $18 billion in pork-barrel spending.", "I can tell you, it's rife.", "It's throughout."]
dialogue: It's a lot more than $18 billion in pork-barrel spending. I can tell you, it's rife. It's throughout.
snippet_sentences: ['The United States Senate will take up a continuing resolution tomorrow or the next day, sometime next week, with 2,000 -- 2,000 -- look at them, my friends.', 'Look at them.', "You'll be appalled."]
snippet: The United States Senate will take up a continuing resolution tomorrow or the next day, sometime next week, with 2,000 -- 2,000 -- look at them, my friends. Look at them. You'll be appalled.

dialogue_sentences: ["You've got to look at our record.", "You've got to look at our records.", "That's the important thing."]
dialogue: You've got to look at our record. You've got to look at our records. That's the important thing.
snippet_sentences: ['Who fought against wasteful and earmark spending?']
snippet: Who fought against wasteful and earmark spending?

dialogue_sentences: ["Number two, we've got to make sure that taxpayers, when they are putting their money at risk, have the possibility of getting that money back and gains, if the market -- and when the market returns.", "Number three, we've got to make sure that none of that money is going to pad CEO bank accounts or to promote golden parachutes.", "And, number four, we've got to make sure that we're helping homeowners, because the root problem here has to do with the foreclosures that are taking place all across the country."]
dialogue: Number two, we've got to make sure that taxpayers, when they are putting their money at risk, have the possibility of getting that money back and gains, if the market -- and when the market returns. Number three, we've got to make sure that none of that money is going to pad CEO bank accounts or to promote golden parachutes. And, number four, we've got to make sure that we're helping homeowners, because the root problem here has to do with the foreclosures that are taking place all across the country.
snippet_sentences: ['Now, we also have to recognize that this is a final verdict on eight years of failed economic policies promoted by George Bush, supported by Senator McCain, a theory that basically says that we can shred regulations and consumer protections and give more and more to the most, and somehow prosperity will trickle down.', "It hasn't worked."]
snippet: Now, we also have to recognize that this is a final verdict on eight years of failed economic policies promoted by George Bush, supported by Senator McCain, a theory that basically says that we can shred regulations and consumer protections and give more and more to the most, and somehow prosperity will trickle down. It hasn't worked.

dialogue_sentences: ["So my attitude is, we've got to grow the economy from the bottom up.", "What I've called for is a tax cut for 95 percent of working families, 95 percent.", "And that means that the ordinary American out there who's collecting a paycheck every day, they've got a little extra money to be able to buy a computer for their kid, to fill up on this gas that is killing them."]
dialogue: So my attitude is, we've got to grow the economy from the bottom up. What I've called for is a tax cut for 95 percent of working families, 95 percent. And that means that the ordinary American out there who's collecting a paycheck every day, they've got a little extra money to be able to buy a computer for their kid, to fill up on this gas that is killing them.
snippet_sentences: ['And over time, that, I think, is going to be a better recipe for economic growth than the -- the policies of President Bush that John McCain wants to -- wants to follow.']
snippet: And over time, that, I think, is going to be a better recipe for economic growth than the -- the policies of President Bush that John McCain wants to -- wants to follow.

dialogue_sentences: ['We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us.', "And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway.", "It's a gateway to out-of-control spending and corruption."]
dialogue: We Republicans came to power to change government, and government changed us. And the -- the worst symptom on this disease is what my friend, Tom Coburn, calls earmarking as a gateway drug, because it's a gateway. It's a gateway to out-of-control spending and corruption.
snippet_sentences: ['And we have former members of Congress now residing in federal prison because of the evils of this earmarking and pork-barrel spending.']
snippet: And we have former members of Congress now residing in federal prison because of the evils of this earmarking and pork-barrel spending.

dialogue_sentences: ['And Senator Obama, who after promising not to vote to cut off funds for the troops, did the incredible thing of voting to cut off the funds for the troops in Iraq and Afghanistan.', 'Jim, there are a whole bunch of things we have got to answer.', "First of all, let's talk about this troop funding issue because John always brings this up."]
dialogue: And Senator Obama, who after promising not to vote to cut off funds for the troops, did the incredible thing of voting to cut off the funds for the troops in Iraq and Afghanistan. Jim, there are a whole bunch of things we have got to answer. First of all, let's talk about this troop funding issue because John always brings this up.
snippet_sentences: ["Senator McCain cut -- Senator McCain opposed funding for troops in legislation that had a timetable, because he didn't believe in a timetable."]
snippet: Senator McCain cut -- Senator McCain opposed funding for troops in legislation that had a timetable, because he didn't believe in a timetable.

dialogue_sentences: ['We should do it in phases.', 'But in 16 months we should be able to reduce our combat troops, put -- provide some relief to military families and our troops and bolster our efforts in Afghanistan so that we can capture and kill bin Laden and crush al Qaeda.', "And right now, the commanders in Afghanistan, as well as Admiral Mullen, have acknowledged that we don't have enough troops to deal with Afghanistan because we still have more troops in Iraq than we did before the surge."]
dialogue: We should do it in phases. But in 16 months we should be able to reduce our combat troops, put -- provide some relief to military families and our troops and bolster our efforts in Afghanistan so that we can capture and kill bin Laden and crush al Qaeda. And right now, the commanders in Afghanistan, as well as Admiral Mullen, have acknowledged that we don't have enough troops to deal with Afghanistan because we still have more troops in Iraq than we did before the surge.
snippet_sentences: ["Admiral Mullen suggests that Senator Obama's plan is dangerous for America."]
snippet: Admiral Mullen suggests that Senator Obama's plan is dangerous for America.

dialogue_sentences: ['I think the lessons of Iraq are very clear that you cannot have a failed strategy that will then cause you to nearly lose a conflict.']
dialogue: I think the lessons of Iraq are very clear that you cannot have a failed strategy that will then cause you to nearly lose a conflict.
snippet_sentences: ['Our initial military success, we went in to Baghdad and everybody celebrated.', 'And then the war was very badly mishandled.', "I went to Iraq in 2003 and came back and said, we've got to change this strategy.", 'This strategy requires additional troops, it requires a fundamental change in strategy and I fought for it.', 'And finally, we came up with a great general and a strategy that has succeeded.', 'This strategy has succeeded.', 'And we are winning in Iraq.']
snippet: Our initial military success, we went in to Baghdad and everybody celebrated. And then the war was very badly mishandled. I went to Iraq in 2003 and came back and said, we've got to change this strategy. This strategy requires additional troops, it requires a fundamental change in strategy and I fought for it. And finally, we came up with a great general and a strategy that has succeeded. This strategy has succeeded. And we are winning in Iraq.

dialogue_sentences: ["We hadn't put al Qaeda to rest, and as a consequence, I thought that it was going to be a distraction.", 'Now Senator McCain and President Bush had a very different judgment.', "And I wish I had been wrong for the sake of the country and they had been right, but that's not the case."]
dialogue: We hadn't put al Qaeda to rest, and as a consequence, I thought that it was going to be a distraction. Now Senator McCain and President Bush had a very different judgment. And I wish I had been wrong for the sake of the country and they had been right, but that's not the case.
snippet_sentences: ['We have lost over 4,000 lives.', 'We have seen 30,000 wounded, and most importantly, from a strategic national security perspective, al Qaeda is resurgent, stronger now than at any time since 2001.']
snippet: We have lost over 4,000 lives. We have seen 30,000 wounded, and most importantly, from a strategic national security perspective, al Qaeda is resurgent, stronger now than at any time since 2001.

dialogue_sentences: ["I've been saying that for over a year now.", "And I think that we have to do it as quickly as possible, because it's been acknowledged by the commanders on the ground the situation is getting worse, not better.", 'We had the highest fatalities among U. S. troops this past year than at any time since 2002.']
dialogue: I've been saying that for over a year now. And I think that we have to do it as quickly as possible, because it's been acknowledged by the commanders on the ground the situation is getting worse, not better. We had the highest fatalities among U. S. troops this past year than at any time since 2002.
snippet_sentences: ['And we are seeing a major offensive taking place -- Al Qaida and Taliban crossing the border and attacking our troops in a brazen fashion.']
snippet: And we are seeing a major offensive taking place -- Al Qaida and Taliban crossing the border and attacking our troops in a brazen fashion.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have to press the Afghan government to make certain that they are actually working for their people.', "And I've said this to President Karzai.", "Number two, we've got to deal with a growing poppy trade that has exploded over the last several years."]
dialogue: We have to press the Afghan government to make certain that they are actually working for their people. And I've said this to President Karzai. Number two, we've got to deal with a growing poppy trade that has exploded over the last several years.
snippet_sentences: ["Number three, we've got to deal with Pakistan, because Al Qaida and the Taliban have safe havens in Pakistan, across the border in the northwest regions, and although, you know, under George Bush, with the support of Senator McCain, we've been giving them $10 billion over the last seven years, they have not done what needs to be done to get rid of those safe havens."]
snippet: Number three, we've got to deal with Pakistan, because Al Qaida and the Taliban have safe havens in Pakistan, across the border in the northwest regions, and although, you know, under George Bush, with the support of Senator McCain, we've been giving them $10 billion over the last seven years, they have not done what needs to be done to get rid of those safe havens.

dialogue_sentences: ["Number two, we've got to deal with a growing poppy trade that has exploded over the last several years.", "Number three, we've got to deal with Pakistan, because Al Qaida and the Taliban have safe havens in Pakistan, across the border in the northwest regions, and although, you know, under George Bush, with the support of Senator McCain, we've been giving them $10 billion over the last seven years, they have not done what needs to be done to get rid of those safe havens.", 'And until we do, Americans here at home are not going to be safe.']
dialogue: Number two, we've got to deal with a growing poppy trade that has exploded over the last several years. Number three, we've got to deal with Pakistan, because Al Qaida and the Taliban have safe havens in Pakistan, across the border in the northwest regions, and although, you know, under George Bush, with the support of Senator McCain, we've been giving them $10 billion over the last seven years, they have not done what needs to be done to get rid of those safe havens. And until we do, Americans here at home are not going to be safe.
snippet_sentences: ["First of all, I won't repeat the mistake that I regret enormously, and that is, after we were able to help the Afghan freedom fighters and drive the Russians out of Afghanistan, we basically washed our hands of the region."]
snippet: First of all, I won't repeat the mistake that I regret enormously, and that is, after we were able to help the Afghan freedom fighters and drive the Russians out of Afghanistan, we basically washed our hands of the region.

dialogue_sentences: ['But let me tell you, you know, this business about bombing Iran and all that, let me tell you my record.', 'Back in 1983, when I was a brand-new United States congressman, the one -- the person I admired the most and still admire the most, Ronald Reagan, wanted to send Marines into Lebanon.', "And I saw that, and I saw the situation, and I stood up, and I voted against that, because I was afraid that they couldn't make peace in a place where 300 or 400 or several hundred Marines would make a difference."]
dialogue: But let me tell you, you know, this business about bombing Iran and all that, let me tell you my record. Back in 1983, when I was a brand-new United States congressman, the one -- the person I admired the most and still admire the most, Ronald Reagan, wanted to send Marines into Lebanon. And I saw that, and I saw the situation, and I stood up, and I voted against that, because I was afraid that they couldn't make peace in a place where 300 or 400 or several hundred Marines would make a difference.
snippet_sentences: ['Tragically, I was right: Nearly 300 Marines lost their lives in the bombing of the barracks.']
snippet: Tragically, I was right: Nearly 300 Marines lost their lives in the bombing of the barracks.

dialogue_sentences: ["And it did and we will win this one and we won't come home in defeat and dishonor and probably have to go back if we fail.", 'Jim, let me just make a point.', "I've got a bracelet, too, from Sergeant - from the mother of Sergeant Ryan David Jopeck (ph), given to me in green bay."]
dialogue: And it did and we will win this one and we won't come home in defeat and dishonor and probably have to go back if we fail. Jim, let me just make a point. I've got a bracelet, too, from Sergeant - from the mother of Sergeant Ryan David Jopeck (ph), given to me in green bay.
snippet_sentences: ["She asked me, can you please make sure another mother is not going through what I'm going through."]
snippet: She asked me, can you please make sure another mother is not going through what I'm going through.

dialogue_sentences: ["And we honor all the service that they've provided.", 'Our troops have performed brilliantly.', 'The question is for the next president, are we making good judgments about how to keep America safe precisely because sending our military into battle is such an enormous step.']
dialogue: And we honor all the service that they've provided. Our troops have performed brilliantly. The question is for the next president, are we making good judgments about how to keep America safe precisely because sending our military into battle is such an enormous step.
snippet_sentences: ['And the point that I originally made is that we took our eye off Afghanistan, we took our eye off the folks who perpetrated 9/11, they are still sending out videotapes and Senator McCain, nobody is talking about defeat in Iraq, but I have to say we are having enormous problems in Afghanistan because of that decision.']
snippet: And the point that I originally made is that we took our eye off Afghanistan, we took our eye off the folks who perpetrated 9/11, they are still sending out videotapes and Senator McCain, nobody is talking about defeat in Iraq, but I have to say we are having enormous problems in Afghanistan because of that decision.

dialogue_sentences: ["By the way, when I'm subcommittee chairman, we take up the issues under my subcommittee.", 'But the important thing is -- the important thing is I visited Afghanistan and I traveled to Waziristan and I traveled to these places and I know what our security requirements are.', 'So the point is that we will prevail in Afghanistan, but we need the new strategy and we need it to succeed.']
dialogue: By the way, when I'm subcommittee chairman, we take up the issues under my subcommittee. But the important thing is -- the important thing is I visited Afghanistan and I traveled to Waziristan and I traveled to these places and I know what our security requirements are. So the point is that we will prevail in Afghanistan, but we need the new strategy and we need it to succeed.
snippet_sentences: ["But the important thing is, if we suffer defeat in Iraq, which General Petraeus predicts we will, if we adopted Senator Obama's set date for withdrawal, then that will have a calamitous effect in Afghanistan and American national security interests in the region."]
snippet: But the important thing is, if we suffer defeat in Iraq, which General Petraeus predicts we will, if we adopted Senator Obama's set date for withdrawal, then that will have a calamitous effect in Afghanistan and American national security interests in the region.

dialogue_sentences: ["First of all, I won't repeat the mistake that I regret enormously, and that is, after we were able to help the Afghan freedom fighters and drive the Russians out of Afghanistan, we basically washed our hands of the region.", "So we can't ignore those lessons of history.", "Now, on this issue of aiding Pakistan, if you're going to aim a gun at somebody, George Shultz, our great secretary of state, told me once, you'd better be prepared to pull the trigger."]
dialogue: First of all, I won't repeat the mistake that I regret enormously, and that is, after we were able to help the Afghan freedom fighters and drive the Russians out of Afghanistan, we basically washed our hands of the region. So we can't ignore those lessons of history. Now, on this issue of aiding Pakistan, if you're going to aim a gun at somebody, George Shultz, our great secretary of state, told me once, you'd better be prepared to pull the trigger.
snippet_sentences: ["I'm not prepared at this time to cut off aid to Pakistan.", "So I'm not prepared to threaten it, as Senator Obama apparently wants to do, as he has said that he would announce military strikes into Pakistan."]
snippet: I'm not prepared at this time to cut off aid to Pakistan. So I'm not prepared to threaten it, as Senator Obama apparently wants to do, as he has said that he would announce military strikes into Pakistan.

dialogue_sentences: ["And the Pakistanis are going to have to understand that that bombing in the Marriott Hotel in Islamabad was a signal from the terrorists that they don't want that government to cooperate with us in combating the Taliban and jihadist elements.", "But I'm confident, now that General Petraeus is in the new position of command, that we will employ a strategy which not only means additional troops -- and, by the way, there have been 20,000 additional troops, from 32,000 to 53,000, and there needs to be more.", "So it's not just the addition of troops that matters."]
dialogue: And the Pakistanis are going to have to understand that that bombing in the Marriott Hotel in Islamabad was a signal from the terrorists that they don't want that government to cooperate with us in combating the Taliban and jihadist elements. But I'm confident, now that General Petraeus is in the new position of command, that we will employ a strategy which not only means additional troops -- and, by the way, there have been 20,000 additional troops, from 32,000 to 53,000, and there needs to be more. So it's not just the addition of troops that matters.
snippet_sentences: ["It's a strategy that will succeed.", 'And Pakistan is a very important element in this.', 'And I know how to work with them.', "And I guarantee you I would not publicly state that I'm going to attack them."]
snippet: It's a strategy that will succeed. And Pakistan is a very important element in this. And I know how to work with them. And I guarantee you I would not publicly state that I'm going to attack them.

dialogue_sentences: ['We spent $10 billion.', "And in the meantime, they weren't going after Al Qaida, and they are more powerful now than at any time since we began the war in Afghanistan.", "That's going to change when I'm president of the United States."]
dialogue: We spent $10 billion. And in the meantime, they weren't going after Al Qaida, and they are more powerful now than at any time since we began the war in Afghanistan. That's going to change when I'm president of the United States.
snippet_sentences: ["I -- I don't think that Senator Obama understands that there was a failed state in Pakistan when Musharraf came to power."]
snippet: I -- I don't think that Senator Obama understands that there was a failed state in Pakistan when Musharraf came to power.

dialogue_sentences: ["By the way, when I'm subcommittee chairman, we take up the issues under my subcommittee.", 'But the important thing is -- the important thing is I visited Afghanistan and I traveled to Waziristan and I traveled to these places and I know what our security requirements are.', 'So the point is that we will prevail in Afghanistan, but we need the new strategy and we need it to succeed.']
dialogue: By the way, when I'm subcommittee chairman, we take up the issues under my subcommittee. But the important thing is -- the important thing is I visited Afghanistan and I traveled to Waziristan and I traveled to these places and I know what our security requirements are. So the point is that we will prevail in Afghanistan, but we need the new strategy and we need it to succeed.
snippet_sentences: ["But the important thing is, if we suffer defeat in Iraq, which General Petraeus predicts we will, if we adopted Senator Obama's set date for withdrawal, then that will have a calamitous effect in Afghanistan and American national security interests in the region."]
snippet: But the important thing is, if we suffer defeat in Iraq, which General Petraeus predicts we will, if we adopted Senator Obama's set date for withdrawal, then that will have a calamitous effect in Afghanistan and American national security interests in the region.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I've said this to President Karzai.", "Number two, we've got to deal with a growing poppy trade that has exploded over the last several years.", "Number three, we've got to deal with Pakistan, because Al Qaida and the Taliban have safe havens in Pakistan, across the border in the northwest regions, and although, you know, under George Bush, with the support of Senator McCain, we've been giving them $10 billion over the last seven years, they have not done what needs to be done to get rid of those safe havens."]
dialogue: And I've said this to President Karzai. Number two, we've got to deal with a growing poppy trade that has exploded over the last several years. Number three, we've got to deal with Pakistan, because Al Qaida and the Taliban have safe havens in Pakistan, across the border in the northwest regions, and although, you know, under George Bush, with the support of Senator McCain, we've been giving them $10 billion over the last seven years, they have not done what needs to be done to get rid of those safe havens.
snippet_sentences: ['And until we do, Americans here at home are not going to be safe.']
snippet: And until we do, Americans here at home are not going to be safe.

dialogue_sentences: ['And I have a record -- and Somalia, I opposed that we should turn -- turn the force in Somalia from a peacekeeping force into a peacemaking force, which they were not capable of.', 'So I have a record.', "I have a record of being involved in these national security issues, which involve the highest responsibility and the toughest decisions that any president can make, and that is to send our young men and women into harm's way."]
dialogue: And I have a record -- and Somalia, I opposed that we should turn -- turn the force in Somalia from a peacekeeping force into a peacemaking force, which they were not capable of. So I have a record. I have a record of being involved in these national security issues, which involve the highest responsibility and the toughest decisions that any president can make, and that is to send our young men and women into harm's way.
snippet_sentences: ['And I\'ll tell you, I had a town hall meeting in Wolfeboro, New Hampshire, and a woman stood up and she said, "Senator McCain, I want you to do me the honor of wearing a bracelet with my son\'s name on it."', 'He was 22 years old and he was killed in combat outside of Baghdad, Matthew Stanley, before Christmas last year.', 'This was last August, a year ago.', 'And I said, "I will -- I will wear his bracelet with honor."', 'And this was August, a year ago.', 'And then she said, "But, Senator McCain, I want you to do everything -- promise me one thing, that you\'ll do everything in your power to make sure that my son\'s death was not in vain."', 'That means that that mission succeeds, just like those young people who re-enlisted in Baghdad, just like the mother I met at the airport the other day whose son was killed.', "And they all say to me that we don't want defeat."]
snippet: And I'll tell you, I had a town hall meeting in Wolfeboro, New Hampshire, and a woman stood up and she said, "Senator McCain, I want you to do me the honor of wearing a bracelet with my son's name on it." He was 22 years old and he was killed in combat outside of Baghdad, Matthew Stanley, before Christmas last year. This was last August, a year ago. And I said, "I will -- I will wear his bracelet with honor." And this was August, a year ago. And then she said, "But, Senator McCain, I want you to do everything -- promise me one thing, that you'll do everything in your power to make sure that my son's death was not in vain." That means that that mission succeeds, just like those young people who re-enlisted in Baghdad, just like the mother I met at the airport the other day whose son was killed. And they all say to me that we don't want defeat.

dialogue_sentences: ["A war that I was in, where we had an Army, that it wasn't through any fault of their own, but they were defeated.", "And it did and we will win this one and we won't come home in defeat and dishonor and probably have to go back if we fail.", 'Jim, let me just make a point.']
dialogue: A war that I was in, where we had an Army, that it wasn't through any fault of their own, but they were defeated. And it did and we will win this one and we won't come home in defeat and dishonor and probably have to go back if we fail. Jim, let me just make a point.
snippet_sentences: ["I've got a bracelet, too, from Sergeant - from the mother of Sergeant Ryan David Jopeck (ph), given to me in green bay.", "She asked me, can you please make sure another mother is not going through what I'm going through."]
snippet: I've got a bracelet, too, from Sergeant - from the mother of Sergeant Ryan David Jopeck (ph), given to me in green bay. She asked me, can you please make sure another mother is not going through what I'm going through.

dialogue_sentences: ["No U. S. soldier ever dies in vain because they're carrying out the missions of their commander in chief.", "And we honor all the service that they've provided.", 'Our troops have performed brilliantly.']
dialogue: No U. S. soldier ever dies in vain because they're carrying out the missions of their commander in chief. And we honor all the service that they've provided. Our troops have performed brilliantly.
snippet_sentences: ['The question is for the next president, are we making good judgments about how to keep America safe precisely because sending our military into battle is such an enormous step.']
snippet: The question is for the next president, are we making good judgments about how to keep America safe precisely because sending our military into battle is such an enormous step.

dialogue_sentences: ['And until we do, Americans here at home are not going to be safe.', "First of all, I won't repeat the mistake that I regret enormously, and that is, after we were able to help the Afghan freedom fighters and drive the Russians out of Afghanistan, we basically washed our hands of the region.", "So we can't ignore those lessons of history."]
dialogue: And until we do, Americans here at home are not going to be safe. First of all, I won't repeat the mistake that I regret enormously, and that is, after we were able to help the Afghan freedom fighters and drive the Russians out of Afghanistan, we basically washed our hands of the region. So we can't ignore those lessons of history.
snippet_sentences: ["Now, on this issue of aiding Pakistan, if you're going to aim a gun at somebody, George Shultz, our great secretary of state, told me once, you'd better be prepared to pull the trigger."]
snippet: Now, on this issue of aiding Pakistan, if you're going to aim a gun at somebody, George Shultz, our great secretary of state, told me once, you'd better be prepared to pull the trigger.

dialogue_sentences: ['But the important thing is -- the important thing is I visited Afghanistan and I traveled to Waziristan and I traveled to these places and I know what our security requirements are.', 'So the point is that we will prevail in Afghanistan, but we need the new strategy and we need it to succeed.', "But the important thing is, if we suffer defeat in Iraq, which General Petraeus predicts we will, if we adopted Senator Obama's set date for withdrawal, then that will have a calamitous effect in Afghanistan and American national security interests in the region."]
dialogue: But the important thing is -- the important thing is I visited Afghanistan and I traveled to Waziristan and I traveled to these places and I know what our security requirements are. So the point is that we will prevail in Afghanistan, but we need the new strategy and we need it to succeed. But the important thing is, if we suffer defeat in Iraq, which General Petraeus predicts we will, if we adopted Senator Obama's set date for withdrawal, then that will have a calamitous effect in Afghanistan and American national security interests in the region.
snippet_sentences: ["Senator Obama doesn't seem to understand there is a connected between the two."]
snippet: Senator Obama doesn't seem to understand there is a connected between the two.

dialogue_sentences: ["What I'd also like to point out the Iranians are putting the most lethal IEDs into Iraq which are killing young Americans, there are special groups in Iran coming into Iraq and are being trained in Iran.", 'There is the Republican Guard in Iran, which Senator Kyl had an amendment in order to declare them a sponsor of terror.', 'Senator Obama said that would be provocative.']
dialogue: What I'd also like to point out the Iranians are putting the most lethal IEDs into Iraq which are killing young Americans, there are special groups in Iran coming into Iraq and are being trained in Iran. There is the Republican Guard in Iran, which Senator Kyl had an amendment in order to declare them a sponsor of terror. Senator Obama said that would be provocative.
snippet_sentences: ['So this is a serious threat.']
snippet: So this is a serious threat.

dialogue_sentences: ["I've always encouraged them.", 'The Iranians have met with Ambassador Crocker in Baghdad.', 'What Senator Obama doesn\'t seem to understand that if without precondition you sit down across the table from someone who has called Israel a "stinking corpse," and wants to destroy that country and wipe it off the map, you legitimize those comments.']
dialogue: I've always encouraged them. The Iranians have met with Ambassador Crocker in Baghdad. What Senator Obama doesn't seem to understand that if without precondition you sit down across the table from someone who has called Israel a "stinking corpse," and wants to destroy that country and wipe it off the map, you legitimize those comments.
snippet_sentences: ['This is dangerous.', "It isn't just naive; it's dangerous."]
snippet: This is dangerous. It isn't just naive; it's dangerous.

dialogue_sentences: ["It isn't just naive; it's dangerous.", 'And so we just have a fundamental difference of opinion.', 'As far as North Korea is concerned, our secretary of state, Madeleine Albright, went to North Korea.']
dialogue: It isn't just naive; it's dangerous. And so we just have a fundamental difference of opinion. As far as North Korea is concerned, our secretary of state, Madeleine Albright, went to North Korea.
snippet_sentences: ['By the way, North Korea, most repressive and brutal regime probably on Earth.']
snippet: By the way, North Korea, most repressive and brutal regime probably on Earth.

dialogue_sentences: ['But I will point out that I was called naive when I suggested that we need to look at exploring contacts with Iran.', 'And you know what?', 'President Bush recently sent a senior ambassador, Bill Burns, to participate in talks with the Europeans around the issue of nuclear weapons.']
dialogue: But I will point out that I was called naive when I suggested that we need to look at exploring contacts with Iran. And you know what? President Bush recently sent a senior ambassador, Bill Burns, to participate in talks with the Europeans around the issue of nuclear weapons.
snippet_sentences: ["Again, it may not work, but if it doesn't work, then we have strengthened our ability to form alliances to impose the tough sanctions that Senator McCain just mentioned."]
snippet: Again, it may not work, but if it doesn't work, then we have strengthened our ability to form alliances to impose the tough sanctions that Senator McCain just mentioned.

dialogue_sentences: ["I think it's much less than it was the day after 9/11."]
dialogue: I think it's much less than it was the day after 9/11.
snippet_sentences: ['I think it -- that we have a safer nation, but we are a long way from safe.']
snippet: I think it -- that we have a safer nation, but we are a long way from safe.

dialogue_sentences: ['And one last point I want to make.', 'It is important for us to understand that the way we are perceived in the world is going to make a difference, in terms of our capacity to get cooperation and root out terrorism.', "And one of the things that I intend to do as president is to restore America's standing in the world."]
dialogue: And one last point I want to make. It is important for us to understand that the way we are perceived in the world is going to make a difference, in terms of our capacity to get cooperation and root out terrorism. And one of the things that I intend to do as president is to restore America's standing in the world.
snippet_sentences: ['We are less respected now than we were eight years ago or even four years ago.']
snippet: We are less respected now than we were eight years ago or even four years ago.

dialogue_sentences: ['Look, over the last eight years, this administration, along with Senator McCain, have been solely focused on Iraq.', 'That has been their priority.', 'That has been where all our resources have gone.']
dialogue: Look, over the last eight years, this administration, along with Senator McCain, have been solely focused on Iraq. That has been their priority. That has been where all our resources have gone.
snippet_sentences: ['In the meantime, bin Laden is still out there.', 'He is not captured.', 'He is not killed.']
snippet: In the meantime, bin Laden is still out there. He is not captured. He is not killed.

dialogue_sentences: ['That sense is something that I want to restore.', "I've been involved, as I mentioned to you before, in virtually every major national security challenge we've faced in the last 20-some years.", 'There are some advantages to experience, and knowledge, and judgment.']
dialogue: That sense is something that I want to restore. I've been involved, as I mentioned to you before, in virtually every major national security challenge we've faced in the last 20-some years. There are some advantages to experience, and knowledge, and judgment.
snippet_sentences: ["And I -- and I honestly don't believe that Senator Obama has the knowledge or experience and has made the wrong judgments in a number of areas, including his initial reaction to Russian invasion -- aggression in Georgia, to his -- you know, we've seen this stubbornness before in this administration to cling to a belief that somehow the surge has not succeeded and failing to acknowledge that he was wrong about the surge is -- shows to me that we -- that -- that we need more flexibility in a president of the United States than that."]
snippet: And I -- and I honestly don't believe that Senator Obama has the knowledge or experience and has made the wrong judgments in a number of areas, including his initial reaction to Russian invasion -- aggression in Georgia, to his -- you know, we've seen this stubbornness before in this administration to cling to a belief that somehow the surge has not succeeded and failing to acknowledge that he was wrong about the surge is -- shows to me that we -- that -- that we need more flexibility in a president of the United States than that.

dialogue_sentences: ['That sense is something that I want to restore.', "I've been involved, as I mentioned to you before, in virtually every major national security challenge we've faced in the last 20-some years.", 'There are some advantages to experience, and knowledge, and judgment.']
dialogue: That sense is something that I want to restore. I've been involved, as I mentioned to you before, in virtually every major national security challenge we've faced in the last 20-some years. There are some advantages to experience, and knowledge, and judgment.
snippet_sentences: ["And I -- and I honestly don't believe that Senator Obama has the knowledge or experience and has made the wrong judgments in a number of areas, including his initial reaction to Russian invasion -- aggression in Georgia, to his -- you know, we've seen this stubbornness before in this administration to cling to a belief that somehow the surge has not succeeded and failing to acknowledge that he was wrong about the surge is -- shows to me that we -- that -- that we need more flexibility in a president of the United States than that."]
snippet: And I -- and I honestly don't believe that Senator Obama has the knowledge or experience and has made the wrong judgments in a number of areas, including his initial reaction to Russian invasion -- aggression in Georgia, to his -- you know, we've seen this stubbornness before in this administration to cling to a belief that somehow the surge has not succeeded and failing to acknowledge that he was wrong about the surge is -- shows to me that we -- that -- that we need more flexibility in a president of the United States than that.

dialogue_sentences: ['It is important for us to understand that the way we are perceived in the world is going to make a difference, in terms of our capacity to get cooperation and root out terrorism.', "And one of the things that I intend to do as president is to restore America's standing in the world.", 'We are less respected now than we were eight years ago or even four years ago.']
dialogue: It is important for us to understand that the way we are perceived in the world is going to make a difference, in terms of our capacity to get cooperation and root out terrorism. And one of the things that I intend to do as president is to restore America's standing in the world. We are less respected now than we were eight years ago or even four years ago.
snippet_sentences: ['And this is the greatest country on Earth.']
snippet: And this is the greatest country on Earth.

dialogue_sentences: ['And that means tax cuts for the middle-class.', 'It means help for homeowners so that they can stay in their homes.', 'It means that we are helping state and local governments set up road projects and bridge projects that keep people in their jobs.']
dialogue: And that means tax cuts for the middle-class. It means help for homeowners so that they can stay in their homes. It means that we are helping state and local governments set up road projects and bridge projects that keep people in their jobs.
snippet_sentences: ["And then long-term we've got to fix our health care system, we've got to fix our energy system that is putting such an enormous burden on families."]
snippet: And then long-term we've got to fix our health care system, we've got to fix our energy system that is putting such an enormous burden on families.

dialogue_sentences: ["And we've -- you know, Senator McCain and I have some fundamental disagreements on the economy, starting with Senator McCain's statement earlier that he thought the fundamentals of the economy were sound.", 'Part of the problem here is that for many of you, wages and incomes have flat-lined.', 'For many of you, it is getting harder and harder to save, harder and harder to retire.']
dialogue: And we've -- you know, Senator McCain and I have some fundamental disagreements on the economy, starting with Senator McCain's statement earlier that he thought the fundamentals of the economy were sound. Part of the problem here is that for many of you, wages and incomes have flat-lined. For many of you, it is getting harder and harder to save, harder and harder to retire.
snippet_sentences: ["And that's why, for example, on tax policy, what I want to do is provide a middle class tax cut to 95 percent of working Americans, those who are working two jobs, people who are not spending enough time with their kids, because they are struggling to make ends meet."]
snippet: And that's why, for example, on tax policy, what I want to do is provide a middle class tax cut to 95 percent of working Americans, those who are working two jobs, people who are not spending enough time with their kids, because they are struggling to make ends meet.

dialogue_sentences: ["And Senator Obama, it's good to be with you at a town hall meeting.", 'And, Alan (ph), thank you for your question.', "You go to the heart of America's worries tonight."]
dialogue: And Senator Obama, it's good to be with you at a town hall meeting. And, Alan (ph), thank you for your question. You go to the heart of America's worries tonight.
snippet_sentences: ["Americans are angry, they're upset, and they're a little fearful."]
snippet: Americans are angry, they're upset, and they're a little fearful.

dialogue_sentences: ['And thanks to Hofstra.', 'And, by the way, our beloved Nancy Reagan is in the hospital tonight, so our thoughts and prayers are going with you.', "It's good to see you again, Senator Obama."]
dialogue: And thanks to Hofstra. And, by the way, our beloved Nancy Reagan is in the hospital tonight, so our thoughts and prayers are going with you. It's good to see you again, Senator Obama.
snippet_sentences: ["Americans are hurting right now, and they're angry.", "They're hurting, and they're angry."]
snippet: Americans are hurting right now, and they're angry. They're hurting, and they're angry.

dialogue_sentences: ['We ought to put the homeowners first.', 'And I am disappointed that Secretary Paulson and others have not made that their first priority.', "Well, first of all, I want to thank Hofstra University and the people of New York for hosting us tonight and it's wonderful to join Senator McCain again, and thank you, Bob."]
dialogue: We ought to put the homeowners first. And I am disappointed that Secretary Paulson and others have not made that their first priority. Well, first of all, I want to thank Hofstra University and the people of New York for hosting us tonight and it's wonderful to join Senator McCain again, and thank you, Bob.
snippet_sentences: ['I think everybody understands at this point that we are experiencing the worst financial crisis since the Great Depression.']
snippet: I think everybody understands at this point that we are experiencing the worst financial crisis since the Great Depression.

dialogue_sentences: ['Our tax rate for business in America is 35 percent.', "Ireland, it's 11 percent.", 'Where are companies going to go where they can create jobs and where they can do best in business?']
dialogue: Our tax rate for business in America is 35 percent. Ireland, it's 11 percent. Where are companies going to go where they can create jobs and where they can do best in business?
snippet_sentences: ['We need to cut the business tax rate in America.', 'We need to encourage business.', "Now, of all times in America, we need to cut people's taxes.", 'We need to encourage business, create jobs, not spread the wealth around.']
snippet: We need to cut the business tax rate in America. We need to encourage business. Now, of all times in America, we need to cut people's taxes. We need to encourage business, create jobs, not spread the wealth around.

dialogue_sentences: ["And there are elements of my proposal that you just outlined which I won't repeat.", 'But we also have to have a short-term fix, in my view, and long- term fixes.', 'Let me just talk to you about one of the short-term fixes.']
dialogue: And there are elements of my proposal that you just outlined which I won't repeat. But we also have to have a short-term fix, in my view, and long- term fixes. Let me just talk to you about one of the short-term fixes.
snippet_sentences: ['The catalyst for this housing crisis was the Fannie and Freddie Mae that caused subprime lending situation that now caused the housing market in America to collapse.']
snippet: The catalyst for this housing crisis was the Fannie and Freddie Mae that caused subprime lending situation that now caused the housing market in America to collapse.

dialogue_sentences: ['If we make investments now so that people have coverage, that we are preventing diseases, that will save on Medicare and Medicaid in the future.', "If we invest in a serious energy policy, that will save in the amount of money we're borrowing from China to send to Saudi Arabia.", 'If we invest now in our young people and their ability to go to college, that will allow them to drive this economy into the 21st century.']
dialogue: If we make investments now so that people have coverage, that we are preventing diseases, that will save on Medicare and Medicaid in the future. If we invest in a serious energy policy, that will save in the amount of money we're borrowing from China to send to Saudi Arabia. If we invest now in our young people and their ability to go to college, that will allow them to drive this economy into the 21st century.
snippet_sentences: ["But what is absolutely true is that, once we get through this economic crisis and some of the specific proposals to get us out of this slump, that we're not going to be able to go back to our profligate ways."]
snippet: But what is absolutely true is that, once we get through this economic crisis and some of the specific proposals to get us out of this slump, that we're not going to be able to go back to our profligate ways.

dialogue_sentences: ['I saved the taxpayer $6.8 billion by fighting a deal for a couple of years, as you might recall, that was a sweetheart deal between an aircraft manufacturer, DOD, and people ended up in jail.', 'But I would fight for a line-item veto, and I would certainly veto every earmark pork-barrel bill.', '... including $3 million for an overhead projector in a planetarium in his hometown.']
dialogue: I saved the taxpayer $6.8 billion by fighting a deal for a couple of years, as you might recall, that was a sweetheart deal between an aircraft manufacturer, DOD, and people ended up in jail. But I would fight for a line-item veto, and I would certainly veto every earmark pork-barrel bill. ... including $3 million for an overhead projector in a planetarium in his hometown.
snippet_sentences: ["That's not the way we cut -- we'll cut out all the pork."]
snippet: That's not the way we cut -- we'll cut out all the pork.

dialogue_sentences: ['And I want to make sure that we are focused on those programs that work.', 'Now, Senator McCain talks a lot about earmarks.', "That's one of the centerpieces of his campaign."]
dialogue: And I want to make sure that we are focused on those programs that work. Now, Senator McCain talks a lot about earmarks. That's one of the centerpieces of his campaign.
snippet_sentences: ["There's no doubt that the system needs reform and there are a lot of screwy things that we end up spending money on, and they need to be eliminated."]
snippet: There's no doubt that the system needs reform and there are a lot of screwy things that we end up spending money on, and they need to be eliminated.

dialogue_sentences: ['Because they have to balance their budgets.', 'I will balance our budgets and I will get them and I will...', '... reduce this -- I can -- we can do it with this kind of job creation of energy independence.']
dialogue: Because they have to balance their budgets. I will balance our budgets and I will get them and I will... ... reduce this -- I can -- we can do it with this kind of job creation of energy independence.
snippet_sentences: ["Now, look, Americans are hurting tonight and they're angry and I understand that, and they want a new direction."]
snippet: Now, look, Americans are hurting tonight and they're angry and I understand that, and they want a new direction.

dialogue_sentences: ['He voted for the last two budgets that had that $24 billion more in spending than the budget that the Bush administration proposed.', 'He voted for the energy bill that was full of goodies for the oil companies that I opposed.', "So the fact is, let's look at our records, Senator Obama."]
dialogue: He voted for the last two budgets that had that $24 billion more in spending than the budget that the Bush administration proposed. He voted for the energy bill that was full of goodies for the oil companies that I opposed. So the fact is, let's look at our records, Senator Obama.
snippet_sentences: ["Let's look at it as graded by the National Taxpayers Union and the Citizens Against Government Waste and the other watchdog organizations."]
snippet: Let's look at it as graded by the National Taxpayers Union and the Citizens Against Government Waste and the other watchdog organizations.

dialogue_sentences: ["So I've got a history of reaching across the aisle.", 'Now with respect to a couple of things Senator McCain said, the notion that I voted for a tax increase for people making $42,000 a year has been disputed by everybody who has looked at this claim that Senator McCain keeps on making.', "Even FOX News disputes it, and that doesn't happen very often when it comes to accusations about me."]
dialogue: So I've got a history of reaching across the aisle. Now with respect to a couple of things Senator McCain said, the notion that I voted for a tax increase for people making $42,000 a year has been disputed by everybody who has looked at this claim that Senator McCain keeps on making. Even FOX News disputes it, and that doesn't happen very often when it comes to accusations about me.
snippet_sentences: ["So the fact of the matter is that if I occasionally have mistaken your policies for George Bush's policies, it's because on the core economic issues that matter to the American people, on tax policy, on energy policy, on spending priorities, you have been a vigorous supporter of President Bush."]
snippet: So the fact of the matter is that if I occasionally have mistaken your policies for George Bush's policies, it's because on the core economic issues that matter to the American people, on tax policy, on energy policy, on spending priorities, you have been a vigorous supporter of President Bush.

snippet_sentences: ['Well, this has been a tough campaign.', "It's been a very tough campaign."]
snippet: Well, this has been a tough campaign. It's been a very tough campaign.

dialogue_sentences: ['And I regret some of the negative aspects of both campaigns.', 'But the fact is that it has taken many turns which I think are unacceptable.', "One of them happened just the other day, when a man I admire and respect -- I've written about him -- Congressman John Lewis, an American hero, made allegations that Sarah Palin and I were somehow associated with the worst chapter in American history, segregation, deaths of children in church bombings, George Wallace."]
dialogue: And I regret some of the negative aspects of both campaigns. But the fact is that it has taken many turns which I think are unacceptable. One of them happened just the other day, when a man I admire and respect -- I've written about him -- Congressman John Lewis, an American hero, made allegations that Sarah Palin and I were somehow associated with the worst chapter in American history, segregation, deaths of children in church bombings, George Wallace.
snippet_sentences: ['That, to me, was so hurtful.']
snippet: That, to me, was so hurtful.

dialogue_sentences: ['I think that, if you look at the record and the impressions of the American people -- Bob, your network just did a poll, showing that two-thirds of the American people think that Senator McCain is running a negative campaign versus one-third of mine.', 'And 100 percent, John, of your ads -- 100 percent of them have been negative.', 'It absolutely is true.']
dialogue: I think that, if you look at the record and the impressions of the American people -- Bob, your network just did a poll, showing that two-thirds of the American people think that Senator McCain is running a negative campaign versus one-third of mine. And 100 percent, John, of your ads -- 100 percent of them have been negative. It absolutely is true.
snippet_sentences: ['And, now, I think the American people are less interested in our hurt feelings during the course of the campaign than addressing the issues that matter to them so deeply.']
snippet: And, now, I think the American people are less interested in our hurt feelings during the course of the campaign than addressing the issues that matter to them so deeply.

dialogue_sentences: ["Whenever you get a large rally of 10,000, 15,000, 20,000 people, you're going to have some fringe peoples.", 'You know that.', "And I've -- and we've always said that that's not appropriate."]
dialogue: Whenever you get a large rally of 10,000, 15,000, 20,000 people, you're going to have some fringe peoples. You know that. And I've -- and we've always said that that's not appropriate.
snippet_sentences: ['But to somehow say that group of young women who said "Military wives for McCain" are somehow saying anything derogatory about you, but anything -- and those veterans that wear those hats that say "World War II, Vietnam, Korea, Iraq," I\'m not going to stand for people saying that the people that come to my rallies are anything but the most dedicated, patriotic men and women that are in this nation and they\'re great citizens.']
snippet: But to somehow say that group of young women who said "Military wives for McCain" are somehow saying anything derogatory about you, but anything -- and those veterans that wear those hats that say "World War II, Vietnam, Korea, Iraq," I'm not going to stand for people saying that the people that come to my rallies are anything but the most dedicated, patriotic men and women that are in this nation and they're great citizens.

dialogue_sentences: ['On economic policy, I associate with Warren Buffett and former Fed Chairman Paul Volcker.', "If I'm interested in figuring out my foreign policy, I associate myself with my running mate, Joe Biden or with Dick Lugar, the Republican ranking member on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, or General Jim Jones, the former supreme allied commander of NATO.", 'Those are the people, Democrats and Republicans, who have shaped my ideas and who will be surrounding me in the White House.']
dialogue: On economic policy, I associate with Warren Buffett and former Fed Chairman Paul Volcker. If I'm interested in figuring out my foreign policy, I associate myself with my running mate, Joe Biden or with Dick Lugar, the Republican ranking member on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee, or General Jim Jones, the former supreme allied commander of NATO. Those are the people, Democrats and Republicans, who have shaped my ideas and who will be surrounding me in the White House.
snippet_sentences: ['And I think the fact that this has become such an important part of your campaign, Senator McCain, says more about your campaign than it says about me.']
snippet: And I think the fact that this has become such an important part of your campaign, Senator McCain, says more about your campaign than it says about me.

dialogue_sentences: ["What we can't do, I think, is try to characterize each other as bad people.", 'And that has been a culture in Washington that has been taking place for too long.', 'But as Senator Clinton said in her debates with you, we need to know the full extent of that relationship.']
dialogue: What we can't do, I think, is try to characterize each other as bad people. And that has been a culture in Washington that has been taking place for too long. But as Senator Clinton said in her debates with you, we need to know the full extent of that relationship.
snippet_sentences: ["We need to know the full extent of Senator Obama's relationship with ACORN, who is now on the verge of maybe perpetrating one of the greatest frauds in voter history in this country, maybe destroying the fabric of democracy."]
snippet: We need to know the full extent of Senator Obama's relationship with ACORN, who is now on the verge of maybe perpetrating one of the greatest frauds in voter history in this country, maybe destroying the fabric of democracy.

dialogue_sentences: ['And Democrats and Republicans alike, I think, acknowledge his expertise there.', "But it's also that his entire life he has never forgotten where he came from, coming from Scranton, fighting on behalf of working families, remembering what it's like to see his father lose his job and go through a downward spiral economically.", 'And, as a consequence, his consistent pattern throughout his career is to fight for the little guy.']
dialogue: And Democrats and Republicans alike, I think, acknowledge his expertise there. But it's also that his entire life he has never forgotten where he came from, coming from Scranton, fighting on behalf of working families, remembering what it's like to see his father lose his job and go through a downward spiral economically. And, as a consequence, his consistent pattern throughout his career is to fight for the little guy.
snippet_sentences: ["That's what he's done when it comes to economic policies that will help working families get a leg up."]
snippet: That's what he's done when it comes to economic policies that will help working families get a leg up.

dialogue_sentences: ["She's cut the size of government.", "She negotiated with the oil companies and faced them down, a $40 billion pipeline of natural gas that's going to relieve the energy needs of the United -- of what they call the lower 48.", "She's a reformer through and through."]
dialogue: She's cut the size of government. She negotiated with the oil companies and faced them down, a $40 billion pipeline of natural gas that's going to relieve the energy needs of the United -- of what they call the lower 48. She's a reformer through and through.
snippet_sentences: ["And it's time we had that bresh of freth air (sic) -- breath of fresh air coming into our nation's capital and sweep out the old-boy network and the cronyism that's been so much a part of it that I've fought against for all these years."]
snippet: And it's time we had that bresh of freth air (sic) -- breath of fresh air coming into our nation's capital and sweep out the old-boy network and the cronyism that's been so much a part of it that I've fought against for all these years.

dialogue_sentences: ["But I do point out that he's been wrong on many foreign policy and national security issues, which is supposed to be his strength.", 'He voted against the first Gulf War.', "He voted against it and, obviously, we had to take Saddam Hussein out of Kuwait or it would've threatened the Middle Eastern world supply."]
dialogue: But I do point out that he's been wrong on many foreign policy and national security issues, which is supposed to be his strength. He voted against the first Gulf War. He voted against it and, obviously, we had to take Saddam Hussein out of Kuwait or it would've threatened the Middle Eastern world supply.
snippet_sentences: ['In Iraq, he had this cockamamie idea about dividing Iraq into three countries.']
snippet: In Iraq, he had this cockamamie idea about dividing Iraq into three countries.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, let me just said that that this is -- he -- Senator Obama doesn't want a free trade agreement with our best ally in the region but wants to sit down across the table without precondition to -- with Hugo Chavez, the guy who has been helping FARC, the terrorist organization.", 'Free trade between ourselves and Colombia, I just recited to you the benefits of concluding that agreement, a billion dollars of American dollars that could have gone to creating jobs and businesses in the United States, opening up those markets.', "So I don't -- I don't think there's any doubt that Senator Obama wants to restrict trade and he wants to raise taxes."]
dialogue: Well, let me just said that that this is -- he -- Senator Obama doesn't want a free trade agreement with our best ally in the region but wants to sit down across the table without precondition to -- with Hugo Chavez, the guy who has been helping FARC, the terrorist organization. Free trade between ourselves and Colombia, I just recited to you the benefits of concluding that agreement, a billion dollars of American dollars that could have gone to creating jobs and businesses in the United States, opening up those markets. So I don't -- I don't think there's any doubt that Senator Obama wants to restrict trade and he wants to raise taxes.
snippet_sentences: ['And the last president of the United States that tried that was Herbert Hoover, and we went from a deep recession into a depression.']
snippet: And the last president of the United States that tried that was Herbert Hoover, and we went from a deep recession into a depression.

dialogue_sentences: ['And we are going to make sure that we manage chronic illnesses, like diabetes and heart disease, that cost a huge amount, but could be prevented.', "We've got to put more money into preventive care.", "This will cost some money on the front end, but over the long term this is the only way that not only are we going to make families healthy, but it's also how we're going to save the federal budget, because we can't afford these escalating costs."]
dialogue: And we are going to make sure that we manage chronic illnesses, like diabetes and heart disease, that cost a huge amount, but could be prevented. We've got to put more money into preventive care. This will cost some money on the front end, but over the long term this is the only way that not only are we going to make families healthy, but it's also how we're going to save the federal budget, because we can't afford these escalating costs.
snippet_sentences: ['Well, it is a terribly painful situation for Americans.']
snippet: Well, it is a terribly painful situation for Americans.

dialogue_sentences: ["You won't pay a fine, because...", 'Zero?', "Zero, because as I said in our last debate and I'll repeat, John, I exempt small businesses from the requirement for large businesses that can afford to provide health care to their employees, but are not doing it."]
dialogue: You won't pay a fine, because... Zero? Zero, because as I said in our last debate and I'll repeat, John, I exempt small businesses from the requirement for large businesses that can afford to provide health care to their employees, but are not doing it.
snippet_sentences: ['I exempt small businesses from having to pay into a kitty.']
snippet: I exempt small businesses from having to pay into a kitty.

dialogue_sentences: ['And Detroit had dragged its feet too long in terms of getting that done.', "It's going to be one of my highest priorities because transportation accounts for about 30 percent of our total energy consumption.", 'If we can get that right, then we can move in a direction not only of energy independence, but we can create 5 million new jobs all across America, including in the heartland where we can retool some of these plants to make these highly fuel-efficient cars and also to make wind turbines and solar panels, the kinds of clean energy approaches that should be the driver of our economy for the next century.']
dialogue: And Detroit had dragged its feet too long in terms of getting that done. It's going to be one of my highest priorities because transportation accounts for about 30 percent of our total energy consumption. If we can get that right, then we can move in a direction not only of energy independence, but we can create 5 million new jobs all across America, including in the heartland where we can retool some of these plants to make these highly fuel-efficient cars and also to make wind turbines and solar panels, the kinds of clean energy approaches that should be the driver of our economy for the next century.
snippet_sentences: ["Well, let me just said that that this is -- he -- Senator Obama doesn't want a free trade agreement with our best ally in the region but wants to sit down across the table without precondition to -- with Hugo Chavez, the guy who has been helping FARC, the terrorist organization."]
snippet: Well, let me just said that that this is -- he -- Senator Obama doesn't want a free trade agreement with our best ally in the region but wants to sit down across the table without precondition to -- with Hugo Chavez, the guy who has been helping FARC, the terrorist organization.

dialogue_sentences: ['The average family is paying an additional $900 a year in higher premiums because of the uninsured.', "So here's what we do.", 'We exempt small businesses.']
dialogue: The average family is paying an additional $900 a year in higher premiums because of the uninsured. So here's what we do. We exempt small businesses.
snippet_sentences: ["In fact, what, Joe, if you want to do the right thing with your employees and you want to provide them health insurance, we'll give you a 50 percent credit so that you will actually be able to afford it."]
snippet: In fact, what, Joe, if you want to do the right thing with your employees and you want to provide them health insurance, we'll give you a 50 percent credit so that you will actually be able to afford it.

dialogue_sentences: ["For the first time in history, you will be taxing people's health care benefits.", 'By the way, the average policy costs about $12,000.', "So if you've got $5,000 and it's going to cost you $12,000, that's a loss for you."]
dialogue: For the first time in history, you will be taxing people's health care benefits. By the way, the average policy costs about $12,000. So if you've got $5,000 and it's going to cost you $12,000, that's a loss for you.
snippet_sentences: ["Last point about Senator McCain's plan is that insurers right now, the main restrictions on what they do is primarily state law and, under Senator McCain's plan, those rules would be stripped away and you would start seeing a lot more insurance companies cherry-picking and excluding people from coverage."]
snippet: Last point about Senator McCain's plan is that insurers right now, the main restrictions on what they do is primarily state law and, under Senator McCain's plan, those rules would be stripped away and you would start seeing a lot more insurance companies cherry-picking and excluding people from coverage.

dialogue_sentences: ['By the way, the average policy costs about $12,000.', "So if you've got $5,000 and it's going to cost you $12,000, that's a loss for you.", "Last point about Senator McCain's plan is that insurers right now, the main restrictions on what they do is primarily state law and, under Senator McCain's plan, those rules would be stripped away and you would start seeing a lot more insurance companies cherry-picking and excluding people from coverage."]
dialogue: By the way, the average policy costs about $12,000. So if you've got $5,000 and it's going to cost you $12,000, that's a loss for you.
