Last point about Senator McCain's plan is that insurers right now, the main restrictions on what they do is primarily state law and, under Senator McCain's plan, those rules would be stripped away and you would start seeing a lot more insurance companies cherry-picking and excluding people from coverage.
snippet_sentences: ['That, I think, is a mistake and I think that this is a fundamental difference in our campaign and how we would approach health care.']
snippet: That, I think, is a mistake and I think that this is a fundamental difference in our campaign and how we would approach health care.

dialogue_sentences: ["Last point about Senator McCain's plan is that insurers right now, the main restrictions on what they do is primarily state law and, under Senator McCain's plan, those rules would be stripped away and you would start seeing a lot more insurance companies cherry-picking and excluding people from coverage.", 'That, I think, is a mistake and I think that this is a fundamental difference in our campaign and how we would approach health care.', "Hey, Joe, you're rich, congratulations, because what Joe wanted to do was buy the business that he's been working for 10-12 hours a day, seven days a week, and you said that you wanted to spread the wealth, but -- in other words, take Joe's money and then you decide what to do with it."]
dialogue: Last point about Senator McCain's plan is that insurers right now, the main restrictions on what they do is primarily state law and, under Senator McCain's plan, those rules would be stripped away and you would start seeing a lot more insurance companies cherry-picking and excluding people from coverage. That, I think, is a mistake and I think that this is a fundamental difference in our campaign and how we would approach health care. Hey, Joe, you're rich, congratulations, because what Joe wanted to do was buy the business that he's been working for 10-12 hours a day, seven days a week, and you said that you wanted to spread the wealth, but -- in other words, take Joe's money and then you decide what to do with it.
snippet_sentences: ["Now, Joe, you're rich, congratulations, and you will then fall into the category where you'll have to pay a fine if you don't provide health insurance that Senator Obama mandates, not the kind that you think is best for your family, your children, your employees, but the kind that he mandates for you."]
snippet: Now, Joe, you're rich, congratulations, and you will then fall into the category where you'll have to pay a fine if you don't provide health insurance that Senator Obama mandates, not the kind that you think is best for your family, your children, your employees, but the kind that he mandates for you.

dialogue_sentences: ['Obviously, that law waived the statute of limitations, which you could have gone back 20 or 30 years.', "It was a trial lawyer's dream.", 'Let me talk to you about an important aspect of this issue.']
dialogue: Obviously, that law waived the statute of limitations, which you could have gone back 20 or 30 years. It was a trial lawyer's dream. Let me talk to you about an important aspect of this issue.
snippet_sentences: ['We have to change the culture of America.']
snippet: We have to change the culture of America.

dialogue_sentences: ['This is an issue that -- look, it divides us.', 'But there surely is some common ground when both those who believe in choice and those who are opposed to abortion can come together and say, "We should try to prevent unintended pregnancies by providing appropriate education to our youth, communicating that sexuality is sacred and that they should not be engaged in cavalier activity, and providing options for adoption, and helping single mothers if they want to choose to keep the baby."', "Those are all things that we put in the Democratic platform for the first time this year, and I think that's where we can find some common ground, because nobody's pro-abortion."]
dialogue: This is an issue that -- look, it divides us. But there surely is some common ground when both those who believe in choice and those who are opposed to abortion can come together and say, "We should try to prevent unintended pregnancies by providing appropriate education to our youth, communicating that sexuality is sacred and that they should not be engaged in cavalier activity, and providing options for adoption, and helping single mothers if they want to choose to keep the baby." Those are all things that we put in the Democratic platform for the first time this year, and I think that's where we can find some common ground, because nobody's pro-abortion.
snippet_sentences: ["I think it's always a tragic situation."]
snippet: I think it's always a tragic situation.

dialogue_sentences: ['I voted for Justice Breyer and Justice Ginsburg.', 'Not because I agreed with their ideology, but because I thought they were qualified and that elections have consequences when presidents are nominated.', "This is a very important issue we're talking about."]
dialogue: I voted for Justice Breyer and Justice Ginsburg. Not because I agreed with their ideology, but because I thought they were qualified and that elections have consequences when presidents are nominated. This is a very important issue we're talking about.
snippet_sentences: ["Senator Obama voted against Justice Breyer and Justice Roberts on the grounds that they didn't meet his ideological standards.", "That's not the way we should judge these nominees."]
snippet: Senator Obama voted against Justice Breyer and Justice Roberts on the grounds that they didn't meet his ideological standards. That's not the way we should judge these nominees.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have to change the culture of America.', 'Those of us who are proudly pro-life understand that.', "And it's got to be courage and compassion that we show to a young woman who's facing this terribly difficult decision."]
dialogue: We have to change the culture of America. Those of us who are proudly pro-life understand that. And it's got to be courage and compassion that we show to a young woman who's facing this terribly difficult decision.
snippet_sentences: ['Senator Obama, as a member of the Illinois State Senate, voted in the Judiciary Committee against a law that would provide immediate medical attention to a child born of a failed abortion.', 'He voted against that.', 'And then, on the floor of the State Senate, as he did 130 times as a state senator, he voted present.', 'Then there was another bill before the Senate Judiciary Committee in the state of Illinois not that long ago, where he voted against a ban on partial-birth abortion, one of the late-term abortion, a really -- one of the bad procedures, a terrible.', 'And then, on the floor of the Illinois State Senate, he voted present.']
snippet: Senator Obama, as a member of the Illinois State Senate, voted in the Judiciary Committee against a law that would provide immediate medical attention to a child born of a failed abortion. He voted against that. And then, on the floor of the State Senate, as he did 130 times as a state senator, he voted present. Then there was another bill before the Senate Judiciary Committee in the state of Illinois not that long ago, where he voted against a ban on partial-birth abortion, one of the late-term abortion, a really -- one of the bad procedures, a terrible. And then, on the floor of the Illinois State Senate, he voted present.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well, thank you again, Bob.', 'Thanks to Hofstra.', "And it's great to be with you again."]
dialogue: Well, thank you again, Bob. Thanks to Hofstra. And it's great to be with you again.
snippet_sentences: ["I think we've had a very healthy discussion."]
snippet: I think we've had a very healthy discussion.

dialogue_sentences: ["I think we've had a very healthy discussion.", 'My friends, as I said in my opening remarks, these are very difficult times and challenges for America.', 'And they were graphically demonstrated again today.']
dialogue: I think we've had a very healthy discussion. My friends, as I said in my opening remarks, these are very difficult times and challenges for America. And they were graphically demonstrated again today.
snippet_sentences: ['America needs a new direction.']
snippet: America needs a new direction.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I hope you'll give me an opportunity to serve again.", "I'd be honored and humbled.", 'Well, I want to thank Senator McCain and Bob for moderating.']
dialogue: And I hope you'll give me an opportunity to serve again. I'd be honored and humbled. Well, I want to thank Senator McCain and Bob for moderating.
snippet_sentences: ['I think we all know America is going through tough times right now.']
snippet: I think we all know America is going through tough times right now.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'd be honored and humbled.", 'Well, I want to thank Senator McCain and Bob for moderating.', 'I think we all know America is going through tough times right now.']
dialogue: I'd be honored and humbled. Well, I want to thank Senator McCain and Bob for moderating. I think we all know America is going through tough times right now.
snippet_sentences: ["The policies of the last eight years and -- and Washington's unwillingness to tackle the tough problems for decades has left us in the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression."]
snippet: The policies of the last eight years and -- and Washington's unwillingness to tackle the tough problems for decades has left us in the worst economic crisis since the Great Depression.

dialogue_sentences: ["We need fundamental change in this country, and that's what I'd like to bring.", "You've shared your stories with me.", "And you've confirmed once again the fundamental decency and generosity of the American people."]
dialogue: We need fundamental change in this country, and that's what I'd like to bring. You've shared your stories with me. And you've confirmed once again the fundamental decency and generosity of the American people.
snippet_sentences: ["And that's why I'm sure that our brighter days are still ahead."]
snippet: And that's why I'm sure that our brighter days are still ahead.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's not going to be quick.", 'It is going to be requiring all of us -- Democrats, Republicans, independents -- to come together and to renew a spirit of sacrifice and service and responsibility.', "I'm absolutely convinced we can do it."]
dialogue: It's not going to be quick. It is going to be requiring all of us -- Democrats, Republicans, independents -- to come together and to renew a spirit of sacrifice and service and responsibility. I'm absolutely convinced we can do it.
snippet_sentences: ['I would ask for your vote, and I promise you that if you give me the extraordinary honor of serving as your president, I will work every single day, tirelessly, on your behalf and on the behalf of the future of our children.']
snippet: I would ask for your vote, and I promise you that if you give me the extraordinary honor of serving as your president, I will work every single day, tirelessly, on your behalf and on the behalf of the future of our children.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have to make quality education there for all of our citizens, not just the privileged few.', 'We have to stop the spending.', "We have to stop the spending, which has mortgaged your children's futures."]
dialogue: We have to make quality education there for all of our citizens, not just the privileged few. We have to stop the spending. We have to stop the spending, which has mortgaged your children's futures.
snippet_sentences: ['All of these things and all the promises and commitments that Senator Obama and I made (inaudible) made to you tonight will base -- will be based on whether you can trust us or not to be careful stewards of your tax dollar, to make sure America is safe and secure and prosperous, to make sure we reform the institutions of government.']
snippet: All of these things and all the promises and commitments that Senator Obama and I made (inaudible) made to you tonight will base -- will be based on whether you can trust us or not to be careful stewards of your tax dollar, to make sure America is safe and secure and prosperous, to make sure we reform the institutions of government.

dialogue_sentences: ['And we would have lost a million jobs.', "And that -- don't take my word for it, take the executives at GM and Chrysler, some of whom are Republicans, may even support Governor Romney.", "But they'll tell you his prescription wasn't going to work."]
dialogue: And we would have lost a million jobs. And that -- don't take my word for it, take the executives at GM and Chrysler, some of whom are Republicans, may even support Governor Romney. But they'll tell you his prescription wasn't going to work.
snippet_sentences: ["And Governor Romney's says he's got a five-point plan?", "Governor Romney doesn't have a five-point plan.", 'He has a one-point plan.', 'And that plan is to make sure that folks at the top play by a different set of rules.', "That's been his philosophy in the private sector, that's been his philosophy as governor, that's been his philosophy as a presidential candidate."]
snippet: And Governor Romney's says he's got a five-point plan? Governor Romney doesn't have a five-point plan. He has a one-point plan. And that plan is to make sure that folks at the top play by a different set of rules. That's been his philosophy in the private sector, that's been his philosophy as governor, that's been his philosophy as a presidential candidate.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's why we've invested in solar and wind and biofuels, energy efficient cars.", "We've got to reduce our deficit, but we've got to do it in a balanced way.", 'Asking the wealthy to pay a little bit more along with cuts so that we can invest in education like yours.']
dialogue: That's why we've invested in solar and wind and biofuels, energy efficient cars. We've got to reduce our deficit, but we've got to do it in a balanced way. Asking the wealthy to pay a little bit more along with cuts so that we can invest in education like yours.
snippet_sentences: ["And let's take the money that we've been spending on war over the last decade to rebuild America, roads, bridges schools.", "We do those things, not only is your future going to be bright but America's future is going to bright as well."]
snippet: And let's take the money that we've been spending on war over the last decade to rebuild America, roads, bridges schools. We do those things, not only is your future going to be bright but America's future is going to bright as well.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's total over the last four years.", "One of the reasons for that is that people think it's more attractive in some cases to go offshore than to stay here.", 'We have made it less attractive for enterprises to stay here than to go offshore from time to time.']
dialogue: That's total over the last four years. One of the reasons for that is that people think it's more attractive in some cases to go offshore than to stay here. We have made it less attractive for enterprises to stay here than to go offshore from time to time.
snippet_sentences: ["What I will do as president is make sure it's more attractive to come to America again."]
snippet: What I will do as president is make sure it's more attractive to come to America again.

dialogue_sentences: ["This is the way we're going to create jobs in this country.", "It's not by trickle-down government, saying we're going to take more money from people and hire more government workers, raise more taxes, put in place more regulations.", 'Trickle-down government has never worked here, has never worked anywhere.']
dialogue: This is the way we're going to create jobs in this country. It's not by trickle-down government, saying we're going to take more money from people and hire more government workers, raise more taxes, put in place more regulations. Trickle-down government has never worked here, has never worked anywhere.
snippet_sentences: ['I want to make America the most attractive place in the world for entrepreneurs, for small business, for big business, to invest and grow in America.']
snippet: I want to make America the most attractive place in the world for entrepreneurs, for small business, for big business, to invest and grow in America.

dialogue_sentences: ["Thank you, and that's an opportunity for me, and I appreciate it.", "In the nature of a campaign, it seems that some campaigns are focused on attacking a person rather than prescribing their own future and the things they'd like to do.", "In the course of that, I think the president's campaign has tried to characterize me as -- as someone who's very different than who I am."]
dialogue: Thank you, and that's an opportunity for me, and I appreciate it. In the nature of a campaign, it seems that some campaigns are focused on attacking a person rather than prescribing their own future and the things they'd like to do. In the course of that, I think the president's campaign has tried to characterize me as -- as someone who's very different than who I am.
snippet_sentences: ['I care about 100 percent of the American people.', 'I want 100 percent of the American people to have a bright and prosperous future.']
snippet: I care about 100 percent of the American people. I want 100 percent of the American people to have a bright and prosperous future.

dialogue_sentences: ['I served as governor and showed I could get them done.', 'Barry, I think a lot of this campaign, maybe over the last four years, has been devoted to this nation that I think government creates jobs, that that somehow is the answer.', "That's not what I believe."]
dialogue: I served as governor and showed I could get them done. Barry, I think a lot of this campaign, maybe over the last four years, has been devoted to this nation that I think government creates jobs, that that somehow is the answer. That's not what I believe.
snippet_sentences: ["I believe that the free enterprise system is the greatest engine of prosperity the world's ever known."]
snippet: I believe that the free enterprise system is the greatest engine of prosperity the world's ever known.

dialogue_sentences: ["We don't have to settle for 47 million people on food stamps.", "We don't have to settle for 50 percent of kids coming out of college not able to get work.", "We don't have to settle for 23 million people struggling to find a good job."]
dialogue: We don't have to settle for 47 million people on food stamps. We don't have to settle for 50 percent of kids coming out of college not able to get work. We don't have to settle for 23 million people struggling to find a good job.
snippet_sentences: ["If I become president, I'll get America working again."]
snippet: If I become president, I'll get America working again.

dialogue_sentences: ["But when he's asked, how are you going to do it, which deductions, which loopholes are you going to close?", "We haven't heard from the governor any specifics beyond Big Bird and eliminating funding for Planned Parenthood in terms of how he pays for that.", 'Now, Governor Romney was a very successful investor.']
dialogue: But when he's asked, how are you going to do it, which deductions, which loopholes are you going to close? We haven't heard from the governor any specifics beyond Big Bird and eliminating funding for Planned Parenthood in terms of how he pays for that. Now, Governor Romney was a very successful investor.
snippet_sentences: ["If somebody came to you, Governor, with a plan that said, here, I want to spend $7 or $8 trillion, and then we're going to pay for it, but we can't tell you until maybe after the election how we're going to do it, you wouldn't take such a sketchy deal and neither should you, the American people, because the math doesn't add up."]
snippet: If somebody came to you, Governor, with a plan that said, here, I want to spend $7 or $8 trillion, and then we're going to pay for it, but we can't tell you until maybe after the election how we're going to do it, you wouldn't take such a sketchy deal and neither should you, the American people, because the math doesn't add up.

dialogue_sentences: ['And why do I want to bring rates down, and at the same time lower exemptions and deductions, particularly for people at the high end?', 'Because if you bring rates down, it makes it easier for small business to keep more of their capital and hire people.', 'And for me, this is about jobs.']
dialogue: And why do I want to bring rates down, and at the same time lower exemptions and deductions, particularly for people at the high end? Because if you bring rates down, it makes it easier for small business to keep more of their capital and hire people. And for me, this is about jobs.
snippet_sentences: ["I want to get America's economy going again."]
snippet: I want to get America's economy going again.

dialogue_sentences: ["And it's named after this amazing woman who had been doing the same job as a man for years, found out that she was getting paid less, and the Supreme Court said that she couldn't bring suit because she should have found about it earlier, whereas she had no way of finding out about it.", 'So we fixed that.', "And that's an example of the kind of advocacy that we need, because women are increasingly the breadwinners in the family."]
dialogue: And it's named after this amazing woman who had been doing the same job as a man for years, found out that she was getting paid less, and the Supreme Court said that she couldn't bring suit because she should have found about it earlier, whereas she had no way of finding out about it. So we fixed that. And that's an example of the kind of advocacy that we need, because women are increasingly the breadwinners in the family.
snippet_sentences: ["This is not just a women's issue, this is a family issue, this is a middle-class issue, and that's why we've got to fight for it."]
snippet: This is not just a women's issue, this is a family issue, this is a middle-class issue, and that's why we've got to fight for it.

dialogue_sentences: ['An economy that has 23 million people looking for work is not a strong economy.', "An economy with 50 percent of kids graduating from college that can't finds a job, or a college level job, that's not what we have to have.", "I'm going to help women in America get good work by getting a stronger economy and by supporting women in the workforce."]
dialogue: An economy that has 23 million people looking for work is not a strong economy. An economy with 50 percent of kids graduating from college that can't finds a job, or a college level job, that's not what we have to have. I'm going to help women in America get good work by getting a stronger economy and by supporting women in the workforce.
snippet_sentences: ['He said, "I\'ll get back to you."', "And that's not the kind of advocacy that women need in any economy."]
snippet: He said, "I'll get back to you." And that's not the kind of advocacy that women need in any economy.

dialogue_sentences: ["I want to add more free trade agreements so we'll have more trade.", "Number three, I'm going to get us to a balanced budget.", "President Bush didn't."]
dialogue: I want to add more free trade agreements so we'll have more trade. Number three, I'm going to get us to a balanced budget. President Bush didn't.
snippet_sentences: ['President Obama was right, he said that that was outrageous to have deficits as high as half a trillion dollars under the Bush years.']
snippet: President Obama was right, he said that that was outrageous to have deficits as high as half a trillion dollars under the Bush years.

dialogue_sentences: ["Now, does that mean you're not struggling?", 'Absolutely not.', 'A lot of us are.']
dialogue: Now, does that mean you're not struggling? Absolutely not. A lot of us are.
snippet_sentences: ["And that's why the plan that I've put forward for manufacturing and education, and reducing our deficit in a sensible way, using the savings from ending wars, to rebuild America and putting people back to work."]
snippet: And that's why the plan that I've put forward for manufacturing and education, and reducing our deficit in a sensible way, using the savings from ending wars, to rebuild America and putting people back to work.

dialogue_sentences: ['I understand.', 'You might say, "Well, you got an example of one that worked better? "', "Yeah, in the Reagan recession where unemployment hit 10.8 percent, between that period -- the end of that recession and the equivalent of time to today, Ronald Reagan's recovery created twice as many jobs as this president's recovery."]
dialogue: I understand. You might say, "Well, you got an example of one that worked better? " Yeah, in the Reagan recession where unemployment hit 10.8 percent, between that period -- the end of that recession and the equivalent of time to today, Ronald Reagan's recovery created twice as many jobs as this president's recovery.
snippet_sentences: ["Five million jobs doesn't even keep up with our population growth.", 'And the only reason the unemployment rate seems a little lower today is because of all the people that have dropped out of the workforce.', "The president has tried, but his policies haven't worked."]
snippet: Five million jobs doesn't even keep up with our population growth. And the only reason the unemployment rate seems a little lower today is because of all the people that have dropped out of the workforce. The president has tried, but his policies haven't worked.

dialogue_sentences: ['Good.', 'Thank you for your question.', 'And let me step back and tell you what I would like to do with our immigration policy broadly and include an answer to your question.']
dialogue: Good. Thank you for your question. And let me step back and tell you what I would like to do with our immigration policy broadly and include an answer to your question.
snippet_sentences: ['But first of all, this is a nation of immigrants.', 'We welcome people coming to this country as immigrants.']
snippet: But first of all, this is a nation of immigrants. We welcome people coming to this country as immigrants.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I am ultimately responsible for what's taking place there because these are my folks, and I'm the one who has to greet those coffins when they come home.", 'You know that I mean what I say.', "Thank you Kerry for your question, it's an important one."]
dialogue: And I am ultimately responsible for what's taking place there because these are my folks, and I'm the one who has to greet those coffins when they come home. You know that I mean what I say. Thank you Kerry for your question, it's an important one.
snippet_sentences: ['And -- and I -- I think the president just said correctly that the buck does stop at his desk and -- and he takes responsibility for -- for that -- for the failure in providing those security resources, and -- and those terrible things may well happen from time to time.']
snippet: And -- and I -- I think the president just said correctly that the buck does stop at his desk and -- and he takes responsibility for -- for that -- for the failure in providing those security resources, and -- and those terrible things may well happen from time to time.

dialogue_sentences: ["We're a nation that believes in the Second Amendment, and I believe in the Second Amendment.", "We've got a long tradition of hunting and sportsmen and people who want to make sure they can protect themselves.", "But there have been too many instances during the course of my presidency, where I've had to comfort families who have lost somebody."]
dialogue: We're a nation that believes in the Second Amendment, and I believe in the Second Amendment. We've got a long tradition of hunting and sportsmen and people who want to make sure they can protect themselves. But there have been too many instances during the course of my presidency, where I've had to comfort families who have lost somebody.
snippet_sentences: ['You know, just a couple of weeks ago, actually, probably about a month, I saw a mother, who I had met at the bedside of her son, who had been shot in that theater.', 'And her son had been shot through the head.']
snippet: You know, just a couple of weeks ago, actually, probably about a month, I saw a mother, who I had met at the bedside of her son, who had been shot in that theater. And her son had been shot through the head.

dialogue_sentences: ['You know, just a couple of weeks ago, actually, probably about a month, I saw a mother, who I had met at the bedside of her son, who had been shot in that theater.', 'And her son had been shot through the head.', 'And we spent some time, and we said a prayer and, remarkably, about two months later, this young man and his mom showed up, and he looked unbelievable, good as new.']
dialogue: You know, just a couple of weeks ago, actually, probably about a month, I saw a mother, who I had met at the bedside of her son, who had been shot in that theater. And her son had been shot through the head. And we spent some time, and we said a prayer and, remarkably, about two months later, this young man and his mom showed up, and he looked unbelievable, good as new.
snippet_sentences: ["But there were a lot of families who didn't have that good fortune and whose sons or daughters or husbands didn't survive."]
snippet: But there were a lot of families who didn't have that good fortune and whose sons or daughters or husbands didn't survive.

dialogue_sentences: ['We will meet our commitments to maintain the freedom and independence of West Berlin.', 'Yes.', 'As a matter of fact, the statement that Senator Kennedy made was that - to the effect that there were trigger-happy Republicans, that my stand on Quemoy and Matsu was an indication of trigger-happy Republicans.']
dialogue: We will meet our commitments to maintain the freedom and independence of West Berlin. Yes. As a matter of fact, the statement that Senator Kennedy made was that - to the effect that there were trigger-happy Republicans, that my stand on Quemoy and Matsu was an indication of trigger-happy Republicans.
snippet_sentences: ['I resent that comment.']
snippet: I resent that comment.

dialogue_sentences: ['In addition to that, we have to move on other areas that are holding back growth.', 'I refer, for example, to distressed areas.', 'We have to move into those areas with programs so that we make adequate use of the resources of those areas.']
dialogue: In addition to that, we have to move on other areas that are holding back growth. I refer, for example, to distressed areas. We have to move into those areas with programs so that we make adequate use of the resources of those areas.
snippet_sentences: ['We also have to see that all of the people of the United States - the tremendous talents that our people have - are used adequately.']
snippet: We also have to see that all of the people of the United States - the tremendous talents that our people have - are used adequately.

dialogue_sentences: ['I favor it not because I want to make a lot of oil men rich, but because I want to make America rich.', 'Why do we have a depletion allowance?', 'Because this is the stimulation, the incentive for companies to go out and explore for oil, to develop it.']
dialogue: I favor it not because I want to make a lot of oil men rich, but because I want to make America rich. Why do we have a depletion allowance? Because this is the stimulation, the incentive for companies to go out and explore for oil, to develop it.
snippet_sentences: ["If we didn't have a depletion allowance of certainly, I believe, the present amount, we would have our oil exploration cut substantially in this country."]
snippet: If we didn't have a depletion allowance of certainly, I believe, the present amount, we would have our oil exploration cut substantially in this country.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well, Mr.', 'Von Fremd, the first thing we have to do is to continue to keep confidence abroad in the American dollar.']
dialogue: Well, Mr. Von Fremd, the first thing we have to do is to continue to keep confidence abroad in the American dollar.
snippet_sentences: ['That means that we must continue to have a balanced budget here at home in every possible circumstance that we can; because the moment that we have loss of confidence in our own fiscal policies at home, it results in gold flowing out.']
snippet: That means that we must continue to have a balanced budget here at home in every possible circumstance that we can; because the moment that we have loss of confidence in our own fiscal policies at home, it results in gold flowing out.

dialogue_sentences: ['Secondly, we have to increase our exports, as compared with our imports.', 'And here we have a very strong program going forward in the Department of Commerce.', 'This one must be stepped up.']
dialogue: Secondly, we have to increase our exports, as compared with our imports. And here we have a very strong program going forward in the Department of Commerce. This one must be stepped up.
snippet_sentences: ['Beyond that, as far as the gold supply is concerned, and as far as the movement of gold is concerned, uh - we have to bear in mind that we must get more help from our allies abroad in this great venture in which all free men are involved of winning the battle for freedom.']
snippet: Beyond that, as far as the gold supply is concerned, and as far as the movement of gold is concerned, uh - we have to bear in mind that we must get more help from our allies abroad in this great venture in which all free men are involved of winning the battle for freedom.

dialogue_sentences: ['And here we have a very strong program going forward in the Department of Commerce.', 'This one must be stepped up.', 'Beyond that, as far as the gold supply is concerned, and as far as the movement of gold is concerned, uh - we have to bear in mind that we must get more help from our allies abroad in this great venture in which all free men are involved of winning the battle for freedom.']
dialogue: And here we have a very strong program going forward in the Department of Commerce. This one must be stepped up. Beyond that, as far as the gold supply is concerned, and as far as the movement of gold is concerned, uh - we have to bear in mind that we must get more help from our allies abroad in this great venture in which all free men are involved of winning the battle for freedom.
snippet_sentences: ['Now America has been carrying a tremendous load in this respect.']
snippet: Now America has been carrying a tremendous load in this respect.

dialogue_sentences: ["But now we find that the countries of Europe for example, that we have aided, and Japan, that we've aided in the Far East; these countries - some our former enemies, have now recovered completely.", 'They have got to bear a greater share of this load of economic assistance abroad.', "That's why I am advocating, and will develop during the course of the next Administration - if, of course, I get the opportunity - a program in which we enlist more aid from these other countries on a concerted basis in the programs of economic development for Africa, Asia and Latin America."]
dialogue: But now we find that the countries of Europe for example, that we have aided, and Japan, that we've aided in the Far East; these countries - some our former enemies, have now recovered completely. They have got to bear a greater share of this load of economic assistance abroad. That's why I am advocating, and will develop during the course of the next Administration - if, of course, I get the opportunity - a program in which we enlist more aid from these other countries on a concerted basis in the programs of economic development for Africa, Asia and Latin America.
snippet_sentences: ['The United States cannot continue to carry the major share of this burden by itself.']
snippet: The United States cannot continue to carry the major share of this burden by itself.

dialogue_sentences: ["I will say this: in the event that such an attack occurred and in the event the attack was a prelude to an attack on Formosa - which would be the indication today because the Chinese Communists say over and over again that their objective is not the offshore islands, that they consider them only steppingstones to taking Formosa - in the event that their attack then were a prelude to an attack on Formosa, there isn't any question but that the United States would then again, as in the case of Berlin, honor our treaty obligations and stand by our ally of Formosa.", 'But to indicate in advance how we would respond, to indicate the nature of this response would be incorrect; it would certainly be inappropriate; it would not be in the best interests of the United States.', 'I will only say this, however, in addition: to do what Senator Kennedy has suggested - to suggest that we will surrender these islands or force our Chinese Nationalist allies to surrender them in advance - is not something that would lead to peace; it is something that would lead, in my opinion, to war.']
dialogue: I will say this: in the event that such an attack occurred and in the event the attack was a prelude to an attack on Formosa - which would be the indication today because the Chinese Communists say over and over again that their objective is not the offshore islands, that they consider them only steppingstones to taking Formosa - in the event that their attack then were a prelude to an attack on Formosa, there isn't any question but that the United States would then again, as in the case of Berlin, honor our treaty obligations and stand by our ally of Formosa. But to indicate in advance how we would respond, to indicate the nature of this response would be incorrect; it would certainly be inappropriate; it would not be in the best interests of the United States. I will only say this, however, in addition: to do what Senator Kennedy has suggested - to suggest that we will surrender these islands or force our Chinese Nationalist allies to surrender them in advance - is not something that would lead to peace; it is something that would lead, in my opinion, to war.
snippet_sentences: ['This is the history of dealing with dictators.']
snippet: This is the history of dealing with dictators.

dialogue_sentences: ['We tried this with Hitler.', "It didn't work.", 'He wanted first uh - we know, Austria, and then he went on to the Sudetenland and then Danzig, and each time it was thought this is all that he wanted.']
dialogue: We tried this with Hitler. It didn't work. He wanted first uh - we know, Austria, and then he went on to the Sudetenland and then Danzig, and each time it was thought this is all that he wanted.
snippet_sentences: ['Now what do the Chinese Communists want?', "They don't want just Quemoy and Matsu; they don't want just Formosa; they want the world."]
snippet: Now what do the Chinese Communists want? They don't want just Quemoy and Matsu; they don't want just Formosa; they want the world.

dialogue_sentences: ['So first it will be Quemoy and Matsu, next it may be Formosa.', 'What do we do then?', 'My point is this: that once you do this - follow this course of action - of indicating that you are not going to defend a particular area, the inevitable result is that it encourages a man who is determined to conquer the world to press you to the point of no return.']
dialogue: So first it will be Quemoy and Matsu, next it may be Formosa. What do we do then? My point is this: that once you do this - follow this course of action - of indicating that you are not going to defend a particular area, the inevitable result is that it encourages a man who is determined to conquer the world to press you to the point of no return.
snippet_sentences: ['We went through this tragic experience leading to World War II.', 'We learned our lesson again in Korea, We must not learn it again.']
snippet: We went through this tragic experience leading to World War II. We learned our lesson again in Korea, We must not learn it again.

dialogue_sentences: ['The road to war is always paved with good intentions.', 'And in this instance the good intentions, of course, are a desire for peace.', "But certainly we're not going to have peace by giving in and indicating in advance that we are not going to defend what has become a symbol of freedom."]
dialogue: The road to war is always paved with good intentions. And in this instance the good intentions, of course, are a desire for peace. But certainly we're not going to have peace by giving in and indicating in advance that we are not going to defend what has become a symbol of freedom.
snippet_sentences: ["I don't think it's possible for Mr. Nixon to state the record in distortion of the facts with more precision than he just did."]
snippet: I don't think it's possible for Mr. Nixon to state the record in distortion of the facts with more precision than he just did.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well Mr. Drummond, first of all, referring to Secretary Dulles' press conference, I think if you read it all - and I know that you have - you will find that Secretary Dulles also indicated in that press conference that when the troops were withdrawn from Quemoy, that the implication was certainly of everything that he said, that Quemoy could better be defended.", "There were too many infantrymen there, not enough heavy artillery; and certainly I don't think there was any implication in Secretary Dulles' statement that Quemoy and Matsu should not be defended in the event that they were attacked, and that attack was a preliminary to an attack on Formosa."]
dialogue: Well Mr. Drummond, first of all, referring to Secretary Dulles' press conference, I think if you read it all - and I know that you have - you will find that Secretary Dulles also indicated in that press conference that when the troops were withdrawn from Quemoy, that the implication was certainly of everything that he said, that Quemoy could better be defended. There were too many infantrymen there, not enough heavy artillery; and certainly I don't think there was any implication in Secretary Dulles' statement that Quemoy and Matsu should not be defended in the event that they were attacked, and that attack was a preliminary to an attack on Formosa.
snippet_sentences: ['Now as far as President Eisenhower is concerned, I have often heard him discuss this question.', 'As I uh - related a moment ago, the President has always indicated that we must not make the mistake in dealing with the dictator of indicating that we are going to make a concession at the point of a gun.']
snippet: Now as far as President Eisenhower is concerned, I have often heard him discuss this question. As I uh - related a moment ago, the President has always indicated that we must not make the mistake in dealing with the dictator of indicating that we are going to make a concession at the point of a gun.

dialogue_sentences: ['I would take any action necessary to defend the treaty, Formosa, and the Pescadores Island.', "What we're now talking about is the Vice President's determination to guarantee Quemoy and Matsu, which are four and five miles off the coast of Red China, which are not within the treaty area.", 'I do not suggest that Chiang Kai-shek - and this Administration has been attempting since 1955 to persuade Chiang Kai-shek to lessen his troop commitments.']
dialogue: I would take any action necessary to defend the treaty, Formosa, and the Pescadores Island. What we're now talking about is the Vice President's determination to guarantee Quemoy and Matsu, which are four and five miles off the coast of Red China, which are not within the treaty area. I do not suggest that Chiang Kai-shek - and this Administration has been attempting since 1955 to persuade Chiang Kai-shek to lessen his troop commitments.
snippet_sentences: ['Uh - He sent a mission - the President - in 1955 of Mr. uh - Robertson and Admiral Radford.', 'General Ridgway said - who was Chief of Staff: "To go to war for Quemoy and Matsu to me would seem an unwarranted and tragic course to take.', 'To me that concept is completely repugnant."', 'So I stand with them.', 'I stand with the Secretary of State, Mr. Herter, who said these islands were indefensible.']
snippet: Uh - He sent a mission - the President - in 1955 of Mr. uh - Robertson and Admiral Radford. General Ridgway said - who was Chief of Staff: "To go to war for Quemoy and Matsu to me would seem an unwarranted and tragic course to take. To me that concept is completely repugnant." So I stand with them. I stand with the Secretary of State, Mr. Herter, who said these islands were indefensible.

dialogue_sentences: ['I stand with the Secretary of State, Mr. Herter, who said these islands were indefensible.', 'I believe that we should meet our commitments, and if the Chinese Communists attack the Pescadores and Formosa, they know that it will mean a war.', 'But I merely say that the treaty is quite precise and I sustain the treaty.']
dialogue: I stand with the Secretary of State, Mr. Herter, who said these islands were indefensible. I believe that we should meet our commitments, and if the Chinese Communists attack the Pescadores and Formosa, they know that it will mean a war. But I merely say that the treaty is quite precise and I sustain the treaty.
snippet_sentences: ["Mr. Nixon would add a guarantee to islands five miles off the coast of the re- Republic of China when he's never really protested the Communists seizing Cuba, ninety miles off the coast of the United States."]
snippet: Mr. Nixon would add a guarantee to islands five miles off the coast of the re- Republic of China when he's never really protested the Communists seizing Cuba, ninety miles off the coast of the United States.

dialogue_sentences: ['Whenever you do that, inevitably the dictator is encouraged to try it again.', 'So first it will be Quemoy and Matsu, next it may be Formosa.', 'What do we do then?']
dialogue: Whenever you do that, inevitably the dictator is encouraged to try it again. So first it will be Quemoy and Matsu, next it may be Formosa. What do we do then?
snippet_sentences: ['My point is this: that once you do this - follow this course of action - of indicating that you are not going to defend a particular area, the inevitable result is that it encourages a man who is determined to conquer the world to press you to the point of no return.']
snippet: My point is this: that once you do this - follow this course of action - of indicating that you are not going to defend a particular area, the inevitable result is that it encourages a man who is determined to conquer the world to press you to the point of no return.

dialogue_sentences: ["He doesn't take that position that I've seen so far in Laos.", 'Guinea and Ghana have both moved within the Soviet sphere of influence in foreign policy; so has Cuba.', 'I merely say that the United States should meet its commitments to Que- to uh - Formosa and the Pescadores.']
dialogue: He doesn't take that position that I've seen so far in Laos. Guinea and Ghana have both moved within the Soviet sphere of influence in foreign policy; so has Cuba. I merely say that the United States should meet its commitments to Que- to uh - Formosa and the Pescadores.

snippet: But as Admiral Yarnell has said, and he's been supported by most military authority, these islands that we're now talking about are not worth the bones of a single American soldier; and I know how difficult it is to sustain troops close to the shore under artillery bombardment.

dialogue: He doesn't take that position that I've seen so far in Laos. Guinea and Ghana have both moved within the Soviet sphere of influence in foreign policy; so has Cuba. I merely say that the United States should meet its commitments to Que- to uh - Formosa and the Pescadores.
snippet_sentences: ["But as Admiral Yarnell has said, and he's been supported by most military authority, these islands that we're now talking about are not worth the bones of a single American soldier; and I know how difficult it is to sustain troops close to the shore under artillery bombardment."]
snippet: But as Admiral Yarnell has said, and he's been supported by most military authority, these islands that we're now talking about are not worth the bones of a single American soldier; and I know how difficult it is to sustain troops close to the shore under artillery bombardment.

dialogue_sentences: ["Uh - I obviously don't think it's valid.", "I have supported the Administration's position and I think that that position has been correct; I think my position has been correct.", 'As far as Indochina was concerned, I stated over and over again that it was essential during that period that the United States make it clear that we would not tolerate Indochina falling under Communist domination.']
dialogue: Uh - I obviously don't think it's valid. I have supported the Administration's position and I think that that position has been correct; I think my position has been correct. As far as Indochina was concerned, I stated over and over again that it was essential during that period that the United States make it clear that we would not tolerate Indochina falling under Communist domination.
snippet_sentences: ['Now, as a result of our taking the strong stand that we did, the civil war there was ended; and today, at least in the south of Indochina, the Communists have moved out and we do have a strong, free bastion there.']
snippet: Now, as a result of our taking the strong stand that we did, the civil war there was ended; and today, at least in the south of Indochina, the Communists have moved out and we do have a strong, free bastion there.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well the que- the - Mr. Griffin, I believe, who is the head of the Klan, who lives in Tampa, Florida, indicated a - in a statement, I think, two or three weeks ago that he was not going to vote for me, and that he was going to vote for Mr. Nixon.']
dialogue: Well the que- the - Mr. Griffin, I believe, who is the head of the Klan, who lives in Tampa, Florida, indicated a - in a statement, I think, two or three weeks ago that he was not going to vote for me, and that he was going to vote for Mr. Nixon.

snippet: I do not suggest in any way, nor have I ever, that that indicates that Mr. Nixon has the slightest sympathy, involvement, or in any way imply any inferences in regard to the Ku Klux Klan.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well the que- the - Mr. Griffin, I believe, who is the head of the Klan, who lives in Tampa, Florida, indicated a - in a statement, I think, two or three weeks ago that he was not going to vote for me, and that he was going to vote for Mr. Nixon.', 'I do not suggest in any way, nor have I ever, that that indicates that Mr. Nixon has the slightest sympathy, involvement, or in any way imply any inferences in regard to the Ku Klux Klan.']
dialogue: Well the que- the - Mr. Griffin, I believe, who is the head of the Klan, who lives in Tampa, Florida, indicated a - in a statement, I think, two or three weeks ago that he was not going to vote for me, and that he was going to vote for Mr. Nixon. I do not suggest in any way, nor have I ever, that that indicates that Mr. Nixon has the slightest sympathy, involvement, or in any way imply any inferences in regard to the Ku Klux Klan.

snippet: Mr. Nixon knows very well that in this - in this whole matter that's been involved with the so-called religious discussion in this campaign, I've never suggested, even by the vaguest implication, that he did anything but disapprove it.

dialogue_sentences: ['Also as far as religion is concerned.', 'I have seen Communism abroad.', 'I see what it does.']
dialogue: Also as far as religion is concerned. I have seen Communism abroad. I see what it does.
snippet_sentences: ['Communism is the enemy of all religions; and we who do believe in God must join together.']
