snippet_sentences: ["Also, we'll never be strong again overseas, unless we're strong at home."]
snippet: Also, we'll never be strong again overseas, unless we're strong at home.

dialogue_sentences: ['At the other extreme, uh - just 1 percent of the richest people in our country derive 25 percent of all the tax benefits.', "So both those extremes grasp for advantage and the person who has to pay that expense is the middle-income family who's still working for a living and they have to pay for the rich who have privilege, and for the poor who are not working.", 'But I think uh - uh - a balanced approach, with everybody being part of it and a striving for unselfishness, could help as it did in 1973 to let people sacrifice for their own country.']
dialogue: At the other extreme, uh - just 1 percent of the richest people in our country derive 25 percent of all the tax benefits. So both those extremes grasp for advantage and the person who has to pay that expense is the middle-income family who's still working for a living and they have to pay for the rich who have privilege, and for the poor who are not working. But I think uh - uh - a balanced approach, with everybody being part of it and a striving for unselfishness, could help as it did in 1973 to let people sacrifice for their own country.
snippet_sentences: ["I know I'm ready for it.", 'I think the American people are too.']
snippet: I know I'm ready for it. I think the American people are too.

dialogue_sentences: ['Uh I call that the people amendment.', 'I think if you really believe that the people of a state ought to make a decision on a matter of this kind that uh - we ought to have a federal constitutional amendment that would permit each one of the fifty states to make the choice.', 'Uh - I think this is a responsible and a proper way to proceed.']
dialogue: Uh I call that the people amendment. I think if you really believe that the people of a state ought to make a decision on a matter of this kind that uh - we ought to have a federal constitutional amendment that would permit each one of the fifty states to make the choice. Uh - I think this is a responsible and a proper way to proceed.
snippet_sentences: ['Uhh - I believe also that uh - there is some merit to a - an amendment that uh - uh - Senator Everett Dirksen uh - proposed very frequently, an amendment that would uh - change the court decision as far as voluntary prayer in public schools.']
snippet: Uhh - I believe also that uh - there is some merit to a - an amendment that uh - uh - Senator Everett Dirksen uh - proposed very frequently, an amendment that would uh - change the court decision as far as voluntary prayer in public schools.

snippet_sentences: ['Well, Mr. Kraft, uh - I violently disagree with your assessment.']
snippet: Well, Mr. Kraft, uh - I violently disagree with your assessment.

dialogue_sentences: ["But now let's talk about the pluses that came out this week.", 'We had an 18 percent increase in housing starts.', 'We had a substantial increase in new permits for housing.']
dialogue: But now let's talk about the pluses that came out this week. We had an 18 percent increase in housing starts. We had a substantial increase in new permits for housing.
snippet_sentences: ['As a matter of fact, based on the announcement this week, there will be at an annual rate of a million, eight hundred and some thousand new houses built, which is a tremendous increase over last year and a substantial increase over the earlier part of this year.']
snippet: As a matter of fact, based on the announcement this week, there will be at an annual rate of a million, eight hundred and some thousand new houses built, which is a tremendous increase over last year and a substantial increase over the earlier part of this year.

dialogue_sentences: ['And inflation hits everybody: those who are working and those who are on welfare.', 'The rate of inflation, as announced just the other day, is under 5 percent; and the uh - 4.4 percent that was indicated at the time of the 4 percent GNP was less than the 5.4 percent.', 'It means that the American buyer is getting a better bargain today because inflation is less.']
dialogue: And inflation hits everybody: those who are working and those who are on welfare. The rate of inflation, as announced just the other day, is under 5 percent; and the uh - 4.4 percent that was indicated at the time of the 4 percent GNP was less than the 5.4 percent. It means that the American buyer is getting a better bargain today because inflation is less.
snippet_sentences: ['With all due respect to President Ford, I think he ought to be ashamed of mentioning that statement, because we have the highest unemployment rate now than we had at any time between the Great Depression caused by Herbert Hoover and the time President Ford took office.']
snippet: With all due respect to President Ford, I think he ought to be ashamed of mentioning that statement, because we have the highest unemployment rate now than we had at any time between the Great Depression caused by Herbert Hoover and the time President Ford took office.

dialogue_sentences: ['The economic growth is less than half today what it was at the beginning of this year.', "And we've got a 35 percent unemployment rate in many areas of this country among construction workers.", "And Mr. Ford hasn't done anything about it."]
dialogue: The economic growth is less than half today what it was at the beginning of this year. And we've got a 35 percent unemployment rate in many areas of this country among construction workers. And Mr. Ford hasn't done anything about it.
snippet_sentences: ['And I think this shows a callous indifference to the families that have suffered so much.']
snippet: And I think this shows a callous indifference to the families that have suffered so much.

dialogue_sentences: ['He has vetoed bills passed by Congress within the congressional budget guidelines job opportunities for two million Americans.', "We'll never have a balanced budget, we'll never meet the needs of our people, we'll never control the inflationary spiral, as long as we have seven and a half or eight million people out of work, who are looking for jobs.", "And we've probably got two and a half more million people who are not looking for jobs any more, because they've given up hope."]
dialogue: He has vetoed bills passed by Congress within the congressional budget guidelines job opportunities for two million Americans. We'll never have a balanced budget, we'll never meet the needs of our people, we'll never control the inflationary spiral, as long as we have seven and a half or eight million people out of work, who are looking for jobs. And we've probably got two and a half more million people who are not looking for jobs any more, because they've given up hope.
snippet_sentences: ['That is a very serious indictment of this administration.', "It's probably the worst one of all."]
snippet: That is a very serious indictment of this administration. It's probably the worst one of all.

dialogue_sentences: ["There's no way to make a prediction that my family might be able to own a home or to put my kid through college.", 'Savings accounts are losing money instead of gaining money.', 'Inflation is robbing us.']
dialogue: There's no way to make a prediction that my family might be able to own a home or to put my kid through college. Savings accounts are losing money instead of gaining money. Inflation is robbing us.
snippet_sentences: ["Under the present administration - Nixon's and Ford's - we've had three times the inflation rate that we experienced under President Johnson and President Kennedy.", 'The economic growth is less than half today what it was at the beginning of this year.']
snippet: Under the present administration - Nixon's and Ford's - we've had three times the inflation rate that we experienced under President Johnson and President Kennedy. The economic growth is less than half today what it was at the beginning of this year.

dialogue_sentences: ['And at the beginning of the year I had about 2 percent.', "So the polls to me are interesting, but they don't determine, you know, my hopes or - or my despair.", 'I campaign among people.']
dialogue: And at the beginning of the year I had about 2 percent. So the polls to me are interesting, but they don't determine, you know, my hopes or - or my despair. I campaign among people.
snippet_sentences: ["I've never depended on powerful political figures to put me in office.", 'I have a direct relationship with hundreds of people around - hundreds of thousands around the country who actively campaign for me.']
snippet: I've never depended on powerful political figures to put me in office. I have a direct relationship with hundreds of people around - hundreds of thousands around the country who actively campaign for me.

dialogue_sentences: ['But I think our hold uh - of support among those who uh - are crucial to the election has been fairly steady.', "And my success in the primary season was, I think, notable for a newcomer, from someone who's from outside Washington, who - who never has been a part of the Washington establishment.", "And I think that we'll have good results uh - on November the second for myself and I hope for the country."]
dialogue: But I think our hold uh - of support among those who uh - are crucial to the election has been fairly steady. And my success in the primary season was, I think, notable for a newcomer, from someone who's from outside Washington, who - who never has been a part of the Washington establishment. And I think that we'll have good results uh - on November the second for myself and I hope for the country.
snippet_sentences: ["I think uh - the uh - increase and the uh - prospects as far as I'm concerned and the I - less favorable prospects for Governor Carter, reflect that Governor Carter uh - is inconsistent in many of the positions that he takes.", 'He tends to distort on a number of occasions.']
snippet: I think uh - the uh - increase and the uh - prospects as far as I'm concerned and the I - less favorable prospects for Governor Carter, reflect that Governor Carter uh - is inconsistent in many of the positions that he takes. He tends to distort on a number of occasions.

dialogue_sentences: ["For the last two years, I've been the president, and I have found from experience that it's much more difficult to make those decisions than it is to second-guess them.", 'I became president at the time that the United States was in a very troubled time.', 'We had inflation of over 12 percent, we were on the brink of the worst recession in the last forty years, we were still deeply involved in the problems of Vietnam.']
dialogue: For the last two years, I've been the president, and I have found from experience that it's much more difficult to make those decisions than it is to second-guess them. I became president at the time that the United States was in a very troubled time. We had inflation of over 12 percent, we were on the brink of the worst recession in the last forty years, we were still deeply involved in the problems of Vietnam.
snippet_sentences: ['The American people had lost faith and trust and confidence in the presidency itself.']
snippet: The American people had lost faith and trust and confidence in the presidency itself.

dialogue_sentences: ['But those are not the things that count.', 'What counts is, that the United States celebrated its 200th birthday on July fourth.', 'As a result of that wonderful experience all over the United States, there is a new spirit in America.']
dialogue: But those are not the things that count. What counts is, that the United States celebrated its 200th birthday on July fourth. As a result of that wonderful experience all over the United States, there is a new spirit in America.
snippet_sentences: ['The American people are healed, are working together.']
snippet: The American people are healed, are working together.

dialogue_sentences: ['I served an a hospital authority.', "And I was in the state senate and I was governor and I'm an engineer, a Naval officer, a farmer, a businessman.", 'And I believe we require someone who can work harmoniously with the Congress, who can work closely with the people of this country, and who can bring a new image and a new spirit to Washington.']
dialogue: I served an a hospital authority. And I was in the state senate and I was governor and I'm an engineer, a Naval officer, a farmer, a businessman. And I believe we require someone who can work harmoniously with the Congress, who can work closely with the people of this country, and who can bring a new image and a new spirit to Washington.
snippet_sentences: ['Our tax structure is a disgrace, it needs to be reformed.']
snippet: Our tax structure is a disgrace, it needs to be reformed.

dialogue_sentences: ['Our housing programs have uh - gone bad.', 'But now less than a third of our people can afford to buy their own homes.', 'The budget was more grossly out of balance last year than ever before in the history of our country - $65 billion - primarily because our people are not at work.']
dialogue: Our housing programs have uh - gone bad. But now less than a third of our people can afford to buy their own homes. The budget was more grossly out of balance last year than ever before in the history of our country - $65 billion - primarily because our people are not at work.
snippet_sentences: ["Inflation is robbing us, as we've already discussed, and the government bureaucracy is uh - just a horrible mess."]
snippet: Inflation is robbing us, as we've already discussed, and the government bureaucracy is uh - just a horrible mess.

dialogue_sentences: ["Now I don't know all the answers.", 'Nobody could.', 'But I do know that if the president of the United States and the Congress of the United States and the people of the United States said, "I believe our nation is greater than what we are now."']
dialogue: Now I don't know all the answers. Nobody could. But I do know that if the president of the United States and the Congress of the United States and the people of the United States said, "I believe our nation is greater than what we are now."
snippet_sentences: ['I believe that if we are inspired, if we can achieve a degree of unity, if we can set our goals high enough and work toward recognized goals with industry and labor and agriculture along with government at all levels, then we can achieve great things.']
snippet: I believe that if we are inspired, if we can achieve a degree of unity, if we can set our goals high enough and work toward recognized goals with industry and labor and agriculture along with government at all levels, then we can achieve great things.

dialogue_sentences: ['What counts is, that the United States celebrated its 200th birthday on July fourth.', 'As a result of that wonderful experience all over the United States, there is a new spirit in America.', 'The American people are healed, are working together.']
dialogue: What counts is, that the United States celebrated its 200th birthday on July fourth. As a result of that wonderful experience all over the United States, there is a new spirit in America. The American people are healed, are working together.
snippet_sentences: ['The American people are moving again, and moving in the right direction.']
snippet: The American people are moving again, and moving in the right direction.

snippet_sentences: ['I think the major reason for a decrease in participation that we have experienced ever since 1960 has been the deep discouragement of the American people about the performance of public officials.']
snippet: I think the major reason for a decrease in participation that we have experienced ever since 1960 has been the deep discouragement of the American people about the performance of public officials.

dialogue_sentences: ['But on the other hand, I found on July fourth of this year, a new spirit born in America.', 'We were celebrating our Bicentennial; and I find that uh - there is a - a movement as I travel around the country of greater interest in this campaign.', "Now, like uh - any hardworking uh - person seeking public office uh - in the campaign, inevitably sometimes you will use uh - rather graphic language and I'm guilty of that just like I think most others in the political arena."]
dialogue: But on the other hand, I found on July fourth of this year, a new spirit born in America. We were celebrating our Bicentennial; and I find that uh - there is a - a movement as I travel around the country of greater interest in this campaign. Now, like uh - any hardworking uh - person seeking public office uh - in the campaign, inevitably sometimes you will use uh - rather graphic language and I'm guilty of that just like I think most others in the political arena.
snippet_sentences: ["But I do make a pledge that in the next ten days when we're asking the American people to make one of the most important decisions in their lifetime, because I think this election is one of the mast vital in the history of America, that uh - we do together what we can to stimulate voter participation."]
snippet: But I do make a pledge that in the next ten days when we're asking the American people to make one of the most important decisions in their lifetime, because I think this election is one of the mast vital in the history of America, that uh - we do together what we can to stimulate voter participation.

snippet_sentences: ['I have indicated to General Brown that uh - the words that he used in that interview, in that particular case and in several others, were very ill advised.']
snippet: I have indicated to General Brown that uh - the words that he used in that interview, in that particular case and in several others, were very ill advised.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I think it's the consensus of the people who are knowledgeable in the military field, that he is probably the outstanding military leader and strategist that we have in America today.", "Now he did use uh - ill-advised words, but I think in the fact that he apologized, that he was reprimanded, uh - does permit him to stay on and continue that kind of leadership that's we so badly need as we enter into uh - negotiations uh - under the SALT II agreement, or if we have operations that might be developing uh in the Middle East or southern Africa, in the Pacific, uh - we need a man with that experience, that knowledge, that know-how, and I think, in light of the fact that he has uh - apologized, uh - would not have justified my asking for his resignation.", 'This one concerned uh - Great Britain.']
dialogue: And I think it's the consensus of the people who are knowledgeable in the military field, that he is probably the outstanding military leader and strategist that we have in America today. Now he did use uh - ill-advised words, but I think in the fact that he apologized, that he was reprimanded, uh - does permit him to stay on and continue that kind of leadership that's we so badly need as we enter into uh - negotiations uh - under the SALT II agreement, or if we have operations that might be developing uh in the Middle East or southern Africa, in the Pacific, uh - we need a man with that experience, that knowledge, that know-how, and I think, in light of the fact that he has uh - apologized, uh - would not have justified my asking for his resignation. This one concerned uh - Great Britain.
snippet_sentences: ['I think he said that Israel was a - a military burden on us and that Iran hoped to reestablish the Persian Empire.', "Ah - I'm not uh - sure that I remembered earlier that President Ford had - had expressed uh - his concern about the statement or apologized for it."]
snippet: I think he said that Israel was a - a military burden on us and that Iran hoped to reestablish the Persian Empire. Ah - I'm not uh - sure that I remembered earlier that President Ford had - had expressed uh - his concern about the statement or apologized for it.

dialogue_sentences: ["I don't mean to be critical of uh - Senator Mondale, but uh - I was uh - very, very surprised when I read that uh - Senator Mondale made a very derogatory, very personal comment about General Brown uh - after the news story that uh - broke about General Brown.", 'If my recollection is correct he indicated that uh - General Brown was not qualified to be a sewer commissioner.', "I don't think that's a proper way to describe aayuh- chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff who has fought for his country for thirty-five years, and I'm sure the governor would agree with me on that."]
dialogue: I don't mean to be critical of uh - Senator Mondale, but uh - I was uh - very, very surprised when I read that uh - Senator Mondale made a very derogatory, very personal comment about General Brown uh - after the news story that uh - broke about General Brown. If my recollection is correct he indicated that uh - General Brown was not qualified to be a sewer commissioner. I don't think that's a proper way to describe aayuh- chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff who has fought for his country for thirty-five years, and I'm sure the governor would agree with me on that.
snippet_sentences: ['Uh - I think Senator Dole would show more good judgment and discretion than to so describe uh - a heroic and brave and very outstanding leader of the military.']
snippet: Uh - I think Senator Dole would show more good judgment and discretion than to so describe uh - a heroic and brave and very outstanding leader of the military.

dialogue_sentences: ['But I think this is indicative of what I would do.', 'The Governor may not have heard my uh - established criteria for the selection of a vice president, but uh - it was a well-established criteria that the person I selected would be fully qualified to be president of the United States.', 'And Senator Bob Dole is so qualified: sixteen years in the House of Representatives and in the Senate, uhh - very high responsibilities on important committees.']
dialogue: But I think this is indicative of what I would do. The Governor may not have heard my uh - established criteria for the selection of a vice president, but uh - it was a well-established criteria that the person I selected would be fully qualified to be president of the United States. And Senator Bob Dole is so qualified: sixteen years in the House of Representatives and in the Senate, uhh - very high responsibilities on important committees.
snippet_sentences: ["I don't mean to be critical of uh - Senator Mondale, but uh - I was uh - very, very surprised when I read that uh - Senator Mondale made a very derogatory, very personal comment about General Brown uh - after the news story that uh - broke about General Brown."]
snippet: I don't mean to be critical of uh - Senator Mondale, but uh - I was uh - very, very surprised when I read that uh - Senator Mondale made a very derogatory, very personal comment about General Brown uh - after the news story that uh - broke about General Brown.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's a 30 percent reduction in the portion that the federal government contributes to education in just eight years.", 'And as you know, the education cost has gone up uh - tremendously.', 'The last point is that the major - uh thrust has gotta be to put people back to work.']
dialogue: That's a 30 percent reduction in the portion that the federal government contributes to education in just eight years. And as you know, the education cost has gone up uh - tremendously. The last point is that the major - uh thrust has gotta be to put people back to work.
snippet_sentences: ["We've got an extraordinarily high unemployment rate among downtown urban ghetto areas, uh - particularly among the very poor and particularly among minority groups, sometimes 50 or 60 percent."]
snippet: We've got an extraordinarily high unemployment rate among downtown urban ghetto areas, uh - particularly among the very poor and particularly among minority groups, sometimes 50 or 60 percent.

dialogue_sentences: ["I think it's accurate to say that Mr. Ford voted against the uh - Voting Rights Acts and the uh - Civil Rights Acts in their uh - debative stage I think once it was assured they were going to pass he finally voted for it.", 'This country uh - changed drastically in 1969 when the uh - terms of John Kennedy and Lyndon Johnson were over and Richard Nixon and - and Gerald Ford became the presidents.', 'There was a time when there was hope for those who uh - were poor and downtrodden and who were - uh elderly or who were - uh ill or who were in minority groups, but that time has been gone.']
dialogue: I think it's accurate to say that Mr. Ford voted against the uh - Voting Rights Acts and the uh - Civil Rights Acts in their uh - debative stage I think once it was assured they were going to pass he finally voted for it. This country uh - changed drastically in 1969 when the uh - terms of John Kennedy and Lyndon Johnson were over and Richard Nixon and - and Gerald Ford became the presidents. There was a time when there was hope for those who uh - were poor and downtrodden and who were - uh elderly or who were - uh ill or who were in minority groups, but that time has been gone.
snippet_sentences: ['I think the greatest thing that ever happened to the South was the passage of the Civil Rights Act and the opening up of opportunities - uh to black people - the chance to vote, to hold a job, to buy a house, to go to school, and to participate in public affairs.']
snippet: I think the greatest thing that ever happened to the South was the passage of the Civil Rights Act and the opening up of opportunities - uh to black people - the chance to vote, to hold a job, to buy a house, to go to school, and to participate in public affairs.

dialogue_sentences: ['I believe that inflation today is caused by government simply spending more than government takes in, at the same time that government has imposed upon business and industry, from the shopkeeper on the corner to the biggest industrial plant in America, countless harassing regulations and punitive taxes that have reduced productivity at the same time they have increased the cost of production.', "And when you are reducing productivity at the same time that you are turning out printing-press money in excessive amounts, you're causing inflation.", "And it isn't really higher prices, it's just, you are reducing the value of the money."]
dialogue: I believe that inflation today is caused by government simply spending more than government takes in, at the same time that government has imposed upon business and industry, from the shopkeeper on the corner to the biggest industrial plant in America, countless harassing regulations and punitive taxes that have reduced productivity at the same time they have increased the cost of production. And when you are reducing productivity at the same time that you are turning out printing-press money in excessive amounts, you're causing inflation. And it isn't really higher prices, it's just, you are reducing the value of the money.
snippet_sentences: ['You are robbing the American people of their savings.']
snippet: You are robbing the American people of their savings.

dialogue_sentences: ['All of these things can be done.', 'When you stop and think that we are only drilling on 2%.', 'That we are, indeed, an energy-rich nation.']
dialogue: All of these things can be done. When you stop and think that we are only drilling on 2%. That we are, indeed, an energy-rich nation.
snippet_sentences: ["Well, Mr. Greenberg, I simply cannot allow to go unpassed the statements that have just been made by Mr. Reagan, who once again, has demonstrated, I think, a total misunderstanding of the energy crisis that confronts, not only this country, but the world, when he suggests that we have 27 years' supply of natural gas, 47 years' supply of oil, and all the rest, and that we really."]
snippet: Well, Mr. Greenberg, I simply cannot allow to go unpassed the statements that have just been made by Mr. Reagan, who once again, has demonstrated, I think, a total misunderstanding of the energy crisis that confronts, not only this country, but the world, when he suggests that we have 27 years' supply of natural gas, 47 years' supply of oil, and all the rest, and that we really.

dialogue_sentences: ["all we have to do is to get the Government off the back of the oil industry, and that's going to be enough.", 'I agree with what I think is the major premise of your question, sir, that we are going to have to create a new conservation ethic in the minds of the American people.', "and that's simply why I proposed, 15 months ago, the emergency excise tax on gasoline that I did."]
dialogue: all we have to do is to get the Government off the back of the oil industry, and that's going to be enough. I agree with what I think is the major premise of your question, sir, that we are going to have to create a new conservation ethic in the minds of the American people. and that's simply why I proposed, 15 months ago, the emergency excise tax on gasoline that I did.
snippet_sentences: ['I did it as a security measure to be sure, because I would rather see us reduce the consumption of imported oil than have to send American boys to fight in the Persian Gulf.']
snippet: I did it as a security measure to be sure, because I would rather see us reduce the consumption of imported oil than have to send American boys to fight in the Persian Gulf.

dialogue_sentences: ['I talked to one of the leading former chiefs of Naval operations in my office a few weeks ago, who told me about 25,000 Chief Petty Officers being short.', 'But, I think that that is clearly related to the fact that, going back to the time when the all-volunteer Army was created in 1973 - and I worked hard for it and supported it - we simply have failed to keep pace with the cost of living.', "And today, on the average, the average serviceman is at least 15% - and I happen to think that's a very modest estimate - 15% below what has happened to the cost of living over that period of time."]
dialogue: I talked to one of the leading former chiefs of Naval operations in my office a few weeks ago, who told me about 25,000 Chief Petty Officers being short. But, I think that that is clearly related to the fact that, going back to the time when the all-volunteer Army was created in 1973 - and I worked hard for it and supported it - we simply have failed to keep pace with the cost of living. And today, on the average, the average serviceman is at least 15% - and I happen to think that's a very modest estimate - 15% below what has happened to the cost of living over that period of time.
snippet_sentences: ['And as a result, the families of some of our young servicemen are on food stamps today.']
snippet: And as a result, the families of some of our young servicemen are on food stamps today.

dialogue_sentences: ['But, I think that that is clearly related to the fact that, going back to the time when the all-volunteer Army was created in 1973 - and I worked hard for it and supported it - we simply have failed to keep pace with the cost of living.', "And today, on the average, the average serviceman is at least 15% - and I happen to think that's a very modest estimate - 15% below what has happened to the cost of living over that period of time.", 'And as a result, the families of some of our young servicemen are on food stamps today.']
dialogue: But, I think that that is clearly related to the fact that, going back to the time when the all-volunteer Army was created in 1973 - and I worked hard for it and supported it - we simply have failed to keep pace with the cost of living. And today, on the average, the average serviceman is at least 15% - and I happen to think that's a very modest estimate - 15% below what has happened to the cost of living over that period of time. And as a result, the families of some of our young servicemen are on food stamps today.
snippet_sentences: ["And I think that's shocking; it's shameful."]
snippet: And I think that's shocking; it's shameful.

dialogue_sentences: ['So, yes, I told the American Legion National!', 'Convention, the VFW National Convention - when I spoke to each of those bodies - I outlined a very specific program of increasing pay and allowances, reenlistment bonuses.', 'That only makes sense.']
dialogue: So, yes, I told the American Legion National! Convention, the VFW National Convention - when I spoke to each of those bodies - I outlined a very specific program of increasing pay and allowances, reenlistment bonuses. That only makes sense.
snippet_sentences: ['But I would leave you with this thought, sir, to be quite specific in my answer to your question: that, of course, to protect the vital interests of this country, if that became impossible; if I could not, despite the very best efforts that I asked the Congress to put forward, to raise those pay and incentives and allowances, of course, I would not leave this country go undefended.']
snippet: But I would leave you with this thought, sir, to be quite specific in my answer to your question: that, of course, to protect the vital interests of this country, if that became impossible; if I could not, despite the very best efforts that I asked the Congress to put forward, to raise those pay and incentives and allowances, of course, I would not leave this country go undefended.

dialogue_sentences: ['Bill of Rights - the fact that, by serving in the military, they could provide for a future college education.', 'In 1977, we took that away from the military.', 'That meant immediately 46% of your people that were signing up had no reason for signing up.']
dialogue: Bill of Rights - the fact that, by serving in the military, they could provide for a future college education. In 1977, we took that away from the military. That meant immediately 46% of your people that were signing up had no reason for signing up.
snippet_sentences: ["So I think it is a case of pay scale, of recognizing that if we're going to have young men and women responsible for our security, dealing with this sophisticated equipment, then for heaven's sakes, let's go out and have a pay scale that is commensurate with the sacrifice that we're asking of them."]
snippet: So I think it is a case of pay scale, of recognizing that if we're going to have young men and women responsible for our security, dealing with this sophisticated equipment, then for heaven's sakes, let's go out and have a pay scale that is commensurate with the sacrifice that we're asking of them.

dialogue_sentences: ['But, unlike Governor Reagan, I do not support a boondoggle like the MX missile.', "I've just gotten a report from the Air Force that indicates that the 30-year lifecycle cost of that system is going to be $100 billion.", 'The initial cost is about $54 billion, and then when you add in the additional costs - not only the construction of the system, the missiles and the personnel, and so on - when you add in the additional costs over the lifecycle of that system, over $100 billion.']
dialogue: But, unlike Governor Reagan, I do not support a boondoggle like the MX missile. I've just gotten a report from the Air Force that indicates that the 30-year lifecycle cost of that system is going to be $100 billion. The initial cost is about $54 billion, and then when you add in the additional costs - not only the construction of the system, the missiles and the personnel, and so on - when you add in the additional costs over the lifecycle of that system, over $100 billion.
snippet_sentences: ['I would propose to save the taxpayers of this country from that kind of costly boondoggle.']
snippet: I would propose to save the taxpayers of this country from that kind of costly boondoggle.

dialogue_sentences: ['That money, I think, ought to be put into rebuilding the base of our cities.', 'In addition to that, jobs programs to re-employ the youth in our cities would be very high on my priority list, both the Youth Opportunities Act of 1980 and a billion-dollar program that I would recommend to put youth to work in energy projects, in conservation projects, in projects that would carry out some of the great national goals of our country.', 'John claims that he is making plain where the money will come from.']
dialogue: That money, I think, ought to be put into rebuilding the base of our cities. In addition to that, jobs programs to re-employ the youth in our cities would be very high on my priority list, both the Youth Opportunities Act of 1980 and a billion-dollar program that I would recommend to put youth to work in energy projects, in conservation projects, in projects that would carry out some of the great national goals of our country. John claims that he is making plain where the money will come from.
snippet_sentences: ['It will come from the pockets of the people.']
snippet: It will come from the pockets of the people.

dialogue_sentences: ['In addition to that, jobs programs to re-employ the youth in our cities would be very high on my priority list, both the Youth Opportunities Act of 1980 and a billion-dollar program that I would recommend to put youth to work in energy projects, in conservation projects, in projects that would carry out some of the great national goals of our country.', 'John claims that he is making plain where the money will come from.', 'It will come from the pockets of the people.']
dialogue: In addition to that, jobs programs to re-employ the youth in our cities would be very high on my priority list, both the Youth Opportunities Act of 1980 and a billion-dollar program that I would recommend to put youth to work in energy projects, in conservation projects, in projects that would carry out some of the great national goals of our country. John claims that he is making plain where the money will come from. It will come from the pockets of the people.
snippet_sentences: ['It will come from the pockets of the people who are living in those very areas.']
snippet: It will come from the pockets of the people who are living in those very areas.

dialogue_sentences: ['What if we had a homestead act, and said to the people, for $1 we sell you this house.', 'All have to do is agree to refurbish it, make it habitable, and live in it - just as 100 or more years ago, we did with the open land in this country - urban .', 'Mr. May, I recently saw a Princeton University study that indicated that the cities of America - the large cities of this country - are in worse shape today than they were in 1960.']
dialogue: What if we had a homestead act, and said to the people, for $1 we sell you this house. All have to do is agree to refurbish it, make it habitable, and live in it - just as 100 or more years ago, we did with the open land in this country - urban . Mr. May, I recently saw a Princeton University study that indicated that the cities of America - the large cities of this country - are in worse shape today than they were in 1960.
snippet_sentences: ['It seems to totally belie the claim that I heard President Carter make a few days ago, that he was the first President that had come forth with a real urban strategy to meet the problems of urban America.']
snippet: It seems to totally belie the claim that I heard President Carter make a few days ago, that he was the first President that had come forth with a real urban strategy to meet the problems of urban America.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have considered inflation in our figures.', 'We deliberately took figures that we, ourselves, believed were too conservative.', "I believe the budget can be balanced by 1982 or 1983, and it is a combination of planned reduction of the tax increase that Carter has built into the economy, and that's what he's counting on for his plan."]
dialogue: We have considered inflation in our figures. We deliberately took figures that we, ourselves, believed were too conservative. I believe the budget can be balanced by 1982 or 1983, and it is a combination of planned reduction of the tax increase that Carter has built into the economy, and that's what he's counting on for his plan.
snippet_sentences: ["We believe that that's too much additional money to take out of the pockets of the people."]
snippet: We believe that that's too much additional money to take out of the pockets of the people.

dialogue_sentences: ["It at the John doesn't quite realize - he's never held an executive position of that kind.", "And I think being Governor of California is probably the closest thing to the Presidency, if that's possible, of any executive job in America today - because it is the most populous state.", 'And I can only tell him that we reduced, in proportion of other states, the per capita spending, the per capita size of Government - we only increased the size of Government one-twelfth what it had increased in the preceding eight years.']
dialogue: It at the John doesn't quite realize - he's never held an executive position of that kind. And I think being Governor of California is probably the closest thing to the Presidency, if that's possible, of any executive job in America today - because it is the most populous state. And I can only tell him that we reduced, in proportion of other states, the per capita spending, the per capita size of Government - we only increased the size of Government one-twelfth what it had increased in the preceding eight years.
snippet_sentences: ['And one journal, the San Francisco Chronicle, a respected newspaper, said there was no question about the fact that Governor Reagan had prevented the State of California from going bankrupt.']
snippet: And one journal, the San Francisco Chronicle, a respected newspaper, said there was no question about the fact that Governor Reagan had prevented the State of California from going bankrupt.

dialogue_sentences: ['The litmus test that John says is in the Republican platform, says no more than the judges to be appointed should have a respect for innocent life.', "Now, I don't think that's a bad idea.", 'I think all of us should have a respect for innocent life.']
dialogue: The litmus test that John says is in the Republican platform, says no more than the judges to be appointed should have a respect for innocent life. Now, I don't think that's a bad idea. I think all of us should have a respect for innocent life.
snippet_sentences: ["With regard to the freedom of the individual for choice with regard to abortion, there's one individual who's not being considered at all.", "That's the one who is being aborted."]
snippet: With regard to the freedom of the individual for choice with regard to abortion, there's one individual who's not being considered at all. That's the one who is being aborted.

dialogue_sentences: ["With regard to the freedom of the individual for choice with regard to abortion, there's one individual who's not being considered at all.", "That's the one who is being aborted.", "And I've noticed that everybody that is for abortion has already been born."]
dialogue: With regard to the freedom of the individual for choice with regard to abortion, there's one individual who's not being considered at all. That's the one who is being aborted. And I've noticed that everybody that is for abortion has already been born.
snippet_sentences: ['I I think that, technically, I know this is a difficult and an emotional problem, and many people sincerely feel on both sides of this, but I do believe that maybe we could find the answer through medical evidence, if we would determine once and for all, is an unborn child a human being?']
snippet: I I think that, technically, I know this is a difficult and an emotional problem, and many people sincerely feel on both sides of this, but I do believe that maybe we could find the answer through medical evidence, if we would determine once and for all, is an unborn child a human being?

dialogue_sentences: ["Oh, I'm it's my question."]
dialogue: Oh, I'm it's my question.
snippet_sentences: ["But whether I agree or disagree with some individual, or what he may say, or how he may say it, I don't think there's any way that we can suggest that because people believe in God and go to church, that they should not want reflected in those people and those causes they support, their own belief in morality, and in the high traditions and principles which we've abandoned so much in this country."]
snippet: But whether I agree or disagree with some individual, or what he may say, or how he may say it, I don't think there's any way that we can suggest that because people believe in God and go to church, that they should not want reflected in those people and those causes they support, their own belief in morality, and in the high traditions and principles which we've abandoned so much in this country.

dialogue_sentences: ['But I do believe that no one in this country should be denied the right to express themselves, or to even try to persuade others to follow their leader.', "That's what elections are all about.", 'Ms. Golden, certainly the church has the right to take a position on moral issues.']
dialogue: But I do believe that no one in this country should be denied the right to express themselves, or to even try to persuade others to follow their leader. That's what elections are all about. Ms. Golden, certainly the church has the right to take a position on moral issues.
snippet_sentences: ['But to try, as occurred in the case that you mentioned - that specific case - to try to tell the parishioners of any church, of any denomination, how they should vote, or for whom they should vote, I think violates the principle of separation of church and state.']
snippet: But to try, as occurred in the case that you mentioned - that specific case - to try to tell the parishioners of any church, of any denomination, how they should vote, or for whom they should vote, I think violates the principle of separation of church and state.

dialogue_sentences: ['I happen to believe it is.', 'I also think that that unborn child has a right to be wanted.', 'And I also believe, sir, that the most personal intimate decision that any woman is ever called upon to make is the decision as to whether or not she shall carry a pregnancy to term.']
dialogue: I happen to believe it is. I also think that that unborn child has a right to be wanted. And I also believe, sir, that the most personal intimate decision that any woman is ever called upon to make is the decision as to whether or not she shall carry a pregnancy to term.
snippet_sentences: ["And for the state to interfere in that decision, under whatever guise, and with whatever rationale, for the state to try to take over in that situation, and by edict, command what the individual shall do, and substitute itself for that individual's conscience, for her right to consult her rabbi, her minister, her priest, her doctor - any other counselor of her choice - I think goes beyond what we want to ever see accomplished in this country, if we really believe in the First Amendment: if we really believe in freedom of choice and the right of the individual."]
snippet: And for the state to interfere in that decision, under whatever guise, and with whatever rationale, for the state to try to take over in that situation, and by edict, command what the individual shall do, and substitute itself for that individual's conscience, for her right to consult her rabbi, her minister, her priest, her doctor - any other counselor of her choice - I think goes beyond what we want to ever see accomplished in this country, if we really believe in the First Amendment: if we really believe in freedom of choice and the right of the individual.

dialogue_sentences: ['And I want to express my appreciation to the League of Women Voters for adopting a course with which I believe the great majority of Americans are in agreement.', "Now, as to my closing remarks: I've always believed that this land was placed here between the two great oceans by some divine plan.", 'That it was placed here to be found by a special kind of people - people who had a special love for freedom and who had the courage to uproot themselves and leave hearth and homeland, and came to what, in the beginning, was the most undeveloped wilderness possible.']
dialogue: And I want to express my appreciation to the League of Women Voters for adopting a course with which I believe the great majority of Americans are in agreement. Now, as to my closing remarks: I've always believed that this land was placed here between the two great oceans by some divine plan. That it was placed here to be found by a special kind of people - people who had a special love for freedom and who had the courage to uproot themselves and leave hearth and homeland, and came to what, in the beginning, was the most undeveloped wilderness possible.
snippet_sentences: ['We spoke a multitude of tongues.']
snippet: We spoke a multitude of tongues.

dialogue: Now, as to my closing remarks: I've always believed that this land was placed here between the two great oceans by some divine plan. That it was placed here to be found by a special kind of people - people who had a special love for freedom and who had the courage to uproot themselves and leave hearth and homeland, and came to what, in the beginning, was the most undeveloped wilderness possible. We spoke a multitude of tongues.
snippet_sentences: ['If wind, water or fire destroyed them, we built them again.']
snippet: If wind, water or fire destroyed them, we built them again.

dialogue_sentences: ['That it was placed here to be found by a special kind of people - people who had a special love for freedom and who had the courage to uproot themselves and leave hearth and homeland, and came to what, in the beginning, was the most undeveloped wilderness possible.', 'We spoke a multitude of tongues.', 'If wind, water or fire destroyed them, we built them again.']
dialogue: That it was placed here to be found by a special kind of people - people who had a special love for freedom and who had the courage to uproot themselves and leave hearth and homeland, and came to what, in the beginning, was the most undeveloped wilderness possible. We spoke a multitude of tongues. If wind, water or fire destroyed them, we built them again.
snippet_sentences: ['And in so doing, at the same time, we built a new breed of human called an American - a proud, an independent., and a most compassionate individual, for the most part.']
snippet: And in so doing, at the same time, we built a new breed of human called an American - a proud, an independent., and a most compassionate individual, for the most part.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well, we, the living Americans, have gone through four wars.', "We've gone through a Great Depression in our lifetime that literally was worldwide and almost brought us to our knees.", 'But we came through all of those things and we achieved even new heights and new greatness.']
dialogue: Well, we, the living Americans, have gone through four wars. We've gone through a Great Depression in our lifetime that literally was worldwide and almost brought us to our knees. But we came through all of those things and we achieved even new heights and new greatness.
snippet_sentences: ['The living Americans today have fought harder, paid a higher price for freedom, and done more to advance the dignity of man than any people who ever lived on this earth.']
snippet: The living Americans today have fought harder, paid a higher price for freedom, and done more to advance the dignity of man than any people who ever lived on this earth.

dialogue_sentences: ["I don't know what the differences might be, because I don't know what Mr. Carter's policies are.", 'I do know what he has said about mine.']
dialogue: I don't know what the differences might be, because I don't know what Mr. Carter's policies are. I do know what he has said about mine.
snippet_sentences: ["And I'm only here to tell you that I believe with all my heart that our first priority must be world peace, and that use of force is always and only a last resort, when everything else has failed, and then only with regard to our national security."]
snippet: And I'm only here to tell you that I believe with all my heart that our first priority must be world peace, and that use of force is always and only a last resort, when everything else has failed, and then only with regard to our national security.

dialogue_sentences: ['America has never gotten in a war because we were too strong.', "We can get into a war by letting events get out of hand, as they have in the last three and a half years under the foreign policies of this Administration of Mr. Carter's, until we're faced each time with a crisis.", 'And good management in preserving the peace requires that we control the events and try to intercept before they become a crisis.']
dialogue: America has never gotten in a war because we were too strong. We can get into a war by letting events get out of hand, as they have in the last three and a half years under the foreign policies of this Administration of Mr. Carter's, until we're faced each time with a crisis. And good management in preserving the peace requires that we control the events and try to intercept before they become a crisis.
snippet_sentences: ['I have seen four wars in my lifetime.', "I'm a father of sons; I have a grandson.", "I don't ever want to see another generation of young Americans bleed their lives into sandy beachheads in the Pacific, or rice paddies and jungles in the in Asia or the muddy battlefields of Europe."]
snippet: I have seen four wars in my lifetime. I'm a father of sons; I have a grandson. I don't ever want to see another generation of young Americans bleed their lives into sandy beachheads in the Pacific, or rice paddies and jungles in the in Asia or the muddy battlefields of Europe.

dialogue_sentences: ["Again it's important to put the situation in perspective.", 'In 1974, we had a so-called oil shock, wherein the price of OPEC oil was raised to an extraordinary degree.', 'We had an even worse oil shock in 1979.']
dialogue: Again it's important to put the situation in perspective. In 1974, we had a so-called oil shock, wherein the price of OPEC oil was raised to an extraordinary degree. We had an even worse oil shock in 1979.
snippet_sentences: ['In 1974, we had the worst recession, the deepest and most penetrating recession since the Second World War.']
snippet: In 1974, we had the worst recession, the deepest and most penetrating recession since the Second World War.

dialogue_sentences: ['Earlier this year, in the first quarter, we did have a very severe inflation pressure brought about by the OPEC price increase.', 'It averaged about 18% in the first quarter of this year.', 'In the second quarter, we had dropped it down to about 13%.']
dialogue: Earlier this year, in the first quarter, we did have a very severe inflation pressure brought about by the OPEC price increase. It averaged about 18% in the first quarter of this year. In the second quarter, we had dropped it down to about 13%.
snippet_sentences: ['The most recent figures, the last three months, on the third quarter of this year, the inflation rate is 7% - still too high, but it illustrates very vividly that in addition to providing an enormous number of jobs - nine million new jobs in the last three and a half years - that the inflationary threat is still urgent on us.']
snippet: The most recent figures, the last three months, on the third quarter of this year, the inflation rate is 7% - still too high, but it illustrates very vividly that in addition to providing an enormous number of jobs - nine million new jobs in the last three and a half years - that the inflationary threat is still urgent on us.

dialogue_sentences: ['The new economic revitalization program that we have in mind, which will be implemented next year, would result in tax credits which would let business invest in new tools and new factories to create even more new jobs - about one million in the next two years.', 'And we also have planned a youth employment program which would encompass 600,000 jobs for young people.', 'This has already passed the House, and it has an excellent prospect to pass the Senate.']
dialogue: The new economic revitalization program that we have in mind, which will be implemented next year, would result in tax credits which would let business invest in new tools and new factories to create even more new jobs - about one million in the next two years. And we also have planned a youth employment program which would encompass 600,000 jobs for young people. This has already passed the House, and it has an excellent prospect to pass the Senate.
snippet_sentences: ["Mr. Ellis, I think this idea that has been spawned here in our country that inflation somehow came upon us like a plague and therefore it's uncontrollable and no one can do anything about it, is entirely spurious and it's dangerous to say this to the people."]
snippet: Mr. Ellis, I think this idea that has been spawned here in our country that inflation somehow came upon us like a plague and therefore it's uncontrollable and no one can do anything about it, is entirely spurious and it's dangerous to say this to the people.

dialogue_sentences: ["But that can't hide the fact that there are eight million men and women out of work in America today, and two million of those lost their jobs in just the last few months.", 'Mr. Carter had also promised that he would not use unemployment as a tool to fight against inflation.', 'And yet, his 1980 economic message stated that we would reduce productivity and gross national product and increase unemployment in order to get a handle on inflation, because in January, at the beginning of the year, it was more than 18%.']
dialogue: But that can't hide the fact that there are eight million men and women out of work in America today, and two million of those lost their jobs in just the last few months. Mr. Carter had also promised that he would not use unemployment as a tool to fight against inflation. And yet, his 1980 economic message stated that we would reduce productivity and gross national product and increase unemployment in order to get a handle on inflation, because in January, at the beginning of the year, it was more than 18%.
snippet_sentences: ['Since then, he has blamed the people for inflation, OPEC, he has blamed the Federal Reserve system, he has blamed the lack of productivity of the American people, he has then accused the people of living too well and that we must share in scarcity, we must sacrifice and get used to doing with less.']
snippet: Since then, he has blamed the people for inflation, OPEC, he has blamed the Federal Reserve system, he has blamed the lack of productivity of the American people, he has then accused the people of living too well and that we must share in scarcity, we must sacrifice and get used to doing with less.

dialogue_sentences: ["The President's economic plan calls for increasing the taxes to the point that we finally take so much money away from the people that we can balance the budget in that way.", 'But we will have a very poor nation and a very unsound economy if we follow that path.', 'most people, when they think about cutting Government spending, they think in terms of eliminating necessary programs or wiping out something, some service that Government is supposed to perform.']
dialogue: The President's economic plan calls for increasing the taxes to the point that we finally take so much money away from the people that we can balance the budget in that way. But we will have a very poor nation and a very unsound economy if we follow that path. most people, when they think about cutting Government spending, they think in terms of eliminating necessary programs or wiping out something, some service that Government is supposed to perform.
snippet_sentences: ['I believe that there is enough extravagance and fat in government.']
snippet: I believe that there is enough extravagance and fat in government.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have a program for a gradual reduction of Government spending based on these theories, and I have a task force now that has been working on where those cuts could be made.', "I'm confident that it can be done and that it will reduce inflation because I did it in California.", 'And inflation went down below the national average in California when we returned the money to the people and reduced Government spending.']
dialogue: We have a program for a gradual reduction of Government spending based on these theories, and I have a task force now that has been working on where those cuts could be made. I'm confident that it can be done and that it will reduce inflation because I did it in California. And inflation went down below the national average in California when we returned the money to the people and reduced Government spending.
snippet_sentences: ["Governor Reagan's proposal, the Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal, is one of the most highly inflationary ideas that ever has been presented to the American public."]
snippet: Governor Reagan's proposal, the Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal, is one of the most highly inflationary ideas that ever has been presented to the American public.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'm confident that it can be done and that it will reduce inflation because I did it in California.", 'And inflation went down below the national average in California when we returned the money to the people and reduced Government spending.', "Governor Reagan's proposal, the Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal, is one of the most highly inflationary ideas that ever has been presented to the American public."]
dialogue: I'm confident that it can be done and that it will reduce inflation because I did it in California. And inflation went down below the national average in California when we returned the money to the people and reduced Government spending. Governor Reagan's proposal, the Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal, is one of the most highly inflationary ideas that ever has been presented to the American public.
snippet_sentences: ['He would actually have to cut Government spending by at least $130 billion in order to balance the budget under this ridiculous proposal.']
snippet: He would actually have to cut Government spending by at least $130 billion in order to balance the budget under this ridiculous proposal.

dialogue_sentences: ['He would actually have to cut Government spending by at least $130 billion in order to balance the budget under this ridiculous proposal.', 'I notice that his task force that is working for his future plans had some of their ideas revealed in The Wall Street Journal this week.', 'One of those ideas was to repeal the minimum wage, and several times this year, Governor Reagan has said that the major cause of unemployment is the minimum wage.']
dialogue: He would actually have to cut Government spending by at least $130 billion in order to balance the budget under this ridiculous proposal. I notice that his task force that is working for his future plans had some of their ideas revealed in The Wall Street Journal this week. One of those ideas was to repeal the minimum wage, and several times this year, Governor Reagan has said that the major cause of unemployment is the minimum wage.
snippet_sentences: ['This is a heartless kind of approach to the working families of our country, which is typical of many Republican leaders of the past, but, I think, has been accentuated under Governor Reagan.']
snippet: This is a heartless kind of approach to the working families of our country, which is typical of many Republican leaders of the past, but, I think, has been accentuated under Governor Reagan.

dialogue_sentences: ['This is a heartless kind of approach to the working families of our country, which is typical of many Republican leaders of the past, but, I think, has been accentuated under Governor Reagan.', "In California - I'm surprised Governor Reagan brought this up - he had the three largest tax increases in the history of that state under his administration.", 'Thank you, sir.']
dialogue: This is a heartless kind of approach to the working families of our country, which is typical of many Republican leaders of the past, but, I think, has been accentuated under Governor Reagan. In California - I'm surprised Governor Reagan brought this up - he had the three largest tax increases in the history of that state under his administration. Thank you, sir.
snippet_sentences: ['The figures that the President has just used about California is a distortion of the situation there, because while I was Governor of California, our spending in California increased less per capita than the spending in Georgia while Mr. Carter was Governor of Georgia in the same four years.']
snippet: The figures that the President has just used about California is a distortion of the situation there, because while I was Governor of California, our spending in California increased less per capita than the spending in Georgia while Mr. Carter was Governor of Georgia in the same four years.

dialogue_sentences: ['It averaged about 18% in the first quarter of this year.', 'In the second quarter, we had dropped it down to about 13%.', 'The most recent figures, the last three months, on the third quarter of this year, the inflation rate is 7% - still too high, but it illustrates very vividly that in addition to providing an enormous number of jobs - nine million new jobs in the last three and a half years - that the inflationary threat is still urgent on us.']
dialogue: It averaged about 18% in the first quarter of this year. In the second quarter, we had dropped it down to about 13%. The most recent figures, the last three months, on the third quarter of this year, the inflation rate is 7% - still too high, but it illustrates very vividly that in addition to providing an enormous number of jobs - nine million new jobs in the last three and a half years - that the inflationary threat is still urgent on us.
snippet_sentences: ['I notice that Governor Reagan recently mentioned the Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal.', 'which his own running mate, George Bush, described as voodoo economics, and said that it would result in a 30% inflation rate.', 'And Business Week, which is not a Democratic publication, said that this Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal - and I quote them, I think - was completely irresponsible and would result in inflationary pressures which would destroy this nation.']
snippet: I notice that Governor Reagan recently mentioned the Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal. which his own running mate, George Bush, described as voodoo economics, and said that it would result in a 30% inflation rate. And Business Week, which is not a Democratic publication, said that this Reagan-Kemp-Roth proposal - and I quote them, I think - was completely irresponsible and would result in inflationary pressures which would destroy this nation.

dialogue_sentences: ['But we will have a very poor nation and a very unsound economy if we follow that path.', 'most people, when they think about cutting Government spending, they think in terms of eliminating necessary programs or wiping out something, some service that Government is supposed to perform.', 'I believe that there is enough extravagance and fat in government.']
dialogue: But we will have a very poor nation and a very unsound economy if we follow that path. most people, when they think about cutting Government spending, they think in terms of eliminating necessary programs or wiping out something, some service that Government is supposed to perform. I believe that there is enough extravagance and fat in government.
snippet_sentences: ['As a matter of fact, one of the secretaries of HEW under Mr. Carter testified that he thought there was $7 billion worth of fraud and waste in welfare and in the medical programs associated with it.', 'Office estimate that there is probably tens of billions of dollars that is lost in fraud alone, and they have added that waste adds even more to that.']
snippet: As a matter of fact, one of the secretaries of HEW under Mr. Carter testified that he thought there was $7 billion worth of fraud and waste in welfare and in the medical programs associated with it. Office estimate that there is probably tens of billions of dollars that is lost in fraud alone, and they have added that waste adds even more to that.

dialogue_sentences: ['President Carter also has spoken of the new jobs created.', 'Well, we always, with the normal growth in our country and increase in population, increase the number of jobs.', "But that can't hide the fact that there are eight million men and women out of work in America today, and two million of those lost their jobs in just the last few months."]
dialogue: President Carter also has spoken of the new jobs created. Well, we always, with the normal growth in our country and increase in population, increase the number of jobs. But that can't hide the fact that there are eight million men and women out of work in America today, and two million of those lost their jobs in just the last few months.
snippet_sentences: ['Mr. Carter had also promised that he would not use unemployment as a tool to fight against inflation.', 'And yet, his 1980 economic message stated that we would reduce productivity and gross national product and increase unemployment in order to get a handle on inflation, because in January, at the beginning of the year, it was more than 18%.']
snippet: Mr. Carter had also promised that he would not use unemployment as a tool to fight against inflation. And yet, his 1980 economic message stated that we would reduce productivity and gross national product and increase unemployment in order to get a handle on inflation, because in January, at the beginning of the year, it was more than 18%.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'll have to get this out very fast.", 'Yes, you can lick inflation by increasing productivity and by decreasing the cost of government to the place that we have balanced budgets, and are no longer grinding out printing press money, flooding the market with it because the Government is spending more than it takes in.', 'And my economic plan calls for that.']
dialogue: I'll have to get this out very fast. Yes, you can lick inflation by increasing productivity and by decreasing the cost of government to the place that we have balanced budgets, and are no longer grinding out printing press money, flooding the market with it because the Government is spending more than it takes in. And my economic plan calls for that.
snippet_sentences: ["The President's economic plan calls for increasing the taxes to the point that we finally take so much money away from the people that we can balance the budget in that way.", 'But we will have a very poor nation and a very unsound economy if we follow that path.']
snippet: The President's economic plan calls for increasing the taxes to the point that we finally take so much money away from the people that we can balance the budget in that way. But we will have a very poor nation and a very unsound economy if we follow that path.

dialogue_sentences: ['I think there are things to do in this regard.', 'I stood in the South Bronx on the exact spot that President Carter stood on in 1977.', 'You have to see it to believe it.']
dialogue: I think there are things to do in this regard. I stood in the South Bronx on the exact spot that President Carter stood on in 1977. You have to see it to believe it.
snippet_sentences: ['It looks like a bombed-out city - great, gaunt skeletons of buildings.', 'Windows smashed out, painted on one of them "Unkept promises;" on another, "Despair."']
snippet: It looks like a bombed-out city - great, gaunt skeletons of buildings. Windows smashed out, painted on one of them "Unkept promises;" on another, "Despair."

dialogue: And this was the spot at which President Carter had promised that he was going to bring in a vast program to rebuild this department. There are whole or this area there are whole blocks of land that are left bare, just bulldozed down flat. snippet_sentences: ["I am eternally optimistic, and I happen to believe that we've made great progress from the days when I was young and when this country didn't even know it had a racial problem."]

dialogue_sentences: ["I am eternally optimistic, and I happen to believe that we've made great progress from the days when I was young and when this country didn't even know it had a racial problem.", "I know those things can grow out of despair in an inner city, when there's hopelessness at home, lack of work, and so forth.", 'But I believe that all of us together, and I believe the Presidency is what Teddy Roosevelt said it was.']
dialogue: I am eternally optimistic, and I happen to believe that we've made great progress from the days when I was young and when this country didn't even know it had a racial problem. I know those things can grow out of despair in an inner city, when there's hopelessness at home, lack of work, and so forth. But I believe that all of us together, and I believe the Presidency is what Teddy Roosevelt said it was.
snippet_sentences: ["It's a bully pulpit."]
snippet: It's a bully pulpit.

dialogue_sentences: ["Since I've been President, I've appointed, for instance, more than twice as many black Federal judges as all previous presidents in the history of this country.", "I've done the same thing in the appointment of women, and also Spanish-speaking Americans.", 'The President talks of Government programs, and they have their place.']
dialogue: Since I've been President, I've appointed, for instance, more than twice as many black Federal judges as all previous presidents in the history of this country. I've done the same thing in the appointment of women, and also Spanish-speaking Americans. The President talks of Government programs, and they have their place.
snippet_sentences: ['But as governor, when I was at that end of the line and receiving some of these grants for Government programs, I saw that so many of them were dead-end.']
snippet: But as governor, when I was at that end of the line and receiving some of these grants for Government programs, I saw that so many of them were dead-end.

dialogue_sentences: ['With regard to the great progress that has been made with this Government spending, the rate of black unemployment in Detroit, Michigan, is 56%.', "It's obvious that we still have a long way to go in fully incorporating the minority groups into the mainstream of American life.", "We have made good progress, and there is no doubt in my mind that the commitment to unemployment compensation, the minimum wage, welfare, national health insurance, those kinds of commitments that have typified the Democratic party since ancient history in this country's political life are a very important element of the future."]
dialogue: With regard to the great progress that has been made with this Government spending, the rate of black unemployment in Detroit, Michigan, is 56%. It's obvious that we still have a long way to go in fully incorporating the minority groups into the mainstream of American life. We have made good progress, and there is no doubt in my mind that the commitment to unemployment compensation, the minimum wage, welfare, national health insurance, those kinds of commitments that have typified the Democratic party since ancient history in this country's political life are a very important element of the future.

dialogue_sentences: ['But as governor, when I was at that end of the line and receiving some of these grants for Government programs, I saw that so many of them were dead-end.', 'They were public employment that these people who really want to get out into the private job market where there are jobs with a future.', 'Now, the President spoke a moment ago about that I was against the minimum wage.']
dialogue: But as governor, when I was at that end of the line and receiving some of these grants for Government programs, I saw that so many of them were dead-end. They were public employment that these people who really want to get out into the private job market where there are jobs with a future. Now, the President spoke a moment ago about that I was against the minimum wage.
