dialogue_sentences: ['Building that kind of growth expands revenues and helps to bring down that deficit.', 'Thirdly, we have to bring interest rates down, and we will as we come up with a good, solid plan with the Congress for bringing that deficit down.', "And, finally, we've got to go out there and collect billions and billions of dollars in taxes owed that aren't being paid to this country."]
dialogue: Building that kind of growth expands revenues and helps to bring down that deficit. Thirdly, we have to bring interest rates down, and we will as we come up with a good, solid plan with the Congress for bringing that deficit down. And, finally, we've got to go out there and collect billions and billions of dollars in taxes owed that aren't being paid to this country.
snippet_sentences: ["It's very unfair to the average taxpayer who pays his taxes and pays them on time to permit these monies to go uncollected."]
snippet: It's very unfair to the average taxpayer who pays his taxes and pays them on time to permit these monies to go uncollected.

dialogue_sentences: ['Well, I hope all of those Americans out there who are watching us, listening to us and trying to make up their mind about which one of us ought to be president of the United States listen to the Vice President very carefully.', "What he's proposing after over a trillion in new debt which has been added in the Federal debt in the course of the past eight years, an IOU our children and grandchildren will be paying for years, is a tax cut for the wealthiest one percent of the people in this country, an average of about $30,000 that we're going to give to people making $200,000 a year.", "Why that's more than the average teacher makes."]
dialogue: Well, I hope all of those Americans out there who are watching us, listening to us and trying to make up their mind about which one of us ought to be president of the United States listen to the Vice President very carefully. What he's proposing after over a trillion in new debt which has been added in the Federal debt in the course of the past eight years, an IOU our children and grandchildren will be paying for years, is a tax cut for the wealthiest one percent of the people in this country, an average of about $30,000 that we're going to give to people making $200,000 a year. Why that's more than the average teacher makes.
snippet_sentences: ["We've had enough of that, ladies and gentlemen."]
snippet: We've had enough of that, ladies and gentlemen.

dialogue_sentences: ['That answer was about as clear as Boston harbor.', "There are so many things there, I don't quite know where to begin.", 'When you cut capital gains, you put people to work.']
dialogue: That answer was about as clear as Boston harbor. There are so many things there, I don't quite know where to begin. When you cut capital gains, you put people to work.
snippet_sentences: ['John Kennedy proposed cutting capital gains.']
snippet: John Kennedy proposed cutting capital gains.

dialogue_sentences: ["There are so many things there, I don't quite know where to begin.", 'When you cut capital gains, you put people to work.', 'John Kennedy proposed cutting capital gains.']
dialogue: There are so many things there, I don't quite know where to begin. When you cut capital gains, you put people to work. John Kennedy proposed cutting capital gains.
snippet_sentences: ['Paul Tsongas, a liberal senator from Massachusetts said the dumbest thing I did was to oppose the capital gains cut.']
snippet: Paul Tsongas, a liberal senator from Massachusetts said the dumbest thing I did was to oppose the capital gains cut.

dialogue_sentences: ["Massachusetts doesn't have an enormous defense budget, but nevertheless, the governor raised taxes five different times.", 'That happens to be a fact.', "And so let's kind of stay on the issue, and I have made a specific proposal for what I call a flexible freeze."]
dialogue: Massachusetts doesn't have an enormous defense budget, but nevertheless, the governor raised taxes five different times. That happens to be a fact. And so let's kind of stay on the issue, and I have made a specific proposal for what I call a flexible freeze.
snippet_sentences: ["And it permits - economists on the East Coast and West think it's good - it permits the president to sort out the priorities, and we continue to grow because I will not raise taxes."]
snippet: And it permits - economists on the East Coast and West think it's good - it permits the president to sort out the priorities, and we continue to grow because I will not raise taxes.

dialogue_sentences: ['And if we - and the - actually this year Congress is doing a little better in controlling the growth of spending.', 'Spending was only up something like 4 percent.', "So, it isn't that we're taking too little - from taxpayer - we're spending too much still."]
dialogue: And if we - and the - actually this year Congress is doing a little better in controlling the growth of spending. Spending was only up something like 4 percent. So, it isn't that we're taking too little - from taxpayer - we're spending too much still.
snippet_sentences: ["And the formula I've given you works, we've put it through a good economic model, we've got good economists on the West Coast, Michael Boskin and Marty Feldstein up there who's a very respected economist in the - Massachusetts.", "And they agree, that if we can do what I've said, we can get it down without going and socking the American taxpayer once again."]
snippet: And the formula I've given you works, we've put it through a good economic model, we've got good economists on the West Coast, Michael Boskin and Marty Feldstein up there who's a very respected economist in the - Massachusetts. And they agree, that if we can do what I've said, we can get it down without going and socking the American taxpayer once again.

dialogue_sentences: ["And they agree, that if we can do what I've said, we can get it down without going and socking the American taxpayer once again.", "Capital gains, one more point on that, please let's learn from history.", 'A capital gains differential will increase jobs, increase risk taking, increase revenues to the Federal Government.']
dialogue: And they agree, that if we can do what I've said, we can get it down without going and socking the American taxpayer once again. Capital gains, one more point on that, please let's learn from history. A capital gains differential will increase jobs, increase risk taking, increase revenues to the Federal Government.
snippet_sentences: ['Well, I hope all of those Americans out there who are watching us, listening to us and trying to make up their mind about which one of us ought to be president of the United States listen to the Vice President very carefully.']
snippet: Well, I hope all of those Americans out there who are watching us, listening to us and trying to make up their mind about which one of us ought to be president of the United States listen to the Vice President very carefully.

dialogue_sentences: ["The thing I don't understand about Mr. Bush's approach to this is how he could possibly be serious about bringing that deficit down given what he says he wants to do.", "He seems to want to spend a great deal of money on just about every weapon system; he says he's against new taxes, although he's broken that pledge at least times in the last year that I know of; he wants to give the wealthiest taxpayers in this country a five year, $40 billion tax break.", 'He also wants to spend a lot of money on additional programs.']
dialogue: The thing I don't understand about Mr. Bush's approach to this is how he could possibly be serious about bringing that deficit down given what he says he wants to do. He seems to want to spend a great deal of money on just about every weapon system; he says he's against new taxes, although he's broken that pledge at least times in the last year that I know of; he wants to give the wealthiest taxpayers in this country a five year, $40 billion tax break. He also wants to spend a lot of money on additional programs.
snippet_sentences: ["If he keeps this up, he's going to be the Joe Isuzu of American politics."]
snippet: If he keeps this up, he's going to be the Joe Isuzu of American politics.

dialogue_sentences: ["I believe that's the answer.", 'I am proud to have been part of an administration that past the first catastrophic health bill.', "And in that there are some Medicaid provisions that will be very helpful to the very kind of people we're talking about here."]
dialogue: I believe that's the answer. I am proud to have been part of an administration that past the first catastrophic health bill. And in that there are some Medicaid provisions that will be very helpful to the very kind of people we're talking about here.
snippet_sentences: ["But we've got to keep going forward without killing off the engine and throwing people out of work."]
snippet: But we've got to keep going forward without killing off the engine and throwing people out of work.

dialogue_sentences: ["But, George, that's no answer.", "You don't like the answer, but it's an answer.", "Well, no, it's no answer to those 37 million people, most of them members of working families who don't have a dime of health insurance and don't know how to pay the bills if their kids get sick at night."]
dialogue: But, George, that's no answer. You don't like the answer, but it's an answer. Well, no, it's no answer to those 37 million people, most of them members of working families who don't have a dime of health insurance and don't know how to pay the bills if their kids get sick at night.
snippet_sentences: ['I was in Houston on Tuesday meeting with a group of good citizens, working citizens.', 'All of them with little or no health insurance.', 'One of them was a father who had been laid off a few months ago and lost his health insurance.']
snippet: I was in Houston on Tuesday meeting with a group of good citizens, working citizens. All of them with little or no health insurance. One of them was a father who had been laid off a few months ago and lost his health insurance.

dialogue_sentences: ["The last time the Vice President used that phrase, I suspect he remembers it, don't you?", "It was in 1964 and that's what he called Medicare.", "Well, he was wrong then and he's wrong now."]
dialogue: The last time the Vice President used that phrase, I suspect he remembers it, don't you? It was in 1964 and that's what he called Medicare. Well, he was wrong then and he's wrong now.
snippet_sentences: ["It's the single most important public health crisis, single most important public health emergency we've had in our lifetimes and I think there are a number of things we have to do including supporting legislation which is now moving through the Congress, which will commit this nation to the resources to find a cure which will provide broad education and prevention, which will provide sensitive and caring treatment for the victims of AIDS."]
snippet: It's the single most important public health crisis, single most important public health emergency we've had in our lifetimes and I think there are a number of things we have to do including supporting legislation which is now moving through the Congress, which will commit this nation to the resources to find a cure which will provide broad education and prevention, which will provide sensitive and caring treatment for the victims of AIDS.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's the way we're going to provide basic health security for all of the citizens of this country of ours.", "Well, Anne, let me just say before I answer your question that I didn't know that the Vice President attacked our program in Massachusetts.", "I hope he hasn't."]
dialogue: That's the way we're going to provide basic health security for all of the citizens of this country of ours. Well, Anne, let me just say before I answer your question that I didn't know that the Vice President attacked our program in Massachusetts. I hope he hasn't.
snippet_sentences: ["Because has won the support of a great many people all over the state and I think it's a model for what I hope we can do across the country."]
snippet: Because has won the support of a great many people all over the state and I think it's a model for what I hope we can do across the country.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, Anne, let me just say before I answer your question that I didn't know that the Vice President attacked our program in Massachusetts.", "I hope he hasn't.", "Because has won the support of a great many people all over the state and I think it's a model for what I hope we can do across the country."]
dialogue: Well, Anne, let me just say before I answer your question that I didn't know that the Vice President attacked our program in Massachusetts. I hope he hasn't. Because has won the support of a great many people all over the state and I think it's a model for what I hope we can do across the country.
snippet_sentences: ['But when I proposed my plan this past Tuesday, he or one of his spokesmen called it socialized medicine.', "The last time the Vice President used that phrase, I suspect he remembers it, don't you?", "It was in 1964 and that's what he called Medicare.", "Well, he was wrong then and he's wrong now."]
snippet: But when I proposed my plan this past Tuesday, he or one of his spokesmen called it socialized medicine. The last time the Vice President used that phrase, I suspect he remembers it, don't you? It was in 1964 and that's what he called Medicare. Well, he was wrong then and he's wrong now.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, I don't question his passion.", "I question - and I don't question his concern about the war in Vietnam.", 'He introduced or supported legislation back then that suggested that kids of Massachusetts should be exempt from going overseas in that war.']
dialogue: Well, I don't question his passion. I question - and I don't question his concern about the war in Vietnam. He introduced or supported legislation back then that suggested that kids of Massachusetts should be exempt from going overseas in that war.
snippet_sentences: ["Now, that's a certain passion that in my view it's misguided passion."]
snippet: Now, that's a certain passion that in my view it's misguided passion.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I hope people don't think that I'm questioning his patriotism when I say he used his words to describe his participation in that organization.", 'Well, I hope this is the first and last time I have to say this.', 'Of course, the vice president is questioning my patriotism.']
dialogue: And I hope people don't think that I'm questioning his patriotism when I say he used his words to describe his participation in that organization. Well, I hope this is the first and last time I have to say this. Of course, the vice president is questioning my patriotism.
snippet_sentences: ["I don't think there's any question about that, and I resent it.", 'I resent it.']
snippet: I don't think there's any question about that, and I resent it. I resent it.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I don't agree with them.", 'He has every right to exercise his passion, as what he said, a strong, progressive liberal.', "I don't agree with that."]
dialogue: And I don't agree with them. He has every right to exercise his passion, as what he said, a strong, progressive liberal. I don't agree with that.
snippet_sentences: ["And I think I'm more in touch with the mainstream of America.", 'They raised the same thing with me on the Pledge of Allegiance.']
snippet: And I think I'm more in touch with the mainstream of America. They raised the same thing with me on the Pledge of Allegiance.

dialogue_sentences: ["I don't agree with that.", "And I think I'm more in touch with the mainstream of America.", 'They raised the same thing with me on the Pledge of Allegiance.']
dialogue: I don't agree with that. And I think I'm more in touch with the mainstream of America. They raised the same thing with me on the Pledge of Allegiance.
snippet_sentences: ["You see, I'd have found a way to sign that bill.", 'Governor Thompson of Illinois did.']
snippet: You see, I'd have found a way to sign that bill. Governor Thompson of Illinois did.

dialogue_sentences: ["Now, that's the kind of leadership that I want to provide as president of the United States.", "This isn't a question of a little charity for the homeless.", 'This is a question of organizing the housing community.']
dialogue: Now, that's the kind of leadership that I want to provide as president of the United States. This isn't a question of a little charity for the homeless. This is a question of organizing the housing community.
snippet_sentences: ["I've talked to bankers and builders and developers, the housing advocates, community development agencies, and they want leadership from Washington."]
snippet: I've talked to bankers and builders and developers, the housing advocates, community development agencies, and they want leadership from Washington.

dialogue_sentences: ["And we've got to attend to them.", 'But fully, my short range answer is fully fund that McKinney Act.', "Well, this is another fundamental difference that I have with the vice president, just as I do in the case of health care for 37 million members of working families in this country who don't have health insurance."]
dialogue: And we've got to attend to them. But fully, my short range answer is fully fund that McKinney Act. Well, this is another fundamental difference that I have with the vice president, just as I do in the case of health care for 37 million members of working families in this country who don't have health insurance.
snippet_sentences: ["The problem, Mr. Bush, is that you've cut back by 90 percent on our commitment to affordable housing for families of low and moderate income.", "And when you do that, you've have homeless families."]
snippet: The problem, Mr. Bush, is that you've cut back by 90 percent on our commitment to affordable housing for families of low and moderate income. And when you do that, you've have homeless families.

dialogue_sentences: ['I want to see more vouchers.', 'I want to see control of some of these projects, and I want to keep the interest rates down.', "They're half, now of what they were when we came into office, and with my policy of getting this deficit under control, they'll be a lot less."]
dialogue: I want to see more vouchers. I want to see control of some of these projects, and I want to keep the interest rates down. They're half, now of what they were when we came into office, and with my policy of getting this deficit under control, they'll be a lot less.
snippet_sentences: ["But if we spend and spend and spend, that is going to wrap up the housing market, and we'll go right back to the days of the misery index and malaise that President Reagan and I have overcome - thank God for the United States on that one."]
snippet: But if we spend and spend and spend, that is going to wrap up the housing market, and we'll go right back to the days of the misery index and malaise that President Reagan and I have overcome - thank God for the United States on that one.

dialogue_sentences: ["The federal program doesn't do that.", 'No other state programs do that.', 'And I favor the death penalty.']
dialogue: The federal program doesn't do that. No other state programs do that. And I favor the death penalty.
snippet_sentences: ["I know it's tough and honest people can disagree.", 'But when a narcotics wrapped up guy goes in and murders a police officer, I think they ought to pay with their life.', 'And I do believe it would be inhibiting.']
snippet: I know it's tough and honest people can disagree. But when a narcotics wrapped up guy goes in and murders a police officer, I think they ought to pay with their life. And I do believe it would be inhibiting.

dialogue_sentences: ["I know it's tough and honest people can disagree.", 'But when a narcotics wrapped up guy goes in and murders a police officer, I think they ought to pay with their life.', 'And I do believe it would be inhibiting.']
dialogue: I know it's tough and honest people can disagree. But when a narcotics wrapped up guy goes in and murders a police officer, I think they ought to pay with their life. And I do believe it would be inhibiting.
snippet_sentences: ['And so I am not going to furlough men like Willie Horton, and I would meet with their, the victims of his last escapade, the rape and the brutalization of the family down there in Maryland.']
snippet: And so I am not going to furlough men like Willie Horton, and I would meet with their, the victims of his last escapade, the rape and the brutalization of the family down there in Maryland.

dialogue_sentences: ["It's one of the reasons why we have a drug education and prevention program that is reaching out and helping youngsters all over our state, the kind of thing I want to do as president of the United States.", 'You know, the vice president says he wants to impose the death penalty on drug traffickers, and yet his administration has a federal furlough program which is one of the most permissive in the country, which gave last year 7,000 furloughs to drug traffickers and drug pushers, the same people that he says he now wants to execute.', 'The issue of abortion is a very difficult issue, one that I think that we all have to wrestle with, we have to come to terms with.']
dialogue: It's one of the reasons why we have a drug education and prevention program that is reaching out and helping youngsters all over our state, the kind of thing I want to do as president of the United States. You know, the vice president says he wants to impose the death penalty on drug traffickers, and yet his administration has a federal furlough program which is one of the most permissive in the country, which gave last year 7,000 furloughs to drug traffickers and drug pushers, the same people that he says he now wants to execute. The issue of abortion is a very difficult issue, one that I think that we all have to wrestle with, we have to come to terms with.
snippet_sentences: ["I don't favor abortion.", "I don't think it's a good thing.", "I don't think most people do."]
snippet: I don't favor abortion. I don't think it's a good thing. I don't think most people do.

dialogue_sentences: ['But when a narcotics wrapped up guy goes in and murders a police officer, I think they ought to pay with their life.', 'And I do believe it would be inhibiting.', 'And so I am not going to furlough men like Willie Horton, and I would meet with their, the victims of his last escapade, the rape and the brutalization of the family down there in Maryland.']
dialogue: But when a narcotics wrapped up guy goes in and murders a police officer, I think they ought to pay with their life. And I do believe it would be inhibiting. And so I am not going to furlough men like Willie Horton, and I would meet with their, the victims of his last escapade, the rape and the brutalization of the family down there in Maryland.
snippet_sentences: ["Maryland would not extradite Willie Horton, the man who was furloughed, the murderer, because they didn't want him to be furloughed again."]
snippet: Maryland would not extradite Willie Horton, the man who was furloughed, the murderer, because they didn't want him to be furloughed again.

dialogue_sentences: ["And that's one of the reasons why my state has cut crime by more than any other industrial state in America.", "It's one of the reasons why we have the lowest murder rate of any industrial state in the country.", "It's one of the reasons why we have a drug education and prevention program that is reaching out and helping youngsters all over our state, the kind of thing I want to do as president of the United States."]
dialogue: And that's one of the reasons why my state has cut crime by more than any other industrial state in America. It's one of the reasons why we have the lowest murder rate of any industrial state in the country. It's one of the reasons why we have a drug education and prevention program that is reaching out and helping youngsters all over our state, the kind of thing I want to do as president of the United States.
snippet_sentences: ['You know, the vice president says he wants to impose the death penalty on drug traffickers, and yet his administration has a federal furlough program which is one of the most permissive in the country, which gave last year 7,000 furloughs to drug traffickers and drug pushers, the same people that he says he now wants to execute.']
snippet: You know, the vice president says he wants to impose the death penalty on drug traffickers, and yet his administration has a federal furlough program which is one of the most permissive in the country, which gave last year 7,000 furloughs to drug traffickers and drug pushers, the same people that he says he now wants to execute.

dialogue_sentences: ["I'm for Head Start and moving that up.", 'But I favor that.', "So these are the combination of things I want, and the fact that I don't think the federal government can endorse a $35 billion program does not mean I have less compassion than the person who endorses such a program."]
dialogue: I'm for Head Start and moving that up. But I favor that. So these are the combination of things I want, and the fact that I don't think the federal government can endorse a $35 billion program does not mean I have less compassion than the person who endorses such a program.
snippet_sentences: ["Well, I must have been living through a different eight years then the ones the vice president's been living through, because this administration has cut and slashed and cut and slashed programs for children, for nutrition, for the kinds of things that can help these youngsters to live better lives."]
snippet: Well, I must have been living through a different eight years then the ones the vice president's been living through, because this administration has cut and slashed and cut and slashed programs for children, for nutrition, for the kinds of things that can help these youngsters to live better lives.

dialogue_sentences: ['Let me just give you one other example.', 'We have a great many people, hundreds of thousands of people living on public assistance in this country.', 'The 50 governors of this nation have proposed to the Congress that we help those families to get off of welfare, help those youngsters, help their mothers to become independent and self-sufficient.']
dialogue: Let me just give you one other example. We have a great many people, hundreds of thousands of people living on public assistance in this country. The 50 governors of this nation have proposed to the Congress that we help those families to get off of welfare, help those youngsters, help their mothers to become independent and self-sufficient.
snippet_sentences: ["It's taken months and months and months to get Mr. Bush and the administration to support that legislation, and they're still resisting."]
snippet: It's taken months and months and months to get Mr. Bush and the administration to support that legislation, and they're still resisting.

dialogue_sentences: ["Being haunted, a thousand points of light - I don't know what that means.", 'I know what strong political leadership is.', "I know what's happened over the course of the past eight years."]
dialogue: Being haunted, a thousand points of light - I don't know what that means. I know what strong political leadership is. I know what's happened over the course of the past eight years.
snippet_sentences: ["These programs have been cut and slashed and butchered, and they've hurt kids all over this country."]
snippet: These programs have been cut and slashed and butchered, and they've hurt kids all over this country.

dialogue_sentences: ["That's just one example of how you can save money and improve the quality of life at the same time.", 'In my own state, for example, we now have that universal health care system, which the vice president opposes, I think very unwisely.', 'One of the greatest barriers to opportunity for a family and for those children is the threat that they mat lose their health insurance.']
dialogue: That's just one example of how you can save money and improve the quality of life at the same time. In my own state, for example, we now have that universal health care system, which the vice president opposes, I think very unwisely. One of the greatest barriers to opportunity for a family and for those children is the threat that they mat lose their health insurance.
snippet_sentences: ["Think about that father down there in Houston who has to tell his youngster that he can't play little league ball that he can't go out on the ball field because he's afraid he's going to get hurt."]
snippet: Think about that father down there in Houston who has to tell his youngster that he can't play little league ball that he can't go out on the ball field because he's afraid he's going to get hurt.

dialogue_sentences: ["Think about that father down there in Houston who has to tell his youngster that he can't play little league ball that he can't go out on the ball field because he's afraid he's going to get hurt.", "And yet, Mr. Bush says well, I don't think we ought to expect business to provide health insurance for their employees, when responsible employers, a majority of employers in this country do and are paying more for their insurance to reimburse hospitals for free care on account of people that are not insured, that have to go to that hospital.", 'So these are the ways that you help families, you help youngsters to live better lives, and more decent lives.']
dialogue: Think about that father down there in Houston who has to tell his youngster that he can't play little league ball that he can't go out on the ball field because he's afraid he's going to get hurt. And yet, Mr. Bush says well, I don't think we ought to expect business to provide health insurance for their employees, when responsible employers, a majority of employers in this country do and are paying more for their insurance to reimburse hospitals for free care on account of people that are not insured, that have to go to that hospital. So these are the ways that you help families, you help youngsters to live better lives, and more decent lives.
snippet_sentences: ['Were ready to go to work at the state and local level, all of us.', 'I know the private sector is.', 'People are all over the country.']
snippet: Were ready to go to work at the state and local level, all of us. I know the private sector is. People are all over the country.

dialogue_sentences: ["I think part of the answer to this haunting of these children that are out there and suffering lies in extension of Medicaid, to challenge the states, and maybe we're going to have to enforce more on the states in terms of Medicaid taking care of these.", 'But, Peter, so much of it is, gets into a whole other phase of things.', "The neighborhood, the kind of environment people are growing up in, and that leads me to the programs I'm talking about in terms of education."]
dialogue: I think part of the answer to this haunting of these children that are out there and suffering lies in extension of Medicaid, to challenge the states, and maybe we're going to have to enforce more on the states in terms of Medicaid taking care of these. But, Peter, so much of it is, gets into a whole other phase of things. The neighborhood, the kind of environment people are growing up in, and that leads me to the programs I'm talking about in terms of education.
snippet_sentences: ["I think that part of it is the crime infested neighborhoods, and that's why I'm a strong believer in trying to control crimes in the neighborhood, why I was so pleased to be endorsed by the policemen on the beat, the Boston Police Department the other day."]
snippet: I think that part of it is the crime infested neighborhoods, and that's why I'm a strong believer in trying to control crimes in the neighborhood, why I was so pleased to be endorsed by the policemen on the beat, the Boston Police Department the other day.

dialogue_sentences: ['It takes a commitment to being involved and the leading.', "And that's the kind of presidency I want to lead.", "What troubles me is that when I talk of the voluntary sector and a thousand points of light and a thousand different ways to help on these problems, the man has just said he doesn't understand what I'm talking about."]
dialogue: It takes a commitment to being involved and the leading. And that's the kind of presidency I want to lead. What troubles me is that when I talk of the voluntary sector and a thousand points of light and a thousand different ways to help on these problems, the man has just said he doesn't understand what I'm talking about.
snippet_sentences: ['This is the problem I have with the big spending liberals.']
snippet: This is the problem I have with the big spending liberals.

dialogue_sentences: ['Minuteman III, penetration systems.', "I mean, there's plenty of them that I oppose, but what I am not going to do, when we are negotiating with the Soviet Union, sitting down talking to Mr. Gorbachev about how we achieve a 50 percent reduction in our strategic weapons, I'm not going to give away a couple of aces I that very tough card game.", "I'm simply not going to do that."]
dialogue: Minuteman III, penetration systems. I mean, there's plenty of them that I oppose, but what I am not going to do, when we are negotiating with the Soviet Union, sitting down talking to Mr. Gorbachev about how we achieve a 50 percent reduction in our strategic weapons, I'm not going to give away a couple of aces I that very tough card game. I'm simply not going to do that.
snippet_sentences: ["We're going to have to-the MX.", "We're going to have to do that.", "It's Christmas."]
snippet: We're going to have to-the MX. We're going to have to do that. It's Christmas.

dialogue_sentences: ['Of course not.', "Of course that's a charge that's always made against any governor who runs for the presidency."]
dialogue: Of course not. Of course that's a charge that's always made against any governor who runs for the presidency.
snippet_sentences: ['I think it was one of the things that Mr. Bush said about Mr. Reagan back in 1980.']
snippet: I think it was one of the things that Mr. Bush said about Mr. Reagan back in 1980.

dialogue_sentences: ["We've piled up over a trillion dollars in debt and the next president of the United States is going to have to make some choices.", 'Mr. Bush wants to spend billions on Star Wars.', "He apparently wants to spend billions on the MX on railroad cars, a weapons system we don't need and can't afford."]
dialogue: We've piled up over a trillion dollars in debt and the next president of the United States is going to have to make some choices. Mr. Bush wants to spend billions on Star Wars. He apparently wants to spend billions on the MX on railroad cars, a weapons system we don't need and can't afford.
snippet_sentences: ['I thought the administration was opposed to the Midgetman.', 'I thought the administration was at the negotiating table in Geneva suggesting that we ban mobile missile systems entirely.']
snippet: I thought the administration was opposed to the Midgetman. I thought the administration was at the negotiating table in Geneva suggesting that we ban mobile missile systems entirely.

dialogue_sentences: ['It was a very different George Bush who was talking much more sympathetically about the freeze in the spring of 1982 than he is today.', 'And you were right then, George, when you said it was no time for partisan demagoguery.', 'Nobody is suggesting that we unilaterally disarm or somehow reduce our strength, of course not.']
dialogue: It was a very different George Bush who was talking much more sympathetically about the freeze in the spring of 1982 than he is today. And you were right then, George, when you said it was no time for partisan demagoguery. Nobody is suggesting that we unilaterally disarm or somehow reduce our strength, of course not.
snippet_sentences: ["What we're talking about is a combination of a strong and effective and credible nuclear deterrent.", 'Strong, well-equipped, well-trained, well-maintained conventional forces.', 'And at the same time a willingness to move forward steadily, thoughtfully cautiously.']
snippet: What we're talking about is a combination of a strong and effective and credible nuclear deterrent. Strong, well-equipped, well-trained, well-maintained conventional forces. And at the same time a willingness to move forward steadily, thoughtfully cautiously.

dialogue_sentences: ['Mr. Bush and Mr. Quayle do not.', 'And we want to pursue that plan in a way which will bring down the level of nuclear armament, will build a more stable and more peaceful world while making choices here at home.', "Let's not forget that our national security and our economic security go hand in hand."]
dialogue: Mr. Bush and Mr. Quayle do not. And we want to pursue that plan in a way which will bring down the level of nuclear armament, will build a more stable and more peaceful world while making choices here at home. Let's not forget that our national security and our economic security go hand in hand.
snippet_sentences: ["We cannot be strong militarily when we're teeter-tottering on top of a mountain of debt which has been created in the past eight years."]
snippet: We cannot be strong militarily when we're teeter-tottering on top of a mountain of debt which has been created in the past eight years.

dialogue_sentences: ['You have to make choices.', "We're not making those choices.", 'And to spend billions and billions of dollars as Mr. Bush apparently wants to, although, he, himself has been all over the lot on this issue lately-on Star Wars-in my judgment makes no sense at all.']
dialogue: You have to make choices. We're not making those choices. And to spend billions and billions of dollars as Mr. Bush apparently wants to, although, he, himself has been all over the lot on this issue lately-on Star Wars-in my judgment makes no sense at all.
snippet_sentences: ['We need a strong, credible, effective nuclear deterrent.']
snippet: We need a strong, credible, effective nuclear deterrent.

dialogue_sentences: ["We know where you're cutting right now.", "You're cutting into the fiber and muscle of our conventional forces.", "You're cutting back on maintenance and equipment."]
dialogue: We know where you're cutting right now. You're cutting into the fiber and muscle of our conventional forces. You're cutting back on maintenance and equipment.
snippet_sentences: ["An Air Force General not too long ago in Europe who said that pretty soon we'd have airplanes without engines, tank commanders who can't drive their tanks more than three-quarters of a mile, because they don't have enough fuel.", 'Coast Guard cutters tied up at the dock this summer, not patrolling.']
snippet: An Air Force General not too long ago in Europe who said that pretty soon we'd have airplanes without engines, tank commanders who can't drive their tanks more than three-quarters of a mile, because they don't have enough fuel. Coast Guard cutters tied up at the dock this summer, not patrolling.

dialogue_sentences: ['Those are two hypo-rhetorical questions.', 'He is the man on conventional forces that wants to eliminate two carrier battle groups.', 'The armed forces, the conventional forces of the United States have never been more ready.']
dialogue: Those are two hypo-rhetorical questions. He is the man on conventional forces that wants to eliminate two carrier battle groups. The armed forces, the conventional forces of the United States have never been more ready.
snippet_sentences: ['Every single one of the Joint Chiefs will testify to the fact that readiness is in an historic high.']
snippet: Every single one of the Joint Chiefs will testify to the fact that readiness is in an historic high.

dialogue_sentences: ["Today is my granddaughter's second birthday, so I think about this a lot.", 'First, we have to build an economy that works for everyone, not just those at the top.', 'That means we need new jobs, good jobs, with rising incomes.']
dialogue: Today is my granddaughter's second birthday, so I think about this a lot. First, we have to build an economy that works for everyone, not just those at the top. That means we need new jobs, good jobs, with rising incomes.
snippet_sentences: ['I want us to invest in you.', 'I want us to invest in your future.']
snippet: I want us to invest in you. I want us to invest in your future.

dialogue_sentences: ['We cannot let it happen.', "Under my plan, I'll be reducing taxes tremendously, from 35 percent to 15 percent for companies, small and big businesses.", "That's going to be a job creator like we haven't seen since Ronald Reagan."]
dialogue: We cannot let it happen. Under my plan, I'll be reducing taxes tremendously, from 35 percent to 15 percent for companies, small and big businesses. That's going to be a job creator like we haven't seen since Ronald Reagan.
snippet_sentences: ["It's going to be a beautiful thing to watch."]
snippet: It's going to be a beautiful thing to watch.

dialogue_sentences: ['We also, though, need to have a tax system that rewards work and not just financial transactions.', 'And the kind of plan that Donald has put forth would be trickle-down economics all over again.', "In fact, it would be the most extreme version, the biggest tax cuts for the top percent of the people in this country than we've ever had."]
dialogue: We also, though, need to have a tax system that rewards work and not just financial transactions. And the kind of plan that Donald has put forth would be trickle-down economics all over again. In fact, it would be the most extreme version, the biggest tax cuts for the top percent of the people in this country than we've ever had.
snippet_sentences: ["I call it trumped-up trickle-down, because that's exactly what it would be."]
snippet: I call it trumped-up trickle-down, because that's exactly what it would be.

dialogue_sentences: ["She's telling us how to fight ISIS.", 'Just go to her website.', 'She tells you how to fight ISIS on her website.']
dialogue: She's telling us how to fight ISIS. Just go to her website. She tells you how to fight ISIS on her website.
snippet_sentences: ["I don't think General Douglas MacArthur would like that too much."]
snippet: I don't think General Douglas MacArthur would like that too much.

dialogue_sentences: ["We just have a different view about what's best for growing the economy, how we make investments that will actually produce jobs and rising incomes.", 'I think we come at it from somewhat different perspectives.', 'I understand that.']
dialogue: We just have a different view about what's best for growing the economy, how we make investments that will actually produce jobs and rising incomes. I think we come at it from somewhat different perspectives. I understand that.
snippet_sentences: ["You know, Donald was very fortunate in his life, and that's all to his benefit.", "He started his business with $14 million, borrowed from his father, and he really believes that the more you help wealthy people, the better off we'll be and that everything will work out from there.", "I don't buy that."]
snippet: You know, Donald was very fortunate in his life, and that's all to his benefit. He started his business with $14 million, borrowed from his father, and he really believes that the more you help wealthy people, the better off we'll be and that everything will work out from there. I don't buy that.

dialogue_sentences: ['I also want to see more companies do profit-sharing.', 'If you help create the profits, you should be able to share in them, not just the executives at the top.', 'And I want us to do more to support people who are struggling to balance family and work.']
dialogue: I also want to see more companies do profit-sharing. If you help create the profits, you should be able to share in them, not just the executives at the top. And I want us to do more to support people who are struggling to balance family and work.
snippet_sentences: ["I've heard from so many of you about the difficult choices you face and the stresses that you're under."]
snippet: I've heard from so many of you about the difficult choices you face and the stresses that you're under.

dialogue_sentences: ['He printed drapery fabrics on long tables, where he pulled out those fabrics and he went down with a silkscreen and dumped the paint in and took the squeegee and kept going.', "And so what I believe is the more we can do for the middle class, the more we can invest in you, your education, your skills, your future, the better we will be off and the better we'll grow.", "That's the kind of economy I want us to see again."]
dialogue: He printed drapery fabrics on long tables, where he pulled out those fabrics and he went down with a silkscreen and dumped the paint in and took the squeegee and kept going. And so what I believe is the more we can do for the middle class, the more we can invest in you, your education, your skills, your future, the better we will be off and the better we'll grow. That's the kind of economy I want us to see again.
snippet_sentences: ["Well, for one thing—and before we start on that—my father gave me a very small loan in 1975, and I built it into a company that's worth many, many billions of dollars, with some of the greatest assets in the world, and I say that only because that's the kind of thinking that our country needs.", "Our country's in deep trouble."]
snippet: Well, for one thing—and before we start on that—my father gave me a very small loan in 1975, and I built it into a company that's worth many, many billions of dollars, with some of the greatest assets in the world, and I say that only because that's the kind of thinking that our country needs. Our country's in deep trouble.

dialogue_sentences: ["Our country's in deep trouble.", "We don't know what we're doing when it comes to devaluations and all of these countries all over the world, especially China.", "They're the best, the best ever at it."]
dialogue: Our country's in deep trouble. We don't know what we're doing when it comes to devaluations and all of these countries all over the world, especially China. They're the best, the best ever at it.
snippet_sentences: ["What they're doing to us is a very, very sad thing.", 'So we have to do that.']
snippet: What they're doing to us is a very, very sad thing. So we have to do that.

dialogue_sentences: ["She's been doing this for 30 years.", "And why hasn't she made the agreements better?", 'The NAFTA agreement is defective.']
dialogue: She's been doing this for 30 years. And why hasn't she made the agreements better? The NAFTA agreement is defective.

snippet: They should have been doing this for years.

snippet: That means we need new jobs, good jobs, with rising incomes. I want us to invest in you.

dialogue_sentences: ["Our country is suffering because people like Secretary Clinton have made such bad decisions in terms of our jobs and in terms of what's going on.", 'Now, look, we have the worst revival of an economy since the Great Depression.', "And believe me: We're in a bubble right now."]

dialogue: It shows income—in fact, the income—I just looked today—the income is filed at $694 million for this past year, $694 million. If you would have told me I was going to make that 15 or 20 years ago, I would have been very surprised. But that's the kind of thinking that our country needs.

snippet: When we have a country that's doing so badly, that's being ripped off by every single country in the world, it's the kind of thinking that our country needs, because everybody—Lester, we have a trade deficit with all of the countries that we do business with, of almost $800 billion a year.

dialogue_sentences: ['I happen to—I happen to support that in a way that will actually work to our benefit.', 'But when I look at what you have proposed, you have what is called now the Trump loophole, because it would so advantage you and the business you do.', 'Trickle-down did not work.']
dialogue: I happen to—I happen to support that in a way that will actually work to our benefit. But when I look at what you have proposed, you have what is called now the Trump loophole, because it would so advantage you and the business you do. Trickle-down did not work.

dialogue_sentences: ["And we don't have the money, because it's been squandered on so many of your ideas.", "And maybe because you haven't paid any federal income tax for a lot of years.", 'You know, your campaign manager said that you built a lot of businesses on the backs of little guys.']
dialogue: And we don't have the money, because it's been squandered on so many of your ideas. And maybe because you haven't paid any federal income tax for a lot of years. You know, your campaign manager said that you built a lot of businesses on the backs of little guys.

snippet: And, indeed, I have met a lot of the people who were stiffed by you and your businesses, Donald. I've met dishwashers, painters, architects, glass installers, marble installers, drapery installers, like my dad was, who you refused to pay when they finished the work that you asked them to do. We have an architect in the audience who designed one of your clubhouses at one of your golf courses.

dialogue_sentences: ['I think building the middle class, investing in the middle class, making college debt-free so more young people can get their education, helping people refinance their—their debt from college at a lower rate.', 'Those are the kinds of things that will really boost the economy.', 'Broad-based, inclusive growth is what we need in America, not more advantages for people at the very top.']

Those are the kinds of things that will really boost the economy. Broad-based, inclusive growth is what we need in America, not more advantages for people at the very top.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, first of all, Secretary Clinton doesn't want to use a couple of words, and that's law and order.", 'And we need law and order.', "If we don't have it, we're not going to have a country."]

snippet: And when I look at what's going on in Charlotte, a city I love, a city where I have investments, when I look at what's going on throughout various parts of our country, whether it's—I mean, I can just keep naming them all day long—we need law and order in our country.

dialogue_sentences: ['There was absolutely no evidence for it, but he persisted, he persisted year after year, because some of his supporters, people that he was trying to bring into his fold, apparently believed it or wanted to believe it.', 'But, remember, Donald started his career back in 1973 being sued by the Justice Department for racial discrimination because he would not rent apartments in one of his developments to African-Americans, and he made sure that the people who worked for him understood that was the policy.', 'He actually was sued twice by the Justice Department.']
dialogue: There was absolutely no evidence for it, but he persisted, he persisted year after year, because some of his supporters, people that he was trying to bring into his fold, apparently believed it or wanted to believe it. But, remember, Donald started his career back in 1973 being sued by the Justice Department for racial discrimination because he would not rent apartments in one of his developments to African-Americans, and he made sure that the people who worked for him understood that was the policy. He actually was sued twice by the Justice Department.
snippet_sentences: ['So he has a long record of engaging in racist behavior.']
snippet: So he has a long record of engaging in racist behavior.

dialogue_sentences: ["But they wouldn't have even been formed if they left some troops behind, like 10,000 or maybe something more than that.", "And then you wouldn't have had them.", "Or, as I've been saying for a long time, and I think you'll agree, because I said it to you once, had we taken the oil—and we should have taken the oil—ISIS would not have been able to form either, because the oil was their primary source of income."]

dialogue_sentences: ['But two things.', "Number one, the 28 countries of NATO, many of them aren't paying their fair share.", "Number two—and that bothers me, because we should be asking—we're defending them, and they should at least be paying us what they're supposed to be paying by treaty and contract."]

snippet: And, number two, I said, and very strongly, NATO could be obsolete, because—and I was very strong on this, and it was actually covered very accurately in the New York Times, which is unusual for the New York Times, to be honest—but I said, they do not focus on terror.

dialogue_sentences: ["And I know Donald's trying very hard to plant doubts about it, but I hope the people out there understand: This election's really up to you.", "It's not about us so much as it is about you and your families and the kind of country and future you want.", 'So I sure hope you will get out and vote as though your future depended on it, because I think it does.']
dialogue: And I know Donald's trying very hard to plant doubts about it, but I hope the people out there understand: This election's really up to you. It's not about us so much as it is about you and your families and the kind of country and future you want. So I sure hope you will get out and vote as though your future depended on it, because I think it does.
snippet_sentences: ['I want to make America great again.']
snippet: I want to make America great again.

dialogue_sentences: ["Yes, I think that that's a very good question, because I've heard from lots of teachers and parents about some of their concerns about some of the things that are being said and done in this campaign.", 'Well, I actually agree with that.', 'I agree with everything she said.']

snippet_sentences: ['I began this campaign because I was so tired of seeing such foolish things happen to our country.']
snippet: I began this campaign because I was so tired of seeing such foolish things happen to our country.

dialogue_sentences: ["I've gotten to know the people of the country over the last year-and-a-half that I've been doing this as a politician.", "I cannot believe I'm saying that about myself, but I guess I have been a politician.", 'And my whole concept was to make America great again.']
dialogue: I've gotten to know the people of the country over the last year-and-a-half that I've been doing this as a politician. I cannot believe I'm saying that about myself, but I guess I have been a politician. And my whole concept was to make America great again.
snippet_sentences: ["When I watch the deals being made, when I watch what's happening with some horrible things like Obamacare, where your health insurance and health care is going up by numbers that are astronomical, 68 percent, 59 percent, 71 percent, when I look at the Iran deal and how bad a deal it is for us, it's a one-sided transaction where we're giving back $150 billion to a terrorist state, really, the number one terror state, we've made them a strong country from really a very weak country just three years ago."]
snippet: When I watch the deals being made, when I watch what's happening with some horrible things like Obamacare, where your health insurance and health care is going up by numbers that are astronomical, 68 percent, 59 percent, 71 percent, when I look at the Iran deal and how bad a deal it is for us, it's a one-sided transaction where we're giving back $150 billion to a terrorist state, really, the number one terror state, we've made them a strong country from really a very weak country just three years ago.

dialogue_sentences: ["And that's what I want to talk about.", "Well, like everyone else, I've spent a lot of time thinking over the last 48 hours about what we heard and saw.", 'You know, with prior Republican nominees for president, I disagreed with them on politics, policies, principles, but I never questioned their fitness to serve.']
dialogue: And that's what I want to talk about. Well, like everyone else, I've spent a lot of time thinking over the last 48 hours about what we heard and saw. You know, with prior Republican nominees for president, I disagreed with them on politics, policies, principles, but I never questioned their fitness to serve.
snippet_sentences: ['These are very important values to me, because this is the America that I know and love.']
snippet: These are very important values to me, because this is the America that I know and love.

dialogue_sentences: ['These are very important values to me, because this is the America that I know and love.', "And I can pledge to you tonight that this is the America that I will serve if I'm so fortunate enough to become your president.", 'I assume I am.']
dialogue: These are very important values to me, because this is the America that I know and love. And I can pledge to you tonight that this is the America that I will serve if I'm so fortunate enough to become your president. I assume I am.
snippet_sentences: ["It's just words, folks.", "It's just words."]
snippet: It's just words, folks. It's just words.

dialogue_sentences: ["Well, first, let me start by saying that so much of what he's just said is not right, but he gets to run his campaign any way he chooses.", 'He gets to decide what he wants to talk about.', "Instead of answering people's questions, talking about our agenda, laying out the plans that we have that we think can make a better life and a better country, that's his choice."]
dialogue: Well, first, let me start by saying that so much of what he's just said is not right, but he gets to run his campaign any way he chooses. He gets to decide what he wants to talk about. Instead of answering people's questions, talking about our agenda, laying out the plans that we have that we think can make a better life and a better country, that's his choice.
snippet_sentences: ['When I hear something like that, I am reminded of what my friend, Michelle Obama, advised us all: When they go low, you go high.']
snippet: When I hear something like that, I am reminded of what my friend, Michelle Obama, advised us all: When they go low, you go high.

dialogue_sentences: ["Instead of answering people's questions, talking about our agenda, laying out the plans that we have that we think can make a better life and a better country, that's his choice.", 'When I hear something like that, I am reminded of what my friend, Michelle Obama, advised us all: When they go low, you go high.', 'He never apologized to Mr. and Mrs. Khan, the Gold Star family whose son, Captain Khan, died in the line of duty in Iraq.']
dialogue: Instead of answering people's questions, talking about our agenda, laying out the plans that we have that we think can make a better life and a better country, that's his choice. When I hear something like that, I am reminded of what my friend, Michelle Obama, advised us all: When they go low, you go high. He never apologized to Mr. and Mrs. Khan, the Gold Star family whose son, Captain Khan, died in the line of duty in Iraq.

dialogue_sentences: ['Our nation has gone through a very challenging time this year.', 'Before there were more than five cases in the United States, all people who had returned from China, President Donald Trump did what no other American president had ever done.', 'And that was he suspended all travel from China, the second largest economy in the world.']
dialogue: Our nation has gone through a very challenging time this year. Before there were more than five cases in the United States, all people who had returned from China, President Donald Trump did what no other American president had ever done. And that was he suspended all travel from China, the second largest economy in the world.

dialogue_sentences: ['We have five companies in phase three clinical trials.', 'So, the fact that you continue to undermine public confidence in a vaccine if the vaccine emerges during the Trump administration, I think is unconscionable.', 'The reality is that we will have a vaccine, we believe, before the end of this year, and it will have the capacity to save countless American lives.']
dialogue: We have five companies in phase three clinical trials. So, the fact that you continue to undermine public confidence in a vaccine if the vaccine emerges during the Trump administration, I think is unconscionable. dialogue_sentences: ["Well, I'll tell you what, I hope he does look at me because what's happening here is you know who I am, you know who he is, you know his character, you know my character, you know our reputations for honor and telling the truth.", 'I am anxious to have this race.', "I'm anxious to see this take place."]
